course.subject: COMP
course.name: Introduction to Computing with Java
course.description: This course is designed to equip students with the fundamental concepts of programming elements and data abstraction using Java. Students will learn how to write procedural programs using variables, arrays, control statements, loops, recursion, data abstraction and objects using an integrated development environment.
course.exclusions: COMP 1021, COMP 1022Q (prior to 2020-21), COMP 2011, COMP 2012H, ISOM 3320

reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload

There are no attendance on the lectures.

Every labs have to be attended in order to get lab marks.
The labs are super easy, that you can finish them within 15 minutes.

Programming assignment requires you to complete a little program on greenfoot.
My programming assignment is to complete a mastermind game on greenfoot. I spent one afternoon to complete both part 1 and 2. Full mark is easy to get if you follow its instructions.

reviews.author: Lkjhgfdsa
reviews.title: Don’t even think of taking this course if you aren’t already familiar with programming.
reviews.comment_content:
I know this is a beginner’s course, but it fails to teach some of the very important basic programming concepts, for instance,

pass by value and pass by reference (I know, theoretically there is only so-called ‘pass by value’ in Java, but still, you can pass a reference of an object/array (or any other reference types), which I believe should be regarded as pass by reference).

What’s worse is that they will ask you questions related to this concept, i.e., what happens when you pass a variable to a function/method v.s. what happens if a reference of an array is passed.

The above concept is not clearly explained in lecture notes on which, they say, the exams are based.

Apart from that, the difference between objects and reference isn’t well-explained in the lecture notes too (though I don’t know if the professor did a good job in explaining it, since I didn’t attend most lectures). This concept is again tested in the final exam.

What I am trying to say is, there is nothing introductory about the course. The content may be friendly to beginners, but the exams aren’t as they test knowledge not included in the notes. For this reason, I can’t give a good grade to this course. If you have programming experience, the course perhaps gives you the opportunity to explore the Java language, but if you don’t, just take the python course.

They did recommend a textbook for reference, which can be handy if you knew some programming basics.

The title is “introduction to java programming comprehensive version 10th edition”, just google it, the first result should be the PDF file.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Didn’t attend the lectures, so I don’t know. The lecture notes are succinct, but you won’t get good grades if you just read them. You’ll need practice and a little bit of exploration because the notes won’t teach you everything, just as I said from the ‘Content’ part of the review. Also, do all the past papers so that you’ll have a better understanding of how the TAs will troll you with their trick questions.

By the way, this course uses Greenfoot and the Eclipse IDE.

Here is the link to the lecture notes and some of the past papers: https://bit.ly/2QkaSJr
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%)

Written assignments (5%)

Programming assignments (20%)

Midterm examination (25%) (closed notes, around 20 MC and 4 long questions)

Mean=83 SD=13.2

The MCs are all about trick questions. They like to test subtle concepts such as post-increment, pre-increment, pass by value, dangling else problems, etc. The long questions are just like any programming exercises you can find on the Internet/ from textbooks.

Final exam (40%) (online, all MCs)

Mean=88 SD=13.8

Not as tricky as mid-term. But recursion questions can take a long time to finish. The most difficult should be one where you have to rewrite a nested loop into a non-nested loop (not tested in the last exam, but it was in the mock and in previous exams).

As you can see the means for both exams are ridiculously high. So you can expect a very harsh grading system.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not very heavy if you have already learnt programming. The written assignment may take around an hour to finish. Make sure you try to run your code with your compiler so that you can get correct answers.

The programming assignments are also easy. One thing to note is that you need to read the instructions very clearly. If your product differs slightly from the specifications, you lose marks. Maybe try to design some test cases to make sure your program is bug-free.

reviews.author: 排骨
reviews.title: God Bless Desmond's Soul
reviews.comment_content: Basic Java knowledge, ranging from simple variable declaration to more complicated concepts such as recursion (the root of all evil in this course). Each topic is covered in adequate length, with pretty much all essentials. As long as you pay attention during the lectures, and skim through notes before exams, you'll most likely do well.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond is a god.
Desmond is a god.
Desmond is a god.

Join our worship of Desmond at http://desmondfans.club/

This guy is a legend. He actually knows how to teach - all lectures are covered with just the right amount of information, and they are always presented in a way that is easy to digest. He also has pretty decent spoken English and Mandarin, and repeats things in lectures in 3 languages (Cantonese, English and Mandarin) to make sure everyone gets what he is talking about. Good notes are also provided, and an extraordinary amount of support is given for students struggling in assignments or general lecture material.

tl;dr: Desmond is a good guy
reviews.comment_grading:
~25% A range for Desmond. Need I say more?
The exams are somewhat difficult, where the mean is usually around 50-60%. However as long as you bring in notes (allowed) into exams, and go through the material prior to walking in the exam venue, you'll most likely do well.

Note: Pay particular attention to recursion in your finals
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Lab per week, which can usually be done within 15 mins, and you can do it before the lab session. No big deal here.

2 Assignments total, and they're pretty hefty. They usually require a lot of thinking, a lot of asking around (be careful for accusations of plagarism when asking your peers), and also occasional visits to Desmond's office (often packed). But Desmond does give enough time for you to complete them, so not much problem here.

reviews.author: Seagur
reviews.title: A course requires hard work & self study
reviews.comment_content:
Before the midterm exam, the content is mainly about object-oriented programming basics and data types in Java. The course and lecturers use GREENFOOT to teach this, thinking that its easier to understand the concept. However, it confused me more...

After the midterm exam, there's more content about coding like do, while, for loops and array. Out of class concepts were also included in final. Final's exam mode is similar to the midterm exam.

I feel quite rewarding after all as a beginner.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good lecturer that clear the content and concepts, also willing to answer student's questions. However midterm and final tested concepts that didn't taught in lectures. It's the course's but not the lecturers' problem. So you need hard work on self study and doing past papers in order to get good results IF YOU ARE A REAL BEGINNER.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 20%
Midterm 30%
Final 40%
Labs 10%

Discouraging grading that you can't get a range even if you get a total of 90%

The midterm exam is easy but include many concepts that weren't taught in ppt and lectures. So programming beginner like me need to make every endeavor on self-study.
If you know the concepts and finish the past papers, the exam is only testing your carefulness.

Before midterm labs were easy but after that they became difficult For BEGINNERS. So prepare them after midterm. You may also find some friends to reg this course or meet friends in this course to help you. There are many students who know java very well in this course. But they're also real beginners like me.

Assignment were required after midterm. It's easy but you need to be careful looking at the instructions.

My grades as a java beginner for reference
Assignment: full mark
Lab: full mark
Midterm: 94/100
Final: 81/100
Final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: Requires much self study to get good results IF YOU ARE A JAVA BEGINNER. Otherwise the course's workload is low that only preparing for midterm & final & assignment require time. I'm a beginner so workload is enormous but it's quite rewarding after all.

reviews.author: hhh
reviews.comment_content:
Frankly speaking, it is true that those who have programming background could handle this course easily and better... Since this course is famous for its bad grade, many students enrolled in this course are very good at programming. But if you don't have much solid background, you can also have a try. I don't have any background before, but finally I still get a :)
Here are the teaching content:
0~logistics
1~Intro to problem-solving and computer programming
2~Basic programming language elements
3~Java operations
4~Java checking and selection statements
5~Java looping statements
6~Java arrays
7~Java classes and objects
8~Java inheritance
9~Java static variables and methods
10~Java recursion
11~Java file I/O
12~Java Strings
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is a really good professor.  The speed of the class is rather slow and he will explain the material clearly. And if you have any questions, you can send him email. Most of the time he will reply quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
As we all know, Desmond is the only professor on 1022p who is willing to give good grade to most of the students, so the grading is quite lenient. 30% of us will get a range. However, I have to say that Desmond's exam is far more difficult that the other prof's.
The midterm is not so difficult, The mean is about 72. But for final, the mean is only 52 or so, because there are so many tricky questions which have not been covered in the lecture and lab. And Desmond will ask you to write the whole code for several questions, while other prof will only let you fill in the blank of the code:(
There are 2 grading schemes, so if you don't get a satisfied score in midterm, you still have the chance to make up for it in the final. Buuutt remember that the final is more difficult that midterm, so it is not good to take this scheme.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 2 assignments in total. To be honest, it is not so easy especially for the second assignment. But you will have plenty of time to prepare and you can also ask for some help from others. So finally, if you want a good grade, your assignment should be nearly full mark.

reviews.author: vmdang
reviews.comment_content:
A basic introduction to Java, with the most complex content covered being recursion. Overall, not very complex if you have prior programming knowledge but is still accessible if you do not. Just need to make sure to review classes and lecture notes before exams.

0~logistics
1~Intro to problem-solving and computer programming
2~Basic programming language elements
3~Java operations
4~Java checking and selection statements
5~Java looping statements
6~Java arrays
7~Java classes and objects
8~Java inheritance
9~Java static variables and methods
10~Java recursion
11~Java file I/O
12~Java Strings
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond.















(All jokes aside, Desmond is a very dedicated and enthusiastic professor, and he knows how to manage the content such that students can keep up. Very engaging classes, and if you ever send him an email you will definitely get a quick and detailed reply.)
reviews.comment_grading: If you are in Desmond's class, the grading will be very good. He is (compared to other professors) more lenient on grades. Keep in mind that his exams are more difficult (mean around 75%(?)), so do not beat yourself up over the grades if you think your score is low. There are two grading schemes, but I suggest taking the one with more weight on the midterm even if you don't do so well on it, because the final is definitely much much harder.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is manageable, with a small lab every week and two big assignments. You of course should try and go through the lecture notes after every class because there are details that you need to remember for exams, but you do not need to spend too much time on it. The assignments are not the easiest but you have plenty of time to work on them and there are always people you can find to get help.

reviews.author: Lewandowski
reviews.title: Don't take this course if you are a computer DUMMY!
reviews.comment_content: The course itself is quite interesting. For me as a computer dummy, I can easily understand and follow the course guides. However, when it comes to do the assignment, I find it extremely difficult to manage and need to spend a lot of time to solve it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred and all TAs are very helpful and always reachable. They can solve my problems easily and promptly.  It's just that I find it difficult to solve problems myself without their help.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not yet released. There are many computer experts in class. They can get full marks easily. Other than Labs, my assignment, mid-term and final are all below means. So I expext my grading won't be so good.
reviews.comment_workload: Although not much assignment, each one took me long time to finish.

reviews.author: alvone01
reviews.title: Good course, harsh grading
reviews.comment_content:
Course covers basic concepts of programming, ranging from data types, conditional statements, loops, to simple recursions, and a bit of Abstract Data Types such as Stacks and Queues. Like any other subject, most topics can be explored outside of class.

The first half of the semester covers concepts up to conditional statements, using Greenfoot as a main platform. The second half uses a bit of Greenfoot and Eclipse, covering the rest of concepts.

Lab assignments can be done before class and submitted during lab sessions. However, attendance is still required and graded.

It is a fairly good introduction course for people with no basics of programming, however a lot of experienced people are also enrolled here so beware.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Instructor embraces concepts fairly well, with good and clear explanation in every concept covered. You may even find the pace really slow for quick-learners. He often interacts with students, giving questions and also smiles a lot. He also has a lovely and distinguishable accent. :)

Overall, Wilfred was really, really nice. Some TAs seem scary but in fact they are also really nice and helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is pretty harsh as it is based on a curve grading scale and a lot experts with prior knowledge of Java were present.

Labs : 10%
Assignments : 20%
Midterm : 30%
Finals : 40%

For myself,

- Full marks on all labs and assignments.
- Midterm 100/100
- Finals 98/100

Final grade : A+

Midterms were relatively easy.

I know a friend who got B+ with a final score of 91.4, due to silly substring mistakes on finals.
Final exam is much tougher than midterms and previous past papers, with a lot of traps (especially on recursion part).

I also know a friend who got A with a final score of 95.3 (He is a genius olympics medalist).
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload was relatively light, with lab works possible to do directly on lab sessions. A lot of people did it prior to lab sessions to finish class early though.

There are 2 special homework assignments which take up quite a bit of the grade, 10% each. It is a Greenfoot-based project of a game (not from scratch, skeleton code provided). Basically it is one assignment, divided into two parts.

Most people got high marks here, so do it well and on-time.

reviews.author: YIN_Ame
reviews.title: Must take if it is Desmond
reviews.comment_content:
Java language for beginners. I admit that there are many experts in this beginner class, but it is not a big deal in Desmond's class. Quite easy to understand as topics are well- explained by Desmond.

Syllabus:
0~logistics
1~Intro to problem-solving and computer programming
2~Basic programming language elements
3~Java operations
4~Java checking and selection statements
5~Java looping statements
6~Java arrays
7~Java classes and objects
8~Java inheritance
9~Java static variables and methods
10~Java recursion
11~Java file I/O
12~Java Strings
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond is definitely the best teacher I have ever met in UST!

The atmosphere in the lectures was very good, with many interactions. The teaching style of Desmond is fun, he always says" Desmond is a good / bad guy" XD

while after class or in emails, he always answers students' questions until they solve their problem.

Desmond has made briefing sessions for both assignment and explained the instructions detailedly. When he knew many students got problems and questions on assignment 2, he even postponed the deadline of submission.

Desmond focuses more on logical thinking, knowledge understanding, application in exams and exercise, but not memorizing skills. Marks can be argued if the logic is correct but different from the model answer.
reviews.comment_grading:
According to Desmond,
30% of students will get an A range;
40% get a B range

there are 3 ways in midterm & final to calculate the grade,
1: midterm 30% + final 40%
2: miderm 0% + final 70%
3: ( midterm + final ) / 2
The method that calculates the highest possible mark will be selected.

Mine
Lab (10%): 10/10
Assignment 1(10%): 100
Assignment 2(10%): 95
Midterm: 73.5
Final: 74.5
Overall: 81.65
Grade: A-

very good grade
reviews.comment_workload:
10 labs (can skip 1 if others are full mark)
2 assignments (image processing)
1 midterm (can skip if all-in final)
1 final
some exercises (no mark is counted)

need more logical thinking rather than java knowledge in assignments, if you are not able to complete the compulsory part; you can do the bonus part to get marks.
1st assignment: ch 1 - 5
2nd assignment: mainly on ch 6 -12

reviews.author: mindywww
reviews.title: GOOD
reviews.comment_content: Basic fundamental concepts on Java programming. The syntax and a little about OOP.
reviews.comment_teaching: Best prof I've met in UST for now!! Very responsible and funny and explain the contents really clear & easy to understand. But sometimes the pace is too slow.
reviews.comment_grading: Final Exam is a bit hard.. But overall it's acceptable and Desmond says he gives around 30% A-range.
reviews.comment_workload: It's introduction course so it's not really hard. Only lab work every week and it can be finished within an hour or two. The two assignments are a bit hard but Desmond and the TAs will give a lot of instructions and help.

reviews.author: ZHUANG XIANG
reviews.comment_content: The content mainly follows the powerpoint but the information in it is much useful. If students follow the powerpoints well, they will have little difficulty understanding the language.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not so good English speaking but the teaching style is quite fun, with jokes sometimes.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading rule is quite strict and you will lose many scores if you don't review the past paper or assignment. Actually, the exam questions in recent years are similar and you will not feel strange with the paper when doing it if you have done the past paper.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite a little. But, do not remain the assignment not done at all until the last day, or you will have no time reviewing the mistakes in your coding or writing assignment

reviews.author: Rigbones
reviews.title: Very competitive course, but you learn a lot
reviews.comment_content:
IF DESMOND IS NOT THE INSTRUCTOR, THIS REVIEW MAY NOT BE APPLICABLE TO YOU

Course content covers basic programming from beginners level.  Even if you never had programming experience before, you will still be able to manage it.

If Desmond is the instructor, he will cover 2 more topics than other instructors, and the order of topics taught will be different.

Topic 1: Problem Solving and Introduction to Computer Programming
Topic 2: Basic Programming Language Elements
Topic 3: Java Operations
Topic 4: Checking and Selection Statements
Topic 5: Looping Statements
<Midterms>
Topic 6: Arrays
Topic 7: Classes and Objects
Topic 8: Inheritance
Topic 9: Static Variables and Methods
Topic 10: Recursion
Topic 11: File I/O
Topic 12: Strings
Topic 13: Abstract Data Types: Stack and Queue
reviews.comment_teaching:
IF DESMOND IS NOT THE INSTRUCTOR, THIS REVIEW MAY NOT BE APPLICABLE TO YOU

Desmond is really a great instructor.  If there was an A+ for teaching I would definitely give him an A+.  He is really passionate about teaching and he will absolutely make you love programming.  He teaches simple topics from scratch and every detail is well explained.  He is willing to stay after class for a long time to answer students questions,  I’ve heard he even sends emails to congratulate students who got A+, which shows how much he cares about his teaching.  Don’t get intimidated if you’ve never learnt programming before, if you put in work and attend lectures you can definitely get A-range.

That being said, I have to say that this course is not suitable for everyone.  If you’re taking this course just to fulfil science school requirements, or simply taking it as a common core, the competitiveness is insane.  There seems to be many QFIN students taking this course during spring term too, so they will absolutely kill the grades.  If this description sounds like you, then you may consider taking COMP 1021 instead.

However, if you’re really passionate about learning programming, or you’re not worried about pulling down your GPA slightly, or simply just want to experience Desmond’s superb teaching, then please take this course.  You’ll learn so much more and so much better than COMP 1021.  If you plan to study Computer Science in the future, taking this course will guarantee a much better foundation when taking future comp courses compared to your peers who studied COMP 1021.
reviews.comment_grading:
IF DESMOND IS NOT THE INSTRUCTOR, THIS REVIEW MAY NOT BE APPLICABLE TO YOU

Very competitive course (See teaching for more details).  Desmond promises a 28% A-range which may sound nice, but the fact is so many crazy guys take this course, so you’ll really have to work hard to squeeze yourself into the top 28%.  On the bright side, there is no limit to B range so if you’re happy with B-range then it’s ok.

Make sure you practice all past exam papers on the course website, and understand why the answer is such, if not you may be screwed.

Exams are of course cumulative.

Lab 10%
Assignments 30%
Midterm 20%
Finals 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
IF DESMOND IS NOT THE INSTRUCTOR, THIS REVIEW MAY NOT BE APPLICABLE TO YOU

Labs are light workload.
The 2 Assignments may look scary at first sight but in fact you only need to write a hundred to two hundred lines of code in total.  
Midterms and Exams are very hard so you need to prepare well for it in advance.  Read the textbook if you have extra time, you’ll pick up useful additional knowledge.

reviews.author: TomChow
reviews.comment_content:

Lecture 1 Intro to problem-solving and computer programming

reviews.comment_teaching: His lessons are mostly entertaining and he often interacts with students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 20%
Mid term 30%
Final 40%
Labs 10%

The exam is hell and only very few people can finish all the questions in the final. Grading would be horrible for people who did not learn programming before. Notes and lecture slides would not help you much in the final as the questions are very very difficult and has to be done in a short period of time.
reviews.comment_workload: The assignments is not hard but you need to spend some time on it. Most people get full mark in the assignments so you need to be careful to avoid careless mistakes.

reviews.author: l<412L
reviews.title: Desmond is a good guy
reviews.comment_content:
The content is not hard, especially for those who have studied programming before. Participate on every lessons and go through all the slides, then you can understand most of the concept.
There are lab sessions every weeks, and as long as you have concentrated on the class, you are able to tackle most of the assignments in lab, and if you couldn't, your lab assistant will help you.

Syllabus:
Basic data types, variables, assignment statements, console I/O
Arithmetic expressions, Boolean expressions
Branching and looping statements
Arrays
Classes and objects, properties and methods
Inheritance
Static variables and methods
Primitive types and reference types
Scope rules
String manipulations
File I/O
Recursion
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond teaches us with all his passion.
He's really a good guy.
He's very kind and humble.
He always tries his best to explain all the concepts for us.
Don't worry about the packed content, Desmond will probably make additional lesson for the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Desmond promises us the top 25% students could get grade A in the class.
The examinations are not easy, I suggest you do all the past papers that provided.

Here are some tips from the website:
The exams are not a test of memorization.
They are a test of understanding, so it is important to prepare for the exams:
Go through all the notes and labs and make sure you understand them.
Study the review exercises.
Download and run the example files to understand them.
Try and write your own code/programs to help understand them.

Below are some statistics of midterm and final
Mean: 62.25
Stdev: 17.26
Max: 95.5
Median: 62.25

Mean: 52.37
Stdev: 19.50
Max: 87.25
Median: 55.63
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fairly average.
There are two assignments.
Before every assignments, there is a briefing session, remember not to miss it or it would be a panic to read all the notes by yourself.

reviews.author: Jack0212
reviews.comment_content: Basic Java syntax and Object-oriented thinking. Comparing to the other introductory programming courses, this course can build a better foundation of programming.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Hard to be interactive in online-teaching mode but Desmond tries his best and the response is one of the best I have seen.
He and his team respond to email very quickly and teaches well.
Lots of resources are provided on the website.
reviews.comment_grading:
Desmond promised to give 28% of A range, which is very high in my opinion.
The midterm is difficult but it is fine even if you got 7x something because of the large SD.
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab every week + 2 assignments for the whole semester, a standard workload of 3 credit courses.
Cannot say it has a light workload but if the professor is teaching well you can spend less time struggling on your work.

reviews.author: NaturalEthan
reviews.comment_content: The course introduces the basic concepts and knowledge of programming by teaching JAVA. The scope covers variable, class, main function, loop, if-else statement, file IO,  and recursion. However, the content is only a simple and plain introduction, which means the difficulty is just designed for non-CS students. And this course teaches so little about the thought of programming, which is the biggest drawback of this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Wilfred's teaching is not good since he often forgot to introduce the fundamental concepts that are very important for the computer programming! The slides is too disorder and the examples are too much and complex.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading scheme is not appropriate and suitable. And some students offence the academic integrity code during the final exam since the exam is online MCs. The final mean is 88 with a SD of 13.8! Thus lots of students got a 100 in the final exam and the grading is depended on the midterm.
reviews.comment_workload: A little bit light. We have 1 written homework and 1 assignment. The assignment is very easy.

reviews.author: I_Wont_Tell_You
reviews.title: Mother of God please do not take this course
reviews.comment_content: For a beginner's course the content is fairly easy but if one aspires to become a programmer this is totally inadequate. It does not train you in algorithm but rather some quirky and eccentric codes that won't see the light of day in your actual tasks.
reviews.comment_teaching: Who gives a shit? Unless you're an expert connoisseur already you shouldn't even think about entering this course under any circumstances otherwise be prepared to be spoon fed with bullshit. But Wilfred was a kind gentleman that I'll at least give him.
reviews.comment_grading: Imagine getting exactly 90% and you're still in the b range. That's right, no longer is it a fantasy and this has been realized by this legendary pile of shit of a course. You'd be much better off in 1021 where that would actually be an A+. You've been warned, think thrice before jumping into this cesspool like I did.
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload at all so at least none of the effort is wasted.

Overall I give this course a score of

Int x = 1000 ;
for(int I =0; I<1000;I++){
x--;
System.out.println(" I hate this course") ;

}
System.out.println("i give this course a:" +x) ;

reviews.author: Benxd
reviews.title: IF DESMOND THEN A MUST-TAKE COURSE
reviews.comment_content:
1. problem solving and computer programming
2. basic programming language elements
3. java operations
4. checking and selection
5. looping
6. arrays
7. class and objects
8. inheritance
9. static variables and methods
10. recursion
11. file i/o
12. strings
13. abstract data types

it's quite packed but desmond will add additional lesson if needed so don't worry if you can't catch up the lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching: BEST TEACHER IN UST. JUST STUDY THE COURSE IF HE'S TEACHING. His pace for me is moderate because I haven't studied Java before, his lesson is fun, he will make jokes (for whatever good or bad ones, at least he did it for a better learning environment). Also, his teaching is clear and cover most scenarios that you may encounter. Of course, he encourages you to try out those cases at home too. One more tip, you can go find Desmond to chat whenever if he is available and he will just chat with you for like 3 hours (that's why he is the best teacher on the EARTH :p).
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good.
for the test part, it's flexible and there are two  option for you.
option 1:
50% mid term, 50% final
option 2:
100% final
so you just skip the mid term if you are quite confident on your final (or let's say programming skills)
but watch out the mc part in either mid term or final is tricky and I can see even someone got 88 mark still got 8-9 wrong on the mc part, so trying out whatever you feel sceptical about it.

also lab (10 sessions) and assignments
reviews.comment_workload:
lab part isn't that hard but if you haven't learnt programming before, nested loops maybe the worst part in your lab session. Others even to class and objects won't be difficult.

assignment is definitely hard for me (coz I didn't do programming), but good thing is DESMOND IS YOUR GOOD FRIEND, so feel free to find him if you have any difficulties. He is a really good teacher.

reviews.author: LazyCancer
reviews.title: An introduction Comp course that are not so friendly to beginner
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course covered fundamental of Java programming. But there is a lot of experts with programming background or they already know about Java taking this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond's teaching is pretty nice, you won't feel that bored when you attend the lecture. And you can always ask him question and he will reply you as soon as possible.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 20%
Mid term 30%
Final 40%
Labs 10%
reviews.comment_workload: Workload might be heavy for beginner in programming aspect, because you need a lot of time to debug your assignment. This semester we do image processing and Sudoku game as the assignment. Please try to finish the lab before you attend it because it can save a lot of time.

reviews.author: Prudencia_L
reviews.comment_content: Introductory course of java, includes basic and comprehensive topics in programming, the first half is quite friendly to those without programming background while the following half requires some effort to understand and handle.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond(Dr. Tsoi) is a very interesting and humorous and helpful instructor, and would give the lectures in a vivid way, and triple-language (English, Cantonese, Mandarin) in teaching, especially when introducing important
but complicated concepts, therefore you don't need to worry about being unable to catch up with the course. However, it's kinda tedious especially  when you can understand all of the three languages, so I usually skip his lectures and watch the lecture video in 2x speed afterwards lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite fair, and the instructor promised to give around 25% of A range.

I got 34/40 for assignment 1 and 98/100 for assignment 2. Both mt and final scores are around 1 SD higher than mean, full-attendance for labs, and got A for the final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: I spent a considerable amount of time on this course. The 2 assignments are really time consuming for you need time to debug, and each of them cost me around 1 week to finish. The lab tasks are moderate, and  I suggest that you should finish the readings.

reviews.author: BOb
reviews.comment_content: Excellent course.!
reviews.comment_teaching: Very clear, not hard to understand. Just read through every ppt slides then you will have enough knowledge for this course
reviews.comment_grading: Wonderful . Desmond is the best professor I’ve ever met in UST till now. Basically in spring semester it’s more likely to get better grades than in fall cause CS guys take it in fall. Desmond gives really good grade. Top 30% students can receive an A range. I got 90 plus as final score and received an A plus
reviews.comment_workload: Ok. Two assignments. 10 Labs which needs attendance for at least 8 times.

reviews.author: dma22
reviews.title: COMP 1022P
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Java concepts. Some of the content might be really hard, such as recursion or inheritance, but Desmond explains really well, so don't worry.

Syllabus :
0~logistics
1~Intro to problem-solving and computer programming
2~Basic programming language elements
3~Java operations
4~Java checking and selection statements
5~Java looping statements
6~Java arrays
7~Java classes and objects
8~Java inheritance
9~Java static variables and methods
10~Java recursion
11~Java file I/O
12~Java Strings
13~Java Abstract Data Type
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is really good!! He explains really clearly and sometimes he would add additional classes (mostly at night). You can ask questions after class and it can even last for an hour or more. He is also very funny, sometimes he compare his course with other computer courses and make jokes out of it. Anyways, his teaching is really fun and easy to understand.

All in all, as an introductory class, I would say he is the best teacher possible to teach the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is nice. Around 25-28% A range, and if I remember it correctly 50+% B range.

As a reference ( my grade / mean ) :
Midterm ( 76 / +- 6... ) : + around 0.8 SD
Finals ( 76.5 / 6... ) : + around 0.8 SD
Assignment 1 : ( 100 / ? )
Assignment 2 : ( 100 / ? )
Lab : All full

Final grade : A -
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not that heavy, only 2 assignments and labs. The assignment is not easy but also not hard. You are given around 2 weeks or so to finish the assignment. As long as you spend time working on your assignment then you will do just fine.

For lab, you can be absent once cause it will grade the best 9 out of 10 labs, and you can finish the lab before the lab itself, so mostly people only spend around 20 - 30 mins.

reviews.author: Nandi
reviews.comment_content: A basic introduction to computing to Java.  Very interesting topics but are slightly challenging to anyone who has no programming background especially the topics after the mid-term.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Honestly, Desmond is one of the best professors at UST. His lectures are really fun and interesting despite being at 9:20 am. He always makes jokes and keeps the lectures very relaxed. His teachings prior to the mid-term were really good, he took his time and explained concepts really well.

But after the mid-term, he really sped up his teaching. He often ended up taking extra classes to cover the syllabus. These "extra lectures" were 2 - 3 hours long and were really annoying.
reviews.comment_grading:
Desmond has 2 types of grading in class, and the one that gives you the highest total is taken into consideration.

I.  Labs (10%) + Assignment (20%) + Midterm (30%) + Final (40%)

II. Labs (10%) + Assignment (20%) + Final (70%)

Desmond gives 30% of the class A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is one lab every week. About 10 labs in total, the best of scores of 9 labs are taken into considerations. The lab work can be completed easily before the class.

The first assignment is pretty simple and doesn't take much time. However, the second assignment is much longer but we were given a month to complete it.

reviews.author: GLY饲养员
reviews.title: hard for rookie
reviews.comment_content:
content is relatively simple，it talks about some basic component of programming
including：class ，superclass，different kinds of variables, different loops and I\O
reviews.comment_teaching: the accent is not very clear,that is why I skipped most of the class. He is a nice teacher, but I really dont understand what he is talking about.
reviews.comment_grading:
fair，but most of ur classmate have learned it before. They will easily get a good grade，so it is hard for rookies to get nice grade.
The final grade mainly depends on the mid final and two hours assignment
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is not very heavy. There is a lab per week which everyone could pass. Pay attention to the assignment earlier, and do not forget to demo. Try to practice when u r free. It helps a lot.

reviews.author: nussun54
reviews.title: Introduction to Computing with Java
reviews.comment_content:
Basic data types, variables, assignment statements, console I/O
Arithmetic expressions, Boolean expressions
Branching and looping statements
Arrays
Classes and objects, properties and methods
Inheritance
Static variables and methods
Primitive types and reference types
Scope rules
String manipulations
File I/O
Recursion

Basic programming essentially, nothing more.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Ng's teaching quality can be shown by the number of students that attended his lectures. Quality of English is rather poor and just understandable. To really get a good grade in this course, it is important to try out the content yourself on Java as the lectures really only teach you the basics of the language and is not well detailed. Trying out the content yourself is probably the best way to fully understand the content just as any other programming languages, which is also encouraged by Prof. Ng. Professor does help if you have any specific questions.

The CSE programming commons is useful to clear up any confusion.
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratory exercises 10%
Programming assignments 20%
Midterm examination 30%
Final examination 40%

97% in Midterm, 90% in Finals, Final Grade = A-

Midterms: Mean = 76.10%; S.D. = 18.60%
Finals: Mean = 76.94%; S.D. = 18.76%

As there are already a lot of programming experts taking this course, really hard for those who have no background in programming (like me) to really get a high grade. Exams marks like this in any other course would be A or better most likely. Did a lot of past papers (mostly provided) to ensure I did well in this course as due to its infamous grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 hours lectures per week
"2 hours" lab work per week

Lectures are pretty boring and is probably more useful to read it and try out the content yourself on Java. I suggest still to attend the lectures as not all content said in the lectures by Prof. is in the powerpoint slides, as he does a lot of annotations on the slides during the lecture.
Lab work is very easy for the first half of the course and could be finished in probably 10 minutes. In the second half, it is probably better to finish the lab work on your laptop the night before as it might take more time if your are stuck. TAs will help during the lab but there are a lot of students so you might have to wait. If you finish the lab work before the lab, you could just present it to the TA and leave straightaway. (Attendance is required)

The programming assignment is to program the game "Mastermind" - which was split into 2 parts (this would change each semester but the next part should apply anyways for all semesters). First part is a lot easier than the second part, and overall it takes quite a bit of time (especially for beginners) so make sure you start this early and try out you program completely to ensure it works for all circumstances. Not much help is provided if you are stuck so find someone who knows Java or programming to help you. Information online is also useful sometimes.

reviews.author: MighTy
reviews.title: Great Course of Introduction to World of Computing
reviews.comment_content: A Fine course introducing the most basic knowledge of java programming and the object-oriented programming. The notes shows most of the knowledge taught and presented by the professor. However, the exams(Mid-term and Final) includes so many contents that were never taught or spoke before which makes it significantly important to put more effort in self-study rather than just follow the course and learn with the professor.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was really good, Wilfred is a really good professor who answer students' email quickly and can provide sufficient help. The teaching during the lessons are accurate and informative, examples of each chapter is always shown on the screen by using the small programs Wilfred wrote himself. Great Professor in all.
reviews.comment_grading:
40% Final Exam
30% Mid-term Exam
10% Lab Work
20% Assignment
The Lab work is usually full mark since instructors usually can help you over the entire program, find and solve the problems you run into to get you write.
The assignment is not hard as well, I spent a whole afternoon and night to complete both parts, guess it only took like 4 or 5 hours? These 30 points are easy to get full.
The exam is rather broad than hard, since there always are questions that aren't mentioned before during the class, for like about 5 or 7 points? But most people can't get it right so actually it doesn't influence too much. The Mean fluctuates little but the SD is always high, like 16-18.
A+ is not impossible if you make little mistakes during the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that heavy but if you'd really like to dig into it and learn something truly helpful, there's still plenty work to be settled, but to get a A grade, you only need to spend like 3-4 hours every week and it will be easy for you to get a good grade.

reviews.author: compbarnlover
reviews.title: Difficult unless you already have a solid background
reviews.comment_content:
I was new to programming so I felt really lost. Many of the other students were way ahead of me and it seemed like everyone else was an expert. If you haven't learned Java before I recommend you learn it before you come to this Introduction to Java.

Some others have already posted the course topics in order.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond was great. He really seemed to care and helped a lot on my projects.
reviews.comment_grading: This class has a really high average because a lot of people already had a solid background in Java. It was tough for me, but they chose the best out of three ways to calculate my grade which was nice.
reviews.comment_workload: There were two projects throughout the course. I felt lost when starting them at first and had to ask for a lot of help. Thankfully the TAs were helpful.

reviews.author: zgaoai
reviews.comment_content: Easy slides and easy lectures. The midterm is just ok, but the final exam is horrible, full of blank pages with no hints or skeleton codes for you to finish the coding...
reviews.comment_teaching: Energetic and cute, always jumping around while teaching the lectures. Have a lot of examples and make-up classes to make sure that we can grab the knowledge well. Highly recommend Desmond.
reviews.comment_grading: Good curve, about 30%+ A range
reviews.comment_workload: High, needs to pay a lot of time in the weekly lab after midterm, and the assignments are very tough for beginners cuz you need to learn a lot with self-study.

reviews.author: Spring Ho
reviews.title: Fuck Wilfred, get DESMOND TSOI
reviews.comment_content: I failed this course (purposefully) and retook it, the things are not hard, sometimes is quite tricky and if you dont get it, it can be a mind fuck. Sometimes I could not figure out the logic of the code for days and the next day I understand it with ease. I suppose this is the magic of learning and programming, practice hard but dont force it, give yourself a break, take a deep breath and think about it from scratch.
reviews.comment_teaching:
First time I failed, it was this guy called Wilfred, I am sure he is a nice guy, but in terms of teaching he is an absolute cunt(sorry wilfred), reads the powerpoint word to word, this might work for other subjects and courses but when it comes to such a flexible topic with unlimited possibility, you can't teach like this.

So I skipped the final and failed it, retook it and thought ah shit here we go again, but this time instead of that piece of shit Wilfred, it was the man, the myth, the LEGEND DESMOND TSOI, this guy is a god, the way he explains every cases under each topic and tries to make them sound interesting is just awesome, It almost made me pick CS as my major just because of him. This made me realize, how much a good professor actually matters.

If you take CompP, get this guy, you wont regret it, you have my word.
reviews.comment_grading: Many Many experts lurking around you, ready to skin you alive and eat you, assuming you are a noob of course. If you have no programming background, this really isn't a good place to be. But, everyone's gotta start somewhere, pay attention and pour effort in, it is not that bad. Plus, programming is actually a very fun topic and it comes with a huge sense of accomplishment when your code and logic actually works. If I can get a B at the end, you can do much better.
reviews.comment_workload:
quite heavy workload, but you kind of expect this for a computer science course as computer science is about constant practising and improving, this is a nature of CS so I would not blame it on the course, this is just what it takes to git good. There are several programming assignments, dont hesitate to send emaiil or ask desmond in person as he is very very passionate about helping you get out of frustration.

Computer labs are  pain in the ass tho, get yourself a buddy to go with you so you feel less lonely and can work on the problem together, as sometime it can be quite a while until you can get the TA signature and leave.

reviews.author: smallp0tat0
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces basic knowledge of Java programming and you will be able to write some small programs. It doesn't need attendance but it's good to attend the classes because professor explains things very clearly, I have never taken any programming courses before but it is not very hard for beginners.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is the best teacher I've ever met in this university!!! He tries hard to make the classes interesting. He is always helpful and willing to answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Midterm and final exam are quite demanding and the programming questions are tough. Btw, the grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate.

Usually, need to spend some time after lectures to fully understand the content.

Assignments are quite useful and practical.

reviews.author: Duo
reviews.comment_content: java语言的基本语法
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond是我遇到过最喜欢的老师。讲课非常清楚有趣，notes也很不错（但光看notes不能考试，讲课中有很多考点）会上传video，对每一章节有可以自己选择的巩固练习。平时发邮件问问题也会打得很快。
reviews.comment_grading:
不错，desmod承诺过30%A range
midterm和final都比mean高接近一个SD左右，两次assignment一次100/100，一次95/100，lab翘了一节，最后的龟A-
reviews.comment_workload: workload对于没有学过编程语言的人要大些，学期中有两个assignment，不熟悉的人可能要花很长时间debug，可能需要六七个小时。lab每周一次，都会提前做好去交，大概需要半个小时到一个半小时不等。midterm和final都不算很难，而且考试时间都比较靠后，有充足的时间复习。

reviews.author: Nicole MA
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces basic knowledge of Java programming and you will be able to write some small programs. It doesn't need attendance but it's good to attend the classes because professor explains things very clearly, I have never taken any programming courses before but it is not very hard for beginners.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is a very good teacher. He tries hard to make the classes interesting. He is always helpful and willing to answer questions. The labs , by the way, are important for you to practice the skills learned in class, so you don't want to miss any.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair.
Lab Exercises (10%) 10/10
Programming Assignments (20%) 100/100
Mid-term Exam (30%) 96/100
Final Exam (40%) 72.5/100
got A in the end.
The final is very difficult so you should be prepared.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty light but you have to review and practice a lot before the examinations. But usually, you just have to keep up the work and go to lab regularly.

reviews.author: Fouzil
reviews.comment_content: Its very straightforward: An introduction to Java. Its not a course that emphasizes on computer science concepts or anything so if you familiar with java and have done any course that covers topics like arrays, I would suggest taking the next level course.
reviews.comment_teaching: He's a nice guy but i feel he tends to assume that the students understand the concept, which is true as most people who take it have done java before. So thats bad for beginners.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. There are short homework assignments that are given once in a while. Labs are scheduled for 2 hours but you can finish in 12 minutes and just leave

reviews.author: WCYL
reviews.comment_content:
好簡單ge java basic野
一開波會廢up下電腦hardware ge運作
之後會講咩class, object, variables之類(java 重要concept黎)
戲肉寫code方面有braching(if, else果D), loops, array, console and file i/o同recursion (recursion個人認為最難,同埋由greenfoot轉eclipse會唔慣)
我冇㡳都handle到
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond 真係一個好好ge professor
local口音, 有耐性, D例子好清楚解到concept, 又識講笑
不過係教得好慢 好多時星期六要補課(每次兩個鐘左右)
佢自己會整個non-official ge homepage比你問問題or feedback
又會post lecture video 上去
reviews.comment_grading:
都幾爛下
我lab+assignment全部full mark
midterm final都above mean 0.7sd 左右
total score 8x/100 得B
mean係7x
reviews.comment_workload:
輕 有midterm lab assignment final
midterm輕鬆9x分(mean 8x)
lab就可以事先做好(greenfoot轉eclipse(console/file i/o)個lab比較煩, 可能因為唔慣)
assignment 分2part 建議deadline前2星期開始做(有D method點打要諗幾耐下)
final就難到一個點, 最後7x/100 (mean 6x)

reviews.author: Chengzhong
reviews.comment_content:
The exams are fairly easy, and most of my friends got high score in the tests. The greenfoot gives a lot help in learning this course.

Considered as a fundamental  COMP course, learning java is indeed a good choice.

There would be a project, but it was just a little bit related with the course. The project is quite tedious and just to bear the trouble of debugging. Certainly, it would cost time, but feels quite good after go through it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
If you are inured to self-learning, do not go to the lecture, as the instructor just go through the ppts in class.

Please note that all the lecture notes are not on the CANVAS, on the web of CSE, comp1022p instead.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very bad. I got a 93+ out of 100, while still in B range; how ever, I have learned that should I got 96+/100, it would be A+.

So, be careful when doing the midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is relatively high if you have no idea about computer science before.

You can ask help from your friends, but do not copy it.

reviews.author: Bakhtiyar
reviews.title: Quite competitive for a person with little programming background
reviews.comment_content:
Course teaches introductory concepts in programming and presents interesting lab works. There are short and helpful videos (lectures) with good approach to teaching. The concepts are not too difficult, but I think you need some programming experience.

The content of the course:

Thinking for Problem Solving
Primitive Data Types, Variables and Literals, Console I/O
Arithmetic Operations, Assignment Operations, Manual Type Casting
Loops and Arrays
Classes and Objects
OOP concepts: inheritance, polymorphism, encapsulation, abstraction
Static Variables and Methods
Recursion
File I/O
Strings
Abstract Data Types (Stack and Queue)
reviews.comment_teaching: Short video lectures by Prof. TC Pong are quite helpful and can help learn basic programming principles. Lab works are also a great way to test your knowledge.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is quite competitive:

Online activities 10%
Labs 10%
Project 10%
Midterm examination 30%
Final examination 40%
Total 100%

My grades:

Online activities: 9/10
Labs: 10/10
Project: 10/10
Midterm examination 100/100
Final examination 61/100
Total 83%
Grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is relatively light

10 modules (video lectures, online tasks, labs)
Each module can be completed in couple of hours.

For the project, most of the work is already done through labs, so you only have to add several more functions. Also can be completed in couple of hours.

reviews.author: TarreVizsla
reviews.comment_content:
The course contains 10 modules, all of which are pretty standard and easy to understand introduction topics. The only things that are slightly complicated are the last 2 modules, which contain recursion and things like n-queen problem. The course however,  barely touches the surface of the topics, even for an introductory course, it is way too easy, don't expect to learn much from it.

It also goes through the course using the crappy BlueJ, without teaching students how to use a proper JAVA IDE, like Eclipse or IntelliJ. It does include a small section at the very end, although I doubt it'll be of much help.

If you have some programming fundamentals, you should do alright. Even if you don't have any experience, the content is not meant to be challenging (or useful) in any way.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching was not delivered by prof. David Rossiter, but rather some other professor. The course was in video form and looked like it was made in early 2010s, which does fit with the BlueJ that the course uses, which feels and looks like a software from 30 years ago (it's insufferable to use). I highly recommend speeding up the videos by 2x speed, it would be nice if the website has a 3x or 4x speed option, because the videos were atrociously boring. Muting the video would also be doing yourself a favour, as the the voice of the instructor is barely audible without the subtitles.

Of course you don't have to go through the completely useless videos, just search up some random online course, it'll be 100 times more educational.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Activities - 10%
Lab Exercises - 10%
Project - 10%
Midterm - 30%
Final - 40%

All the online activities, the project and most of the lab exercises are graded automatically by the online system. You are allowed quite a few tries and only a handful of test cases were used, so it's safe to assume that the majority of the students are able to complete these parts with full marks. The few hand checked lab should also be easy enough to get 100% if you follow the instructions (although it does get ambiguous sometimes).

The exams are conducted on the canvas quiz system and you are allowed to use BlueJ, pdf files, google calculator and course websites. Past papers were provided, but they were not representative of the difficulty of the midterm, which was exceptionally easy, quite some people scored 100. They probably realised the issue and designed the final with greater difficulty. It was also filled with problems. The system did not recognise correct code and the questions were deleted because the program provided was not written properly. It led to great confusion during the exam and people did poorly compared to the midterm.

The grading in general is very lenient, even if you messed up and get 80 something in the final, you can still get A+. However, judging from the trend of the exams, it's likely the difficulty of the papers go up significantly and it will be much harder to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was really light. The tasks took no time to finish. Also revisions for the exams did not demand much effort, because you're able to drag the any pdf files and notes to the browser to act as cheat sheets during the exam, so no memorisation required.

reviews.author: SunGamePlay
reviews.title: 大學，大不了自學
reviews.comment_content:
I had learn some basic Java coding before,

so the review might not be helpful to you,

but I try my best to provide a useful feedback.

= = = Online Course = = =

The course is an online course,

that mean you don’t need to go to any lecture/lab/tutorial.

Instead you watch video provided to learn,

complete assignment and take the exam,

to complete this course.

= = = Course structure = = =

COMP1022P consists 10 modules, as below

To help you better understand what the module is about,

an example of what you should be able to do is also stated.

1. Course Overview
    
    output “Hello, world!” on the terminal.
    
2. Programming Fundamentals
    
    ask user to input 2 integers, output the product of them.
    
3. Object-oriented Programming
    
    Load an image and display it on a canvas*
    
4. Scope Rules, Boolean Expressions and Branching Statements
    
    Compare the result of a Rock-paper-scissors game
    
    and output whether you win, tile or lose.
    
5. Loops, Shortcut Operators, Arrays
    
    Swapping cards in a 1D Game board
    
6. Introduction to OOP, Subclass, Multidimensional Array, Simple Sorting
    
    Swapping cards in a 2D Game board
    
7. Character String, File I/O
    
    Turning every character on a string to ‘?’
    
    for example “hello” → “?????”
    
8. Simple Event Driven Programming and GUI
    
    adding a game record into a high score table.
    
9. Recursion
    
    Making a screen transition effect
    
10. Abstract data type (ADT), Eclipse
    
    Loading game record from a file
    

= = = Special remind = = =

If you learned Java before,

Just go and read the Javadoc of comp102x packages,

they added some self-defined class

and are tested in the exam,

be sure you know how to use them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
SIS told you that the instructor is ROSSITER, David,

However, you can ONLY see him in Exam or Zoom.

I believed that UST just plays same set of video,

recorded a few years ago, again, again and again.

However, there is one big problem,

the instructor in that semester was not good at teaching,

His don’t even speaks clear English, and speaks with flat tone.

Luckily that there is subtitles provided,

allows you to learn just by watching subtitles.

But to be honest,

there is no reason to learn Java watching this set of video,

watching video from other online video series

would be a much better choice,

since this set of video is really not good.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Online activities + 10% Lab exercises + 10% Project

Just Assignment, work hard or smart to get high.

30% Midterm

My result : 100(+1.10sd)

Highest : 100 | Mean : 76 | Lowest : 20

Standard deviation : 21.8

40% Final

My result : 96 (+2.08sd)

Highest : 96 | Mean : 65 | Lowest 28

Standard deviation : 14.9

Overall  A+

Have to mentioned that both exams are not really much difficult,

The only problem is you might made careless mistake, be careful.

(just like what I made in Final and losing some scores)
reviews.comment_workload:
I have to said this is a very low workload course,

I finished every assignments, including online activities,

lab exercises and project,

within one day in the day of their deadline.

I just look at some past paper and their solution ,

without even doing them, before the Midterm and the Final.

It takes ~ 3 hours for me for each exam.

Overall the course costs me < 24 hours in a whole semester.

(However it might not be the case for you.)

reviews.author: summerwoon
reviews.title: Java
reviews.comment_content: the content overall is reasonable. Not really hard. Besides, after learning Java, Python will sounds so much easier.
reviews.comment_teaching: the teaching is not bad, however might require some time to understand what are they teaching about. Need some time to grasp the facts and then you'll realised what he said do make sense.
reviews.comment_grading: the overall grading is okay, i screwed up my midterm and did well in finals and got a B+. I have no computing background at all.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is quite heavy as we are required to go through the exercises and there are tasks once in awhile. The tasks require quite some time to do

reviews.author: Bibubibu
reviews.title: You don’t get good result only listening hard
reviews.comment_content: Course materials are short and concise. Each lectures lasts 5-10 mins. While 1 chapter consists of 5-10 videos, there are 10 chapters covering basic programming knowledge with Java and some basic data structures. Totally self paced. However it’s easy to get left behind if you’re not diligent or self-disciplined enough. To get a satisfying result you need to practice A LOT.
reviews.comment_teaching: Course content explained well. Each video is short with clear title and well-defined topic. Therefore it’s pretty easy to repeat it if you don't understand any concept. However, it’s harder to ask about your confusion if you have any as it’s an online class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good. The course will be a bit challenging if you don’t have any previous programming experience. You need to work hard. Written cheat sheet is permitted.

I got
MIdterm 89/100
Final 86/100
Online assignment and lab ~90/100
Overall A

The s.d. is pretty high, ~20 marks while the mean is ~55
reviews.comment_workload: Little. They have 1 simple and straight forward lab assignment and around 3 mc questions for each chapter. There are 3 final projects in which you are required to finish a little game. It’s pretty interesting. A lot of the work has been done as a template so if you are familiar with programming, the workload should not be that bad.

reviews.author: Cinw
reviews.comment_content:
Java introductory course, for example, the structure of writing Java code, some Java packages, etc.
It's not difficult for a beginner, but it takes time to understand some concepts. If you have learned some other Java knowledge would be more accessible as sometimes some concepts that were not covered in the course would be used as a supporter to run the whole program.
reviews.comment_teaching: This semester was changed to a self-paced online delivery mode, so we would watch the pre-recorded video through another online platform. While during the semester, you can attend the Zoom review session every 2 weeks and the professor would explain 2 topics' content. If you got any other questions, you can write an email and the responses were quick. But still, this is a self learning course, not much to discuss on the teaching part.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. Both of my mid-term and final got above the mean (~0.5-0.8 sd). But because some other students already studied Java before, they would get extremely high scores. I put effort throughout the course and of course before the exams and eventually, I got a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
Total 10 topics, 5 in each half of the semester. Some graded exercises are attached to each topic after some video recording. Each topic would have a lab task that is more complicated than the graded exercises.
There's also a project which combined several topics to write a Java program for a computer game.

reviews.author: kazzattack
reviews.title: Fighting against computer geniuses
reviews.comment_content: The content covers basic java programming like arrays, loops, etc.. If you've learned other done programming before then you can pick up the learning pretty easily.
reviews.comment_teaching: The learning is self-paced. You just watch videos and the teaching is pretty straightforward and quite easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: Shit is fucked here... Went into the first zoom meeting and saw SNU korean kids and I knew I was fucked. The exam and midterm was SOOO bad. The modules were easy but the exams require you to run code, loops, and algorithms in your head really quickly. Only take this course if you can do quick maths and logics in your head.
reviews.comment_workload: Just finished the modules, labs, and short questions before the deadline. They give enough time dw.

reviews.author: Saffron
reviews.comment_content: Should be simple java program technique. But I cant understand. It required logic skills and able to read and write program.
reviews.comment_teaching: It doesn't have real lesson but you need to read the online materials by yourself. It will have online lesson sometimes to review the online materials.
reviews.comment_grading: For me, it is acceptable. I got a bad result in both midterm and final but still get a C. Maybe the project and the labs help a lot.
reviews.comment_workload: There will be some questions to test your understanding of the topic. Also, there will be one lab for each module. Some labs are easy to do but some are hard for me. Moreover, there will be a project for you to complete. However, the labs are actually similar to he project so just need to change some content of the labs can help you to finish the final project.

reviews.author: Testing1234
reviews.title: Self-paced course on MOOC
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction to Computing with Java
2. Programming Fundamentals
3. Object-Oriented Programming
4. Scope Rules, Boolean Expressions and Branching Statements
5. Loops, Shortcut Operators, Arrays
6. Introduction to OOP, Subclass, Multidimensional Array, Simple Sorting
7. Character String, File I/O
8. Simple Event Driven Programming and GUI
9. Recursion
10. Abstract data type (ADT), Eclipse

To a Java beginner, chapter 1-5 is easier since it is basic programming knowledge. Chapter 6-10 is more advance since they dig deeper into Java
reviews.comment_teaching: Since this is a self-paced course, you dont have to attend any lectures. All of the lecture videos are uploaded to HKMOCC on the first day and you can watch them whenever you want. The teaching is fine and all concepts are discussed. There were a few meetings held by Gibson which you can choose to participate or not. I participated all of them and Gibson discussed some concepts and raised some examples with us.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online activities 10%
Lab exercises 10%
Project 10%
Midterm exam 30% or 0%
Final exam 40% or 70%
Since the performance of the midterm exam is terrible, Gibson introduced the 2nd grading method which is 0% midterm and 70% final. The system will automatically select the higher scheme for you.

For me:
Online activities: 10/10
Lab exercises: 9.9/10
Project: 10/10
Midterm: 54/100 (Mean=54.8, S.D=21.1)
Final: 77.17/100 (Mean=62.6, S.D=19.2)
My grade is calculated by the second scheme, and I receive a B+
reviews.comment_workload: Not really heavy. It is a self-paced course so everything depends on yourself. There are 10 labs and some short/MC questions which are easy.

reviews.author: misaka
reviews.title: Self-paced MOOC course
reviews.comment_content:
M1: Course Overview
M2: Programming Fundamentals
M3: Object-oriented Programming
M4: Scope Rules, Boolean Expressions and Branching Statements
M5: Loops, Shortcut Operators, Arrays
M6: Introduction to OOP, Subclass, Multidimensional Array, Simple Sorting

I am a complete beginner in programming who does not even know what is Java or Python. The content of this course is not too difficult if you follow the materials closely and spent extra time to find more information with Google.

My advice for beginner is that don't imagine you have to know everything you can find on the internet, the PPTs and the BlueJ projects have practically everything you needs to understand if you would just look at it long enough.

All lectures are videos recorded some years ago. There were occasional Zoom lecture for summary and Q&A.

The content of the videos are concise with just enough details.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online activities (10%)
Labs (10%)
Project (10%)
Midterm Exam (30%)
Final Exam (40 %)

7% + 7% + 10% + 10% + 28% = 62%
Final Grade: B

reviews.comment_workload:
The online course is self-paced with only 1 deadline before the midterm and another before the final.

Each labs took me on average a few hours. The MOOC system allow multiple attempts. The final project is simply a bigger lab assignment.

reviews.author: Masblablabla

reviews.author: ericc016
reviews.comment_content: Very interesting and relatively easy content even for those without any previous knowledge in programming. However, a lot of students in the class already come with previous experience, making it a little more difficult for beginners. A good starting course to coding (but not for good your gpa)
reviews.comment_teaching: Very nice and helpful professor, goes through every concept thoroughly with specific examples to help with understanding. Labs also used to make sure students both understand and can apply learning to real projects.
reviews.comment_grading: As mentioned previously, since a lot of students in the class already come with previous experience, it is not easy to achieve a good grade in the class, especially for people with no/minimal coding background. However, if you are really dedicated to learning, it should be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not too heavy, but each project/assignment/lab will require some thinking and trial and error, which is where most of the time is spent. Workload could be seen as slightly heavy compared to the amount of knowledge you gain, but it is so that you can fully understand and apply the things you learnt into a real example.

reviews.author: MartinCol
reviews.title: Hard for beginner, but really interesting
reviews.comment_content: Really interesting content to get a grasp on how programming works
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is god is a really amazing teacher, I love him. However, you'll have to find some content online, but don't worry. Java is a popular language, so it's easy to find what you're looking for.
reviews.comment_grading: It depends of your teacher. Mine was Desmond, so it was easy to get a good grade. Obviously, to get an A, you have to work extra.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is intense, it can be quite hard to understand at the beginning. Some students are already expert, so don't be unmotivated if it is your first programming course. However, you'll learn very fast how everything works, and you'll feel great when you have a program that works!

reviews.author: mushroomkeeper
reviews.title: I love desmond
reviews.comment_content: The content is not hard, basically a brief tour of everything you need to start playing with java. There are around 20 pages or more for each topic, with examples and attractive cartoons and illustations.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is the best. He welcomes all kinds of question and he replies each one with heart. Moreover, he often sends emails to follow up lecture materials and assignments. What else can you ask for?
reviews.comment_grading: The exams are hard though. The trickiest and most devious questions appear in desmond's finals, and there are many cs and qfin students competing with you. If you work hard and study all materials, you can get good grades with desmond's help. He says he is trying to give more students A range as many as possible.
reviews.comment_workload: Throughout the course there are lab assignment each week and monthly homework assignment. For lab assignment, the tasks are quite easy and you can usually finish it within 10 minutes. For homework assignment, they are often big projects like image processor, connect-four game etc. Those require you to fill in many details and spend some time to digest the whole thing. But for me, or others who interested in coding, working with assignments is intriguing and I was always expecting next lab assignment to play with.

reviews.author: 13ryan.C
reviews.title: COMP 1022P course summary
reviews.comment_content:
The course is mainly about basic programming knowledge which includes basic Object-Oriented programming, OOP, concepts like class, objects, etc. The good manipulation of such concepts will get you through the midterm.
Then you will need to know control statements, strings, recursion, arrays for the final exam. Basic knowledge of counting will be helpful towards questions about loop executions. You will encounter IDPs like Greenfoot and Ecplise.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is of normal standard. If you think the delivery pace is slow, skip the lectures and start doing past papers/revisions and finish lab preparations. The professor answered questions confidently and was helpful to clarify concepts. He also did revision sessions before the midterms and final.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair and good. Make sure you practice past papers and be aware of the timing which is very important since exams are all conducted online.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy if you are already familiar with basic programming concepts, like, OOP, data types. If not, SPEND time to clarify them, which will make things go smoother especially after the midterm. Make sure to finish Labs and assignments.

Recursion will be the most difficult part (I think). So if you are going to take this course, preview this part for better comprehension.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wilfred is energetic but his accent is a bit weird lol. He explains things well but it still requires a bit extra effort to digest things after class.
The only thing bad about Wilfred is that he always runs overtime so you either choose to miss the things he's gonna say or to be super embarrassed for being late in next class.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% written assignment
20% programming assignment
10% lab
25% midterm
40% final

Almost everyone gets full marks in lab. Written assignment and programming assignments are not terribly difficult to get full mark if you are careful enough. Final is more difficult than midterm and both midterm and final have multiple choice part and programming part.
Got nearly full in written assignment, full in programming assignment and lab, 1.5-2 sd (forgot the exact number) above mean in midterm and final. Absolute grading ~95% got A+. I have programming background.
reviews.comment_workload:
Labs and assignments are easy but you gotta spend time on it, So the workload is average.
Btw the course page has the answer to basically all the labs so check the webpage before you actually do it. That saves a lot of time.

reviews.author: sinman
reviews.title: Very good
reviews.comment_content:
This is a brief introduction to Java, so even students without programming background can try to read this course, here are some course contents.

0~logistics
1~Intro to problem-solving and computer programming
2~Basic programming language elements
3~Java operations
4~Java checking and selection statements
5~Java looping statements
6~Java arrays
7~Java classes and objects
8~Java inheritance
9~Java static variables and methods
10~Java recursion
11~Java file I/O
12~Java Strings
reviews.comment_teaching: MUPPALA is a good teacher.His teaching is lively and interesting, and he is very serious about teaching. He often answers students' questions and interacts with students
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab 10%
Written Assignment 5%
Programming Assignment 20%
Mid-term 25%
Final 40%

Mid-term and final exams are more difficult and need to spend more time studying.
reviews.comment_workload: Every week, there will be two hours of experimental halls to prepare in advance, and TA will provide effective help, therefore, it is easier to get full marks.

reviews.author: CsAka
reviews.comment_content:
It's just an introduction so do not expect to learn too much except java syntax and the concept of object-oriented. I think it is ok just learn the course slides by yourself.
BUT! I do not suggest the course if you are not interested in cs coz there are really many many many experts in this course:(
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecture does not record attendance, but tutorials do. And I think TAs are good.
reviews.comment_grading: It is easy to get full marks in labs. But ATTENTION, do the last exam question first, it is the easiest one when you take a midterm/final, or you will regret it after every exam :(
reviews.comment_workload: 1 or 2 hours for every week's assignment.

reviews.author: Sum06
reviews.comment_content:
---Mid-term---
1-hardware-software
2-elementary-programming
3-objects-and-classes
4-variables-scopes
5-expression-branching
------------------
---Final---
7-loops
8-arrays-nested-loops
10-eclipse-console
11-eclipse-string-fileio
12-recursion
13-altogether
-------------
reviews.comment_teaching:
The learning atmosphere is good, not so boring.
He always explains the code patiently and clearly. He tries to make the class fun.
reviews.comment_grading:
I have learnt some basic JavaScript, so I found the content is quite easy and basic.
MCs in the exam is a bit tricky, just need to do them carefully.
Not enough time to do the programming part in the exam

Lab 10%
Written assignment 5%
Programming assignment 20%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 40%

Both exams my mark is above mean and I got B.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost every week would have a lab which is writing Java code.
There are one written assignment, which is similar to the mid-term exam, and one programming assignment, which is making a mastermind by Green-foot.

reviews.author: whoamiLOL
reviews.comment_content:
If you are going to take this courses, please get prepared or learn via online platform before taking this course, cuz it is a little bit had and difficult to programming beginners.
This course covered some basic programming concept, e.g. data type, variables and scopes, branches, looping, array, File I/O.
Software used: Greenfoot (used this most of the time, including tutorial), Eclipse
reviews.comment_teaching:
Muppala is a very funny professor, he is like the god of meme, he can randomly say somethings that is interesting and I never feel bored when having his lesson.
