And that's the point even if it is online class, I think he could still interact with students without a problem. Back to the main point, I think he explained the concept quite clear, but still, better to learn more by yourself via online platform.
For the TAs, because each tutorial will have a different tutor to host the class, so it depends, some are good and some are bad (maybe because of the pronunciation, so I think it is difficult to listen what they said clearly). But overall, I think they are responsible and can response to my questions and quires very quickly.
reviews.comment_grading: Because this semester used online learning mode, so overall results and SD are not that high, SD for mid term and exam is around 60.x and 50.x, so overall 70.x and I get a B, which I think it is already a fair grade, because you know, UST, haha. Also, the mean and SD are comparatively high in previous semesters/years, so I think I am quite lucky to get a B with 70 ish in this semester.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not that heavy, I think, the workload and weighting:
-Exam: 40%
-Mid-term: 25%
-Assignment (including written assignment & programming assignment part I & II): 25%
-Tutorial: 10% (each tutorial will around 3-4 tasks, and if you had done it correct, 5 marks will be given for one tutorial)

reviews.author: K_Karson
reviews.comment_content: Basic-level programming. Greenfoot and Eclipse are major tools to use in the lab session. If you already equipped with basic knowledge of programming, this course is pretty easy for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good. Muppala is a very good teacher. He always interacts with students, which makes the lesson quite funny and not boring. If you have any programming question and facing difficulties, he can answer you very quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%),Written assignments (5%),Programming assignments (20%),Midterm examination (25%),Final exam (40%)

You can easily get full marks in Labs if you put some time and afford to finish the coding assignment before the laboratory starts.
reviews.comment_workload:
Two assignment.
Labs every week, make sure you prepare before the lesson starts.

reviews.author: An225 Mriya
reviews.title: So I somehow managed to survive??
reviews.comment_content:
Basic programming in Java (Note: not JavaScript), and also teach about basic manipulation of GreenFoot and Eclipse IDE, 2 programs for Java programming.

Topics include:
*variables
*objects and classes
*more on variables
*scopes
*expression and branching
*loops
*arrays and nested loops
*console input, file I/O
*recursion

Stack is not taught in 2020-2021 Fall

My thought is that, concepts aren't hard when you practice more on Java. Looking for some extra-curricular Java tutorials may also help. If you are really not good at programming, consider COMP1021 (really), given by the following grading information.
reviews.comment_teaching:
As an Indian (presumably from Andhra Pradesh?) lecturer, Muppala's English is peppered with heavy accent. This however, doesn't affect my understanding. After all, as he's responsive to questions asked in and after lectures, clarifications can be raised without doubt. Generally, a good lecturer.

I previously heard about that Muppala shows cat videos during lectures according to a 2014 COMP1022P review on MSSSUG, but I don't observed any cat videos being shown on lectures. (after all, it's 6 years past...)

Regarding TAs, they are supportive during labs. Some of them have heavy Chinese accent when speaking English, but are generally understandable.
reviews.comment_grading:
– Laboratories (10%)
– Assignments (5+20%)
– Midterm examination (25%) (68.5/100)
– Final exam (40%) (69/100)

As per other's said before, there will be loads of programming experts in COMP1022P. This means not only the mean is quite high, but also you'll face fierce competition.

From an optimistic perspective, as there are plenty of programming experts, you can easily ask for help if you have any conceptual problems. For example, I met an experienced French student on course Whatsapp group, and he helped me a lot on understanding scopes.

I have to say that I'm very lucky to survive in COMP1022P as a programming muggle (especially when I didn't look through course reviews before pre-enrollment). In general (and for other courses in HKUST, actually), you're in great trouble if your score is under the mean.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is 1 written assignment and 1 programming assignment for COMP1022P. You can get a good score if you can make early preparation for the 2 assignments (For example, I get full mark for the programming assignment). Workload is generally light.

There's also weekly computer labs, focusing on recent topics taught. Although for most of the time you can get easy full marks for labs, it's highly advised that you should prepare for labs early, as you won't know the difficulty of the upcoming labs (For example, a number of students and I screwed in a lab related to if/switch statements).

reviews.author: mickyli1117
reviews.comment_content: Entry-level programming. Use Greenfoot and Eclipse asJava IDE. Pretty easy if you already have programming basic.
reviews.comment_teaching: Normal, sometimes make jokes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%)
Written assignments (5%)
Programming assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (25%)
Final exam (40%)

During the final and mid-term exam, you are allowed to read notes and use the compiler, so you can get a high mark in the MC session easily. If you want a good grade, then you should work hard on the long questions as it distinguish student's level mostly.
reviews.comment_workload: There are laboratories every week, most of the time you will be assigned to group with other classmates, so please do everyone a favor by preparing the lab before it started.

reviews.author: Shady
reviews.comment_content: Fair amount of content covered. Teaching recursion to students is unnecessary. Objects and Classes, Data Types, String IO is also covered. File IO is also unnecessary.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pretty good. The professor answers the students' doubts and gives extra knowledge as well. The classes are interactive online as well.
reviews.comment_grading: Not great. The final exam is online so it is not easy to score. This may be temporary however.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very manageable. Not many assignments. Labs are also doable.
One written and one programming assignment. Both of which are easy but graded poorly.

reviews.author: Stone_
reviews.title: Extremely harsh to get a good grade
reviews.comment_content:
It's easy for 1000lv course
Not that much of Java covered, it's more like a course which talk about some fundamental concepts of high level programming.
The hardest concepts mentioned is Recursion. Array is rather straight forward to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wilfred is a great professor. He's funny and willing to answer your questions after lectures.
For TA, I recommend Wallace Mak, he's also helpful and of course, a meme enthusiastic guy who post memes on lab PowerPoints. Lmao
Course materials and lab instructions are user friendly, easy to read and understand.
Programming project is fun. More practical then exams.
reviews.comment_grading: Not good grading (there's no absolute grading). Because most students have already learned the basics of programming like for & while loop, array, conditional statements, etc. The mean or median of assignments marks or midterm exam is around 80 to 90 something. Want A? Just don't get wrong in one question... or you will fall into B or C range...
reviews.comment_workload:
Relatively small.
Depends on how you treat the subject.

reviews.author: stevennoo
reviews.comment_content:
Directory:
Topic 1: Problem-solving, algorithms and computer programming language
Topic 2: Basic programming language elements
Topic 3: Java operations
Topic 4: Checking and Selection Statements
Topic 5: Looping Statements
Topic 6: Arrays
Topic 7: Class and Objects
Topic 8: Inheritance
Topic 9: Static variables and methods
Topic 10: recursion
Topic 11: File I/O
Topic 12: Strings
Topic 13: Abstract data type: Stack and Queue
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is one of the best lecturers I've learned from. He and the TAs were very helpful in terms of teaching the materials and also answering questions. I definitely recommend taking this class when Desmond is the lecturer.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is pretty lenient as 28% of students get A range and I think no one failed the class.
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab every week, usually not that hard.
Two assignments, they were pretty challenging but doable for sure.

reviews.author: rhuaf
reviews.comment_content:
this comp course is about basic java
contains some basic grammar and algorithm
students are asked to attend every lab about once a week
and are asked to write a program about a game in greenfoot
not so hard
better for students who have known some knowledge about programming
reviews.comment_teaching:
not bad
but also not so interesting...?
in fact, i didn't listen to him very carefully

TAs would tell you almost very carefully in the labs because some of the students are not good in programming.
reviews.comment_grading:
i got b+
not bad i think
because i didn't put hard work in this course, just attended labs every week, worked on two simple assignments( but are related in fact), and prepare for the exams.
exams are not so easy because it didn't just test you programming, also some basic knowledge, which i am not so good in.
but all in all, a good course for getting good grade for students who have experience in programming.
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is not heavy
just labs, homework and exams
exam is a little difficult for people like me-- just know about programming haha
lab is easy because TAs would teach you and also help you
many people leave just in a very short time after the labs started.
attendance of the lectures are not required maybe because some people have the experience in programming
the homework is also a little easy because many functions are already written and you can just simply invoke them. just thinking about the algorithm might be a little difficult for some people. but might not be so many.

reviews.author: Seanpan
reviews.comment_content: Basic programming using java. I feel like most students are already somewhat familiar with the programming language. Content is challenging but interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Muppala's teaching is clear, he says some dad jokes here and there which I appreciate, lightens the mood quite a bit. The material covered in class is inadequate for me to finish the assignments easily, I had to look up books and watch plenty of YouTube tutorials after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is bad in my opinion, as said previously, most students are already familiar with the programming language. I was definitely in a disadvantage since it was my first time learning java.

Studied quite hard.
midterm: 95/100
final: 94/100
lab: full mark
assignments: full mark or nearly full mark?

final grade: 94.75
letter grade: b+
reviews.comment_workload: Workload isn't that heavy. A few assignments and a few lab sessions. The preparation before doing the assignments were the most tiring for me. If you're simply trying to get your hw done, then it's easy. But if you're actually trying to learn how to code in java then it will definitely require some effort.

reviews.author: J.Y
reviews.title: Difficult course for complete beginners to Java
reviews.comment_content: Content is good, complete and there is lots to learn. But it is quite fast and sometimes the concept are hard to grasp in this short time. As a beginner I struggled to understand some concepts and by that time, new concepts were being taught so it is hard to keep up.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Just basic use of a powerpoint to teach the content.
It is clear and understandable. Teaching was a little bit too fast-paced for me.
Tutorial sessions are unclear sometimes and it was quite difficult in general for me as a complete beginner to java.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is quite hard.
Many students in this course has had previous exposure to java and therefore are just relearning the same beginner concepts that they have learned in the past. I found it hard to keep up with those people and of course, the average grade tends to be higher as most of the students have a better than beginner understanding of the content even though the course is a beginner course.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework, just attend tutorials and review content in your own time. For me, reviewing the content and understanding it in my own time was difficult so I felt like it was taking up a lot of my time.

reviews.author: hylam
reviews.comment_content: Java is quite complicated as the code for simple command is very long. eg. for printing , you have to say system.out.print. Thus, you have to extremely write fast and quick in the midterm and exam in order to finish the paper. Total grade included two assignments, one midterm, one final, and lab work.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr Desmond TSOI is very funny and his teaching is interesting. the TA is good (especially Nicko Shek, and Man Ting WONG).
reviews.comment_grading: 70% in exam and midterm and final grade B+
reviews.comment_workload: Once lab work a week. Some were very difficult.

reviews.author: kyddet
reviews.title: EXTREMELY GOOD TEACHING BUT DIFFICULT FOR BEGINNERS
reviews.comment_content: Desmond teaches really useful content in the course, basically everything taught are those tools that you can apply easily (eg. loops, checking statements etc). The syllabus goes from basics to the difficult ones, so it really helps build a good foundation before moving on.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is an extremely good professor. If there was an A+ for me to choose for his teaching it would be A+. I am a programming dummy so during classes I would ask silly questions and ask him to repeat things that I could not catch up with. Desmond patiently answered my queries every time and would even stay behind class to explain more to me. The thing is he even encouraged me when I felt hopeless during the course, and I would say he has been more like a mentor than he is a professor. Desmond係科大既清泉 if you know what I mean.
reviews.comment_grading: I would be honest, I think the grading is really fair actually. If you are good at it, you get a good grade, if you are lost most of the time (like I was), you don't get a good grade. The distribution is really fair and it is not impossible to A range, but that definitely means a great deal of effort. Some students have a programming background and it is normal for them to do a bit better but then for those who don't and started from scratch, I would say it would be challenging. Yet again, I would say I never expected to get a good grade when I enrolled in the course. I just wanted to learn. So maybe if you kept this thought in mind, the grade wouldn't matter that much after all. The course is really worthy to take and the final grade is just a by-product to me. (Not gonna reveal my grade but I failed every test, think this says a lot)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is alright. Sometimes Desmond would hold make-up classes when he has to catch up with syllabus (as it is quite a lot) and the make-up classes were quite demanding to me (teaching a lot and using long hours). Yet apart from that, I would say the workload makes sense. Two programming assignments throughout the course, and if you are good at it it shouldn't take you a lot of time.

reviews.author: leongan
reviews.title: many god in this course
reviews.comment_content: The course itself is quite interesting. For me as a computer dummy, I can easily understand and follow the course guides. However, when it comes to do the assignment, I find it extremely difficult to manage and need to spend a lot of time to solve it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Wilfred's teaching is not good since he often forgot to introduce the fundamental concepts that are very important for the computer programming! The slides is too disorder and the examples are too much and complex.
reviews.comment_grading:
Desmond promised to give 28% of A range, which is very high in my opinion.
The midterm is difficult but it is fine even if you got 7x something because of the large SD.
reviews.comment_workload: A little bit light. We have 1 written homework and 1 assignment. The assignment is very easy.

reviews.author: Heliumet
reviews.title: Wonderful Course Wonderful Professor Wonderful Java
reviews.comment_content: Basically include all fundamentals of Java (variables, display and input, string and array, class and object, file I/O, recursion, stack and queue, etc) The course is well structured to make students to learn each topic step by step. Class demonstrations with interesting examples. Assignment and lab work are designed to assist extended learning from topic discussed in class.
reviews.comment_teaching: An "A" in teaching cannot describe how good Desmond is. He is definitely one of the best programming teachers I have ever met. He explains everything clearly and structure the teaching order well so that students are easier to learn. He always use a friendly tone in class to attract students to respond to him. He is also willing and capable to answer any question raised by students. Very fast response through email. He would even find extra material for you correspond to your question. After all, he is willing to give any help that can assist your learning.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% lab
20% assignment (2 in total, 10% each)
30% midterm
40% final

Although midterm and final is really not easy, but it has a low mean too (around 60% only). Meanwhile Desmond gives lenient grade, he promises 28% of A range in the class which is the highest allowed by department. Approximately 80% in overall score can guarantee you an A range. Also, there are bonus score in assignment which you can use it to compensate marks deducted in other assignment.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload of this course is not really light, but I would say that it is all reasonable. About one lab work (consists of 2 programming tasks) a week that extends the topic taught in lectures in the previous week. Each lab session lasts 2 hours. You can code in that period, but it is advised that you do it before attending so you can present your codes immediately when it is your turn. Normally each task takes around 10-15 minutes to do if you are capable, even if you are not you can find Desmond he is willing to guide you through the thinking process.

For the 2 assignment it might be a bit tough (approximately 10 working hours each). One is image processing and another is implementing a game. Desmond will hold an extra session for introducing the assignment, extra topic covered in the assignment and tips that might be helpful in doing it. Normally up to 1 month is allowed for an assignment so you will get sufficient time to make your progress.

reviews.author: Louis Liang
reviews.title: A good course with a great instructor
reviews.comment_content:
Directory:
Topic1:
Problem solving, algorithms and coputer programming language
Topic2:
Basic programming language elements
Topic3:
Java operations
Topic4:
Checking and Selection Statements
Topic5:
Looping Statements
Topic6:
Arrays
Topic7:
Class and Objects
Topic8:
Inheritance
Topic9:
Static variables and methods
Topic10:
recursion
Topic11:
File I/O
Topic12:
Strings
Topic13:
Abstract data type:Stack and Queue
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond is God !
Desmond is God !
Desmond is God !
Desmond is really kind and humorous. You will never feel bored if you listen carefully because Desmond can always explain things clearly using interesting examples.
If you have any question, email Desmond and he will definitely reply to you within several hours.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good and fair grading.
It is lucky to have so many A-ranges in this non-honor class.
reviews.comment_workload: For students with a better understanding (or with some background knowlege), the workload is appropriate. But maybe for some people who are not good at programming, it may be a little bit heavy ?

reviews.author: hwli
reviews.title: A harsh-grading introductory course for students who are new to programming
reviews.comment_content: The course introduces basic java programming language such as arrays, objects and classes, variables, branching, loops, scopes etc. The course uses Greenfoot as the platform for teaching, demonstrating programming instructions using Picobot object. It is quite interesting for me as the concepts are not very complicated.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Ng taught very clearly with examples like MTR tickets or fares. From what I assumed he is a local professor so he can answer questions in Chinese or English. The TA in labs are also very helpful and guarantee that you can finish every lab assignments.
reviews.comment_grading: I got B+ in the course with 0.5 S.D above mean. Due to the closure of the University in the Fall Semester, the final exam becomes a home-taken exam and thus the mean is quite high, 88/100 to be exact. I got full mark in every assignment and 94/100 total in the course total and got a B+. Therefore, if you are not an expert in java programming, I would advise you not to take this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair. If you want to leave early in labs, you could do it at home first as the lab manual are usually released at the start of every week. In addition to labs, there is also a paper assignment about basic programming and a programming assignment using Greenfoot. The mid-term exam consists of MCQs, a long question which requires you to fill in the missing codes.

reviews.author: PiGi
reviews.title: "Desmond is a good guy"
reviews.comment_content:
1: Course logistics
2: Intro
3: Variables
4: Operations
5: Checking and Selection statements
6: Looping Statements
7: Arrays
8: Classes and Objects
9: Inheritance
10: Static variables and methods
11: Recursion
12: File I/O
13: Abstract Data types, Strings
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great at teaching. Slower pace to ensure everyone can understand what he says.

Teaches through examples, not by reading off a textbook!

Very approachable!
Responds to queries very quickly and also gives detailed explanations.

He has his own site where he provides additional materials if you need it!

TAs are also very helpful and approachable. Through zoom, they invite you into breakout rooms in lab sessions where you can ask one-on-one if you have any questions during/after your lab demo.
reviews.comment_grading:
He guarantees the top 25% will get A range - so do not need to be afraid of those students who already have prior experience with java.

Midterm:30% {Mean: 62.25, StDev: 17.26}
Labs: 10%
Final Exam: 40% {Mean: 52.37, StDev: 19.50}
Assignments: 20% {10% each}
reviews.comment_workload:
Weekly Labs (Total 9 Labs) - Pretty easy: There are two tasks for each lab session. They provide two sample tasks and their solutions to understand the logic to-be-applied behind the lab tasks, after which you can approach the actual lab tasks (with ease!)

2 Programming Assignments (They guide you through each task in the assignment) (Avoid keeping it for submission date...)

2 50-min Lectures per week: Concise. Ends lecture with a summary slide to ensure you understand everything.

reviews.author: Phil7
reviews.comment_content:
Key Concepts Covered
1. Basic data types, variables, assignment statements, console I/O
2. Arithmetic expressions, Boolean expressions
3. Checking & selection statements, looping statements
4. Arrays
5. Classes and objects, properties and methods
6. Inheritance
7. Static variables and methods
8. Primitive types and reference types
9. Scope rules
10. Recursion
11. File I/O
12. String manipulations
13. Abstract data types (stack and queue)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond is funny and patient.
He teaches very detailedly with lots of examples
So even if you are not familiar with programming, you can still understand his content.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is bad if you did not spend a lot time on the addition exercise they provide.
Because most of the students enrolled actually got very high scores in all of the assessment, the mean is super high!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
10 lab
Two programming assignment only, each may take 5-8 hours.

HOWEVER, you should spend time on the written exercise and past paper they provide, otherwise you can't finish all the questions in midterm or final

reviews.author: Celina_jr
reviews.title: Meaningless Final
reviews.comment_content: Introducing you to programming using Java. It's quite some to learn if you are new to programming but if you are familiar with it then whatever. Do remember to stick to the slides.
reviews.comment_teaching: Muppala is a cute professor! Seniors told me he played videos of kittens before the classes started and although this term he didn't he is still really nice a prof. (Don't be scared by the long name he is really nice)
reviews.comment_grading:
I guess this is a curve grading... My total mark is around 96 or so and I thought this will give a A or above.... However only a A- given, sad:(

By the way the final exam is totally meaningless
reviews.comment_workload: Fine. the lab preparation will be long if you are new to programming.

reviews.author: kwan1997
reviews.title: 簡單course,有底會著數
reviews.comment_content:
呢個course mid term之前的教學内容都比較簡單, mt後就會難小小.
但係因為很多人簡得呢科都係有底,所以個mean很高.如果你之前有學過其實連lecture都可以吾使上. lab就一定要上,因為佢會計attendance出席分,lab内容都較简單,都係跟住佢step做就沒問題,pre lab 都吾駛.
reviews.comment_teaching: 啊sir都教得幾好,是有D悶.
reviews.comment_grading:
但係因為很多人簡得呢一科都係有底,所以個mean會好高.
midterm:mean=83
final:mean=88
reviews.comment_workload: 工作量就吾算好大,兩個assignment,第二個assignment就比較煩,會整個game出黎,但你只要跟住佢step&guideline整都沒咩難度.

reviews.author: JessicaMoon
reviews.title: 冇學過programming入黎會比人屈晒機
reviews.comment_content: 冇學過programming入黎會比人屈晒機，個course內容都幾多但冇底好難追
reviews.comment_teaching:
聽得好辛苦,講得都幾快同埋口音好難聽所以冇聽過書咁濟唔係好知教成點
powerpoint唔係好知佢講咩
reviews.comment_grading:
20%programming assignment
5%written assignment
5% lab
25% midterm
35%final
~below mean少少 C+
reviews.comment_workload:
1 written assignment and 1 programming assignment
programming assignment如果冇底會做得好辛苦

reviews.author: thebusranger
reviews.comment_content:
Typical java stuff, very difficult for a program beginer.
Include loops,recursion, if-else statements etc

Content is basic, but questions for hw and exam are fucking difficult!

You will end up in hell like me if u suck at programming as a lot of students from mainland and foreign countries will smash you into pieces.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wifred is ok, he is willing to answer student question, although I don't know what they are talking about.
TA are nice and they help me a lot
reviews.comment_grading:
Very harsh.
For a begineer like me and know nothing about programming, I think getting 60-70% is maximum( probably a C range). I heard ppl that getting A range is so damn difficult since mean is very high in mid term and final.
reviews.comment_workload:
For ppl like me, need to always refresh your knowledge, workload is much more than others.

Fortunately this course has a lot of resources to help, but still hard for a begineer to catch up everything.

1 written homework, 1 programming assignment and lab exercises

reviews.author: 78!!!aaaslm
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge of Java.
0~logistics
1~Intro to problem-solving and computer programming
2~Basic programming language elements
3~Java operations
4~Java checking and selection statements
5~Java looping statements
6~Java arrays
7~Java classes and objects
8~Java inheritance
9~Java static variables and methods
10~Java recursion
11~Java file I/O
12~Java Strings
reviews.comment_teaching: Taught too slow
reviews.comment_grading: Not difficult to get B+ if you have programming experience. But still, you need to work hard to get a good grade
reviews.comment_workload:
One lab per week, one written assignment, two programming assignment.
No attendance will be taken in lectures

reviews.author: Claudia Lau
reviews.comment_content:
difficult for beginners
easy in the beginning but start from 2nd lesson it suddenly jumps into writing code which is difficult for beginners like me to follow what is going on
reviews.comment_teaching:
he teaches well but sometimes jump a bit and its hard to follow sometimes
I didn't ask much questions coz I don't even understand what is the tutor talking about
reviews.comment_grading: I don's understand at all so I get low grades in the exam
reviews.comment_workload:
not much homework, only a few assignments
more work has to be done after the course

reviews.author: Turtle~~
reviews.title: Pretty easy for those who learnt Java before
reviews.comment_content:
It covers almost all the basics of Java programming that a new programmers should know. It starts from zero so don't worry if you do not have any programming experience before.

The contents are as follows:
Simple introduction to hardware and software
Data types and Variables
Scope of variables
Control flow(if branches, while loop for loop...)
Class and object
Inheritance
Simple I/O
Recursion
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Muppala often tell us some jokes during lecture. He is more like telling us the full story of computer science rather than Java programming. The PowerPoint is clear and if you have any question you can just ask him during lesson. Things are easy to understand. If you have Java programming experience you can even skip some of the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is harsh, since many students have programming experience.

My overall score is 96.6/100 and I can only get A-

Assignments and exams are easy though, I got full marks in all assignments.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light.

Only one written assignment and two programming assignments are required.

All of them are very easy, you can get full mark effortlessly, prepare well for your exam and then you should be safe for A range.

reviews.author: Nico E
reviews.comment_content: Basic programing content, variable types (char, string, Boolean... Etc), loops (if... Else, do... While), instance variables, recursion, string manipulation (reading and writing from/to a txt file)
reviews.comment_teaching: Always reading from a ppt slide, so it's easy to self study (slides are uploaded to course website)
reviews.comment_grading: Mean for midterm and final exam are very high (many people get 100%) so even a final grade of above 90% does not guarantee an A
reviews.comment_workload: Labs are useless, can be completed ahead of time in 15 minutes to save yourself time. Written assignment and programming assignments take very little time but you need to ensure you get 100%

reviews.author: mallu
reviews.title: COMP1022P
reviews.comment_content:
Content is pretty standard for someone with a basic computer science knowledge, however if you have never done computer science before, it is a struggle to learn and I would suggest doing a more straight forward language like python.

Topics Learnt:
Hardware and software
Basic data types, variables, assignment statements
Objects and classes
Methods and scope rules
Arithmetic and Boolean expressions
Branching statements
Loops
1D and 2D Arrays
String and File I/O
Console I/O
Recursion
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor actually tries to make an effort to make the classes interesting.  He is always ready to answer whatever questions we have and is definitely helpful in making the course that much more easier.
reviews.comment_grading:
Many people who have done this language before still take this course even though it is an Intro course. That really messes up the mean and sd.

Labs and Assignments not that hard to get full marks in. The exams though do mess you up.
92.15 Overall gets you a B+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload isnt too high at all, labs can be finished in 15-20 mins and the assignments can be done in 2-3 hours if you just manage your time wisely.

reviews.author: Sahab
reviews.title: It's OK
reviews.comment_content:
The following topics will be taught:
1. Introduction to Computers: Hardware and Software
2. Elementary Programming (Variables, Data Types, Assignment statements, Console I/O)
3. Objects and Classes
4. Variables and Scopes
5. Expression and Branching Statements
Midterm
6. Loops
7. Arrays and Nested Loops
8. Console I/O
9. String Manipulation and File I/O
10. Recursion
Final

In general, the teaching materials are self-explanatory to those who have studied programming, especially in Java language, as they are only basic concepts. Those who didn't may find it difficult to understand. I personally studied programming in high school, but not in Java, still finding it alright.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. is very willing to answer questions, and explain the course materials very well.
The lab assistant is also very kind and always guide us through lab work. (using ppts with memes) Just ask whenever you need and you will get a detail explanation.
reviews.comment_grading:
As you may have heard, the mean of this course is very high, because many who take this course have rich programming experience.

The exam MC questions are very tricky. You will easily lose marks if you are a tad bit not familiar with Java. Some tricky parts are not covered in lessons so it's important to complete as many past papers as possible.

It is easy to score high marks in assignments, as long as you spare more time to complete them.

Attendance of labs and lab work also count towards the final grade, but they are easy to complete under the TAs' guidance.

My scores:
Written assignment: 46/50
Programming Assignment part 1: 100/100
Programming Assignment part 2: 100/100
Midterm: 97/100 (Mean: 88)
Finals: 98/100

Side note: due to social unrest, the final exam is changed to an online quiz on Canvas, consisting 50 MC questions, so it's basically an open book exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is manageable. One written assignment, one programming assignment separated into two parts and weekly lab.
Be sure to spare more time to complete the programming assignment; deadline seems farther than it is.

reviews.author: HoHoHarry
reviews.comment_content:
Simple syntax in java and basic concepts in programming such as data types and variables, Objects and classes...

The course started with the idea of classes and objects, which was quite hard to follow for a freshman in programming. I only figured it out after doing the first written assignment.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred' s teaching is clear, a lot of examples, and he is patient to answer all weird questions in the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
The general assessment (100%)
- Laboratories (10%)
- Written assignments (5%)
- Programming assignments (20%)
- Midterm examination (25%)
- Final exam (40%)

Just finished online final on Canvas, mean is 87.8
you have to be very careful to avoid mistakes to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
For the content, everything becomes easy to follow if you understand the idea of class and object, the syntax will be given in the exam.

The Written assignments and Picobot Programming assignments  take a lot of time. They are very helpful to understand the content.

Have to attempt a lab every week.

reviews.author: RyanZ
reviews.title: Nice course overall
reviews.comment_content:
Great content, just basic overview of Java programming.
But one chapter was missing due to the online course since mid November.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Wilfred’s teaching is both humorous and insightful, I sat in the first row and I was able to ask questions all the time. Even during the online course period, he and the TA Wallace are very reachable.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not sure yet.
I got 95 in the midterm and 96 in the final.
(now the grade is out, my final score was 95.6 but i only got a A-. The exams were way too easy so you must make literally no mistake to get A or A+)
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is really light. The lab might take some time.
Do make sure you prepare well for the exams, pass papers are really helpful.

reviews.author: smackbam
reviews.comment_content: The content is fairly straightforward. It covers most basic principles of Java. Initially uses Greenfoot to support learning, then uses Eclipse in the second half of the course. All lecture powerpoints are provided.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor was good and occasionally funny. Managed to cover all content before mid-terms and finals. He was helpful and would happily answer all questions when raised in class. TAs are also helpful in lab sessions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is alright. Most people in the class are experts in Java and will get close to full marks. Exams are fairly straightforward.

Laboratories (10%)
Written assignments (5%)
Programming assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (25%)
Final exam (40%)
reviews.comment_workload: There were only 2 assignments and a few lab sessions. Straightforward.

reviews.author: 13ruc3
reviews.comment_content: The content is designed properly and easy. If you got any coding experience before, it'll be great for you to review a little bit and dive into java and oop. Some questions tend to be tricky, but only some.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching is logical and clear,
and you can download his powerpoint anytime
reviews.comment_grading:
No attendance point
10% lab (i guarantee you, just dont miss any lab)
5% written assignment (you can even use your computer to test it)
20% programming assignments (two related projects on greenfoot, no puzzles)
25% mid (for test, just read the ppt patiently)
40% final
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. Less than one hour per week (for lab); for the two assignments, you can deal with them in three hours in total. Just be patient in every assignment for minor errors.

reviews.author: qpwegf
reviews.comment_content: Basic Java knowledge, ranging from simple variable declaration to more complicated concepts such as recursion (the root of all evil in this course). Each topic is covered in adequate length, with pretty much all essentials. As long as you pay attention during the lectures, and skim through notes before exams, you'll most likely do well.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is a really good professor.  The speed of the class is rather slow and he will explain the material clearly. And if you have any questions, you can send him email. Most of the time he will reply quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
~25% A range for Desmond. Need I say more?
The exams are somewhat difficult, where the mean is usually around 50-60%. However as long as you bring in notes (allowed) into exams, and go through the material prior to walking in the exam venue, you'll most likely do well.

Note: Pay particular attention to recursion in your finals
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Lab per week, which can usually be done within 15 mins, and you can do it before the lab session. No big deal here.

2 Assignments total, and they're pretty hefty. They usually require a lot of thinking, a lot of asking around (be careful for accusations of plagarism when asking your peers), and also occasional visits to Desmond's office (often packed). But Desmond does give enough time for you to complete them, so not much problem here.

reviews.author: Keita
reviews.title: Hard for beginner
reviews.comment_content: This course cover the basic of Java. It's easy for experienced programmer, but maybe not for the beginner. I saw many students asking questions to professor after classes. On the other hand, the class was too easy for me and my friends having experience of programming. In this course, we used a software called greenfoot to get familiar with programming, which I think it's useless because it is making even difficult to understand the Java programming. There are more memorisation than Python course, but once u memorised it will be easier than Python course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is okay. Slides are quite informative, so for the experienced programmer students, no need to go to the classes, just read through the slides before exam and you will be alright.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite harsh, since there are many experienced programmer in this course, the average is quite high. You need to get 100 for all the assignments and exams in order to get A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light. Hardly any assignment, labs are very easy, you can finish it in 30 minutes. I think 1 credit bridging course has more workload than this course.

reviews.author: Parth
reviews.title: Good course if you know some programming
reviews.comment_content: It starts with elementary programming in the picobot application in greenfoot and slowly progresses into more complicated java programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is pretty good, the professor and lab instructors are both very open to questions after and during the class. In class teaching is clear and not very hard to follow if you have some programming background.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is difficult as the class has a lot of people who are already very experienced in Java, so getting a high grade is quite challenging as a first timer.
reviews.comment_workload: Not that much workload, the labs are pretty straightforward and can be done in less than the stipulated time. However, it will be very difficult without a programming background. If you don't have any experience with programming languages you will have to put in a lot more work to keep up.

reviews.author: chriswong
reviews.title: 冇program 底唔好入
reviews.comment_content:
Java language intro course
呢個course 係俾啲有讀過program 既人讀
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture 正正常常
但預左要搵人教 因為啲note skip左好多野
佢已經當你有基本知識
淨係靠note自學根本冇可能
Lab都好啲 佢肯慢慢一步一步教
但時間唔多 所以都係學唔哂
reviews.comment_grading:
勁人多的是 95%都係得個A
5x%多數c range
mean係8x%
所以都係果句 冇底唔好讀
得一個sem時間 係冇可能追得到所有野
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload大唔大好難講
一星期一堂lab
如果你咁啱有program 底/source 就輕鬆
但如果你係0基礎0概念
唔洗去到midterm 淨係一個lab都可以玩死你
仲有兩份功課又係同樣道理

reviews.author: Shreyas
reviews.comment_content: Very useful introductory material in Java and OOP. Also covered data structures (linked lists, hash tables, etc.) with interesting and relevant applications. All material was posted online.
reviews.comment_teaching: Course was taught at a good pace, mostly lecture with coding projects to do in your own. Prof does a great job explaining all concepts throughly and the slides have good visuals to supplement explanations.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was fair, for projects as long as the code does what they ask you will get a good grade. Exams are graded more strictly when it comes to syntax errors and stuff but nothing excessive.
reviews.comment_workload: About 4 major projects

reviews.author: Rickykoo
reviews.title: Not easy to learn
reviews.comment_content:
this course is suitable for the computer expert.
A lot of experts got full mark in mid-term.
If you didn't learn java, you need to be hard work.
Even the introduction of this course said that it is basic java programming, it is still not easy to understand the algorithm in the java world.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor Ng is a nice and patient guy. He will care for everyone in this course. Always make jokes with students.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 cases:
1.
in class work 10%
2*assignment 20%
midterm 30% + final 40%
2.
in class work 10%
2*assignment 20%
final 70%

the midterm and final exam is an open book exam.
You can bring your notes and hand paper to the exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much. In-class work once a week.
But the assignment is really difficult. Even I find my CS's friend to teach me. It can still not to get a better grading.

reviews.author: LucyLai
reviews.comment_content: a great introduction to the Java language, teaching basic computer language concepts and how to use Java to execute some simple tasks
reviews.comment_teaching: precise teaching and easy to understand. there are usually many in-class examples and demonstrations for students. also in the lab, the TAs will demonstrate the lab work for students to follow so students do not get behind
reviews.comment_grading: average grading, if do not have major problems in your lab session. the average grade will be around B range
reviews.comment_workload: low workload, labs are relatively simple, only need to finish the lab work every week

reviews.author: Alecton
reviews.title: Desmond is really a good guy!!!
reviews.comment_content: really really basic
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is really a good guy! The teaching method is definitely awesome. The classes are never boring or tedious . The explanation is thorough and vigorous. And if you have any questions, Desmond will reply at earliest convenience! What a good guy!!!😍😍😍
reviews.comment_grading: Unfortunately I didn't get A+
reviews.comment_workload: The lab work every week can be finished within an hour or two so there is nothing to be afraid of. The two assignments are a little bit harder but Desmond and the TAs will give you a lot of instructions and help. To be honest, it is not so easy especially for the second assignment. But you will have plenty of time to prepare and you can also ask for some help from others. So finally, your assignment should be nearly full mark if you pay some attention to this course.

reviews.author: popsicle
reviews.title: really nice teacher, TA and grade
reviews.comment_content:
Elementary Programming
data types, classes, identifiers, objects and instance variables, constructors methods, arithmetic expressions,
branching statements(if-else, switch), loop
1D and 2D array
character strings and File I/O
Event-driven programming and GUI
recursion
abstract data types
reviews.comment_teaching:
online mooc has everything and face-to-face class is repetition of what he had already taught in online mooc. But you still need to attend and do the in-class activities(usually the prof assigns you to a certain group and you finish the activities in the group)and kahoo quiz(individual-based and you can win bonus through this). If you dont attend, your in-class activities will be 0. Actually those activities are not hard at all and if you still cant solve,just ask TA
Teacher is really nice and even gave us cookies every facetoface class
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme                          
Online activities (10%)            
In-class activities (10%)
Labs (10%)
Project (10%)                                                                 
Midterm Exam (20%)                      
Final Exam (40 %）                         
me：full mark in labs, project  and in-class activities(almost everyone has 100 on these items)   
82 out of 100 in midterm(about 1 sd above mean)
86 out of 100 in final(no statistics on mean and sd)
online activities 96 out of 100(almost everyone has 100)           
total 91 out of 100
final grade:A-                
mt and final papers are almost the same with the past paper he gave(both question types and degree of difficulty) ,but some numbers are changed
reviews.comment_workload:
much lower than fall sem and spring sem
Lots of primary or middle school kids because it's their summer experience program
Also lots of exchange students
much less competitors and dont have to be 99/98 to get A range
Perfect for non-engineering school students
The only thing you need for this course is CIRCUMSPECTION coz it's not hard but easy to make foolish mistakes

reviews.author: 肯尼含
reviews.comment_content:
Started the course from basic algorithms & loops, and extended to classes of Java.
It is a quite organized learning pathway for a beginner.

Overall, "class" is an important concept which is a little bit hard to understand, but it is really useful to recognize "class" at the very beginning.

Part 1 (midterm & final)
Ch 1 Problem solving
Ch 2 Primitive data types and arithmetic expressions
Ch 3 Object-oriented programming basics
Ch 4 Branching and loops
Ch 5 Arrays

Part 2 (Final)
Ch 6 String manipulation
Ch 7 File I/O
Ch 8 Simple event-driven programming
Ch 9 Recursion
Ch 10 Abstract data types
reviews.comment_teaching:
A great professor with strong passion in teaching.
Although it is an online course (LX), you can still easily find the TAs and professor if you have questions.

Professor Pong designed this course really well so that you can learn a lot and get good grades if you just follow his instructions and finish all the practices on your own (not copying others).
You will find out coding is really interesting in his course!
reviews.comment_grading:
Won't get a bad grade if you complete all the HW and labs.
The midterm and final will be easy for you if you review all the contents again before the exam.

It is counted on HW, labs, projects, and exams.
You can complete the HW alone and no need to watch the course videos if you are already good enough.
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable.
The content is not that hard.
Many students complete all the tasks in one week ahead the deadline, and it is NOT SUGGESTED.

Since LX does not have a regular time slot, lots of people will forget to study it on a weekly basis.
Spending a few hours per week to watch the course videos can prevent you from staying up late before the exam.

reviews.author: Jakob Kallestad
reviews.comment_content:
Was pretty okay. Learned the basics, loops, variables, types.
Also touched on scope, some input/output methods and all the other java concepts. Java is a good language to learn and therefore I recommend this course. Also lightly touched on some OOP principles near the end of the semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good instructor,. He told the content of the course in a clear and fun way. No complaints here
reviews.comment_grading: I felt that it was quite fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite easy course to be honest. To be excpected of an introductory course. Assignments were quick to complete

reviews.author: Anlu
reviews.comment_content: Introduction to Java, it was hard for me to understand at first because I have 0 prior knowledge in coding. So the assignment and lab really helped me understand the contents a lot better.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is very nice and always tries to make the lesson interesting. Always helpful when you have any questions about the material.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: Below mean 20 marks
Final: Above mean 15 marks

In the end got a B, pretty happy with the results as it seems like everyone who takes this course already knows Java.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much.

reviews.author: cfyan
reviews.comment_content:
Online lessons using HKMOOC platform
5 modules (multiple sub-sections with videos) before midterm
unlock another 5 after midterms

ONLINE MODE IS A HUGE TIME-SAVER FOR THOSE WHO KNOWS THE MATERIALS ALREADY
reviews.comment_teaching:
Videos are boring but short.
if you know how to write a simple program (using whatever language) already, just watch the videos w/ 2x speed.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online activities (10%) [a few online questions: MC / what is the output of...]
Labs (10%) [programming assignment]
Project (10%) [final assignment with 4 small parts]
Midterm Exam (30%)
Final Exam (40 %)

Exams are with normal class
MT 98%
Final 95.5%
Others 100%?
Total ~97% A+
reviews.comment_workload:
7 out of 10 modules have a simple programming assignment(lab). Write the code online and it will execute on server and return the grade. You can submit multiple times with a limit for each question (3~10times)
Final project is a game but you only need to complete 4 parts (4 functions with so many hints) just like assignments.

reviews.author: kalung
reviews.title: Don't take this unless you have some background knowledge
reviews.comment_content:
(before midterm)
Uses greenfoot to teach some basic stuff like
Static
Void return type
Variables
Public private protected
Classes(subclass superclass)
datatypes(int string char)
loop(for while do...while switch)
constructor(object)
and such
(after midterm)
Switch to use eclipse to teach like
import java package
(java.util.scanner java.io.printwriter)
IOException (try catch)
abstract datatypes(stack)
Return type(recursion)
Other stuff forgotten already......
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture no attendance required(at least for my session)
SANDER's speech is quite easy to understand and follow
His teaching material isnt hard to swallow as well
Strongly suggest to attend his lecture
P.s. Remember to ask question if you find it hard to understand his notes
reviews.comment_grading:
Here comes the terrible part......

Greenfoot content is easy but both midterm and final won't test anything about greenfoot
Getting used to greenfoot GUI will just bring more confusion to the exam question(but you have to finish your assignment in greenfoot)

The reason I told you to ask him question if you can't understand his notes is because the notes just cover the basic concept.....exam is far more challenging...
If you think his notes is hard then congratulations....you can forgot you have taken this course and go enjoy your life

My suggestion for those who have some prior knowledge in computing....play around with the IDE.....it might be the best way to learn and revise

Grading : since there's always some expert taking this course.....you can imagine your grade won't be too great...but with time and hardwork this course is still acceptable.
reviews.comment_workload:
LAB every week(require you to attend there and show your result)
A two part assignment to make a game(based on greenfoot)(require plenty of time to finish)

===========================
If you manage to read here....sorry for my 1999 english.....here is some way to make your comp1022p feel less painful(for me at least)
1.attend the lecture only if you don't understand the item in that lecture notes.other time you can just find a place.... sit down and try typing some code...is better than just listen
2.lab only require you to show your result and the mark will be given.....so if you have time you can always prepared the lab and write the code before the lab .....just show the code to ta and leave
3.remember to check for semicolon....

reviews.author: ubiboosted
reviews.comment_content:
Simple Java programming:
Here are the teaching content:
0~logistics
1~Intro to problem-solving and computer programming
2~Basic programming language elements
3~Java operations
4~Java checking and selection statements
5~Java looping statements
6~Java arrays
7~Java classes and objects
8~Java inheritance
9~Java static variables and methods
10~Java recursion
11~Java file I/O
12~Java Strings
At the end of the course, you should be able to write some simple programs to deal with daily issues.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor NG tries his best to utilize modern/ relatable examples to capture students interest, however, he is still slightly boring. In any case, the relevant content can be learned solely through slides, you do not need to attend a single lecture to get a decent grade. The course might get a bit confusing as they tend to go into a lot of detail about each function.
reviews.comment_grading: Although a lot of people say this course is full of experts (which is true), as long as you pay attention to class/ read the notes carefully and double check your work (midterm, final, and programming assignments) for mistakes then you should be fine. That being said, both the mean and SD are pretty high so any mistake you make may have a huge effect on your grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is relatively standard as long as you understand the basic concepts and are careful with assignments.

reviews.author: Jaymi
reviews.title: great if you're experienced, not the best grade bc some people get full marks
reviews.comment_content:
- if you are an ICT student, you're going to understand everything
- if you're a beginner, it may be hard to understand the concepts, better find someone to carry/teach you
- better yet, go online to search for free java courses, you can learn everything there
- basic programming concepts and loops are taught
- greenfoot and eclipse are used for java programming
reviews.comment_teaching:
- wilfred's english is, quite frankly, shit
- everything he says basically goes through my head. but engineering teachers generally teach badly, so it is expected
- he is friendly and will make (poor) jokes, also willing to answer your questions in details
- teaching pace is quite fast for a beginner
- no attendance needed, i skipped pretty much all lessons as i find that i cannot focus in class with his teaching style
reviews.comment_grading:
not much studying is needed because as you know, comp is a very hands-on practice heavy course. if you understand the concepts and can perform well in labs and can do the past papers well without any assistance, then you should not have to memorize many things

grading may not be that good bc as always, some people will get full mark in exams. it is not absolute grading but cumulative

- midterm : 89/100
- final : 84/100
(above mean ~10 marks in both exams)
- assignment : 200/200
reviews.comment_workload:
- lab every week, you can usually leave within 15-20 mins if you've done the lab before class
- lab is easy
- one assignment, this sem we have to do a mastermind game with greenfoot (i personally dislike greenfoot but the project is still easy to do)
- have an entire month to do the assignment, i did it leisurely and got it done in 2 weeks

reviews.author: grateful grade
reviews.comment_content:
I'm a Lecture X student, so all of my course content is delivered through an online platform.
Here is the teaching content:
0~logistics
1~Intro to problem-solving and computer programming
2~Basic programming language elements
3~Java operations
4~Java checking and selection statements
5~Java looping statements
6~Java arrays
7~Java classes and objects
8~Java inheritance
9~Java static variables and methods
10~Java recursion
11~Java file I/O
12~Java Strings
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecture videos produced by TC Pong is very slow and boring. I used 1.25x or 1.5x to play the video in order not to fall asleep when watching them.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Activities 10%
Lab 10%
Project 10%
Mid-term exam 30%
Final Exam 40%
For grading, online course students have a higher mean than regular students but for the bell curve, it is going to be mixed with all students from a different section. But the mean is pretty high and it is pretty hard for students without a prior programming background.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is heavy since there are online graded problem sets and a lab assignment every week and for LX student. We do not have TA or instructor to help our lab section so if you do not have friends that are really good at Java or do not have prior programming background it is gonna be very difficult for you. The TA is not helpful at all because looking for him in hkust is already a challenge in itself. I suggest that you go to GitHub and search for some sources in past years as a reference for most of the project becuase it used to be hkust summer course.

reviews.author: mlololoer
reviews.comment_content: OOP, Scope, Loops, Shortcut operators, Subclasses, Strings, File I/O, Recursion, ADTs
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecture videos were ok, though I felt that beginners might find them difficult to follow. Note that unlike the non-LX session, the LX session uses BlueJ rather than Greenfoot.
reviews.comment_grading: Thanks to the high mean, you have to do really well to hope to get into the A range of this course. There are a lot of students who already know Java yet still take this course.
reviews.comment_workload: As long as you keep up with the lecture videos and don't leave the lab assignments to the last minute, the workload should be alright. Best part of the LX session is that you can view the lectures and do the labs whenever you like. But the workload might seem larger if you're a beginner to comp sci since you only have lecture videos to get help from. Also note that there are some Github resources you can look up to use as a reference in completing the labs if you're having some trouble with them.

reviews.author: Brrian
reviews.title: Thats was a good one
reviews.comment_content:
Module 01 - Course Overview
Module 02 - Programming Fundamentals
Module 03 - Object-oriented Programming
Module 04 - Scope Rules, Boolean Expressions and Branching Module 05 - Loops, Shortcut Operators, Arrays
Module 06 - Introduction to OOP, Subclass, Multidimensional
Module 07 - Character String, File I/O
Module 08 - Simple Event Driven Programming and GUI
Module 09 - Recursion
Module 10 - Abstract data type (ADT), Eclipse

As I attended LX (online session) everything is pre-recorded earlier and some chapters (eg: event driven programming) may not appear in exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
LX teaching and TC teaching are great.

First of all, LX are online session which you can rewatch every video that you think you are not familiar with, which is really good for beginners. Although TC has Hong Kong scent English, he can explained detail of many chapters well.

Only downside is that as video are prerecorded, the information created there may not be up to date (eg. the comments of some online activities are not for yours, but only for students few years before, but that's not a large portion)

Another advantage (whether or not an advantage depends on how you think) is that you can learn more than other lecture session as this course have some removed material these years, some topics will only be taught in LX (Event driven programming, gui). Recursion and ADT are also harder than other session), you will be more prepared with the exam.

There is also an online discussion area for us to discuss with other classmates and teaching team. We can ask question about concept taught on lesson as well as asking help on labs :D

Oh and according to TC, LX mid term score are a lot higher than the average of all session.
All session average in mid term and sd:
avg = 78, s.d. = 20
LX's average in mid term and sd:
avg = 84, s.d.= 16
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Activities 10%
Lab 10%
Project 10%
Mid-term exam 30%
Final Exam 40%

This is what I got:
Online Activities 10/10
Lab 9.1/10 (so idiot that I accidentally submitted the demo back to the TA and I still got a 0.1 mark out of 1 on that lab)
Project 10/10
Mid-term exam 28.8/30
Final Exam 37.6/40

Overall 95.5/100, Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: Since LX is an online course with no fixed timetable, self-discipline is very important. You cannot really rush at the very last day on lab submission. (There is a deadline on lab submission. Module 1-5 shall submit before mid-term, Module 6-10 shall submit before exam). Your workload depends on your learning progress. It can be relaxing if you learned something before, as you may tried to skip videos and directly finish online activities and labs.

reviews.author: 1194tom
reviews.title: SUPERB nice and helpful professor!!!
reviews.comment_content: The content is fair, not much. Actually, we finished all the lecture notes 2 weeks earlier, so we got so many time for doing revision during the lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mr. Pedro is Super super nice!! He is such a patient teacher, ever sometimes I ask some simple questions, he will still explain it in details. I truly recommend you to attend his lecture, you will definitely learn so much through his classes. (I will give him S grade for teaching actually)
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the mean is quite high around 75-80/100 in total since many students they got a full mark in both lab tasks and assignments and the mean score of the mid-term and final are around 75-76%.

My score: Lab tasks & assignments:100/100
                 mid-term:90/100
                 Final exam:91/100
                Total:93.4/100
Grade:A- (WTF)
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload, just a lab class per week and 2 assignments. Both are super easy to get a full mark.

reviews.author: Maxlazy
reviews.comment_content: Quite good for a beginner to learn java. This course covers necessary introductions to the fundamental grammar of java language.
reviews.comment_teaching: A little bit boring. The teacher just read the ppt in front of us.
reviews.comment_grading: Since the polarization is severe, students should prepare well and be careful enough when doing the exam paper if they want to get an A range. And it was particularly hard to get an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Bellow average. Students can finish the lab assignment beforehand, which is quite easy. But the final assignment was quite complicated; students should plan their time in advance.

reviews.author: Dani
reviews.comment_content: The content are well written it is clear and we learn about array, recursion, etc and TC POng will make sure that we learn java step by step
reviews.comment_teaching: FOr LX the teaching is done through online video platform and all lab sections are uploaded to hkmooc. THe video teaching is pretty clear but it is going to be a little bit different than regular course as we are using Bluej instead of greenfoot.
reviews.comment_grading: For grading online course students have higher mean than regular students but for the bell curve it is going to be mixed with alll sutdents from different section. But the mean is pretty high and it is pretty hard for students without prior programming background
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is heavy as there are lab assignment every weeek and for LX student. We do not have TA or instructtor to help our lab section so if you do not have friends that are really good at java or do not have prior programming background it is not going to be easy for you. The TA is not the most helppful as finding him is a challenge in itself. I personally have to go to tutorial space to ask question but for a little bit of tips you can use github as a reference for most of the project and it use to be hkust summercourse

reviews.author: BillFung1412
reviews.comment_content:
If you don't have experience in programming, don't take this course.

The first tool for this course is Greenfoot and this software is not user-friendly. The structure of 1022p is wired, in my own opinion.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred is nice to answer all your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term: 91/100 mean:7X%
Lab+assignment: 100%
Final: 92.5/100 mean: 7X%
total score: 94.3%
Grade: A

Some friend told me that I need 95% of the total score to get A-. Maybe that depends on the instructor?
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is petty low. You can do all the lab before lab. After showing to TA, you can go. The difficulty of Mid-term and final is fine.

reviews.author: deku
reviews.title: Reconsider if you are thinking of taking java
reviews.comment_content: This is a very hard course, especially if you have no background in programming. This course is open for both students with programming experience and students with no experience.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was at least somewhat fluent in English. Sometimes, he rushed through content and it was hard to follow. But, he was good at explaining the content by showing demo.
reviews.comment_grading: It is hard to get a good grade because the mean is very high. Many students already learnt java before, so they get high mark in exams and assignment. This boosts the mean.
reviews.comment_workload: There is not much workload. There is one assignment split into two parts. The assignment can be easy depending on your knowledge about Java. You have to attend all the lab sessions since they check your attendance. You will have to complete the lab assignment in 2 hours and you can leave immediately if you finish the task beforehand. But, you can finish the task out of lab and show it at the start of the lab and leave.

reviews.author: Pollux
reviews.title: Be careful in exam
reviews.comment_content: Basic Java and programming, very basic. You can basically skip all lectures if you know programming. Not recommended for people without programming knowledge, you will be crushed.
reviews.comment_teaching: I didn't go to lectures after the first week. It is boring and useless. Labs TA are nice and friendly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 20% 200/200
Mid term 30% 93/100
Final 40% 89/100
Labs 10% 10/10
overall 93.5/100 A-

Definitely take this course if you have a programming base. The course require minimum effort for A-
reviews.comment_workload: Basically no workload. Only 2 assignments which are easy and only take very little time. You have to attend all the labs as it counts towards the final grade. Labs only takes about 15-30 minutes and you can leave early.

reviews.author: Steeeve
reviews.comment_content:
Chap 1: hardware-software
Chap 2: elementary-programming
Chap 3: objects-and-classes
Chap 4: variables-scopes
Chap 5: expression-branching
Chap 6: midterm-review
Chap 7: loops
Chap 8: arrays-nested-loops
Chap 10: eclipse-console
Chap 11: eclipse-string-fileio
Chap 12: recursion
Chap 12-1: recursion-suppl-binary search
Chap 12-2: recursion-suppl-tower of hanoi
Chap 13: altogether
Chap 14: final-review
suppl-ADTs

The contents are reasonably hard but manageable if study hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is really nice to all the students in the lecture. His explanation is easily understandable and clear.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it is harder to get a good letter grade in this course compared to other courses. There are many students who have studied java when they were in high school. Thus, if you haven't studied programming language, you have to study really hard to overcome the gap between you and them. As the result, it is not impossible to get a good grade even though you have not studied programming language before! So don't be too stressed about it.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is reasonable. There will be a lab work every week which is not too hard if you understood the lecture well. It would be better to prepare for it before you go to the lab session. Moreover, there will be two assignments. They will give you a reasonable time to complete it so I recommend you to start as soon as possible when it is uploaded.

reviews.author: yzhaock
reviews.title: Worth a Shot
reviews.comment_content:
01-hardware-software
02-elementary-programming
03-objects-and-classes
04-variables-scopes
05-expression-branching
06-midterm-review
07-loops
08-arrays-nested-loops
10-eclipse-console
11-eclipse-string-fileio
12-recursion
12-recursion-suppl-bsearch
12-recursion-suppl-hanoi
13-altogether
14-final-review
suppl-ADTs
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very nice.
He had graduated from Harvard and worked for Google for several years. Therefore, his knowledge and abilitity surpasses the requirement of this class.Also, he is fairly patient with every student. Actually, in this class, there was a very wide gap between the students' skill sets. However, he treat everyone equally without discrimination.
The lecture is not bored for the most and sometimes he would show some works of his or some top research results, which increase my interest to cs.
reviews.comment_grading:
I was a freshman in Java and any other programming language, totally.
There are a number of experts in this class as usual.
I didn't work that hard, 70%hard, perhaps.
I got A- overall at last.
So, don't be nervous if you chose this class. Just follow the instructor and never hesitate to ask questions.
Past papers are very useful !!!
Especially 2018Fall......
reviews.comment_workload:
In order to get full marks in every lab and assignment, you need to start your work early.
"It is the first step that costs troublesome. "

reviews.author: Qwerty123
reviews.title: HKMOOC course
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamentals of programming (would be challenging for those who have no background in programming)
Part 1:
Module 01 - Course Overview
Module 02 - Programming Fundamentals
Module 03 - Object-oriented Programming
Module 04 - Scope Rules, Boolean Expressions and Branching Module 05 - Loops, Shortcut Operators, Arrays

Part 2:
Module 06 - Introduction to OOP, Subclass, Multidimensional
Module 07 - Character String, File I/O
Module 08 - Simple Event Driven Programming and GUI
Module 09 - Recursion
Module 10 - Abstract data type (ADT), Eclipse
reviews.comment_teaching: I knew a little bit of programming before attending this course so I found most of the content was pretty straightforward. If you don't have the experience, you'll have to work extra hard to catch up. You can ask questions on HKMOOC/during the meetings/etc. As long as you ask, tutors are happy to help explain things in more detail
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Activities 10%
Lab exercises 10%
Project 10%
Midterm 30%
Final 40%
The grading is fair because everything's objective: as long as your code works you get the marks
reviews.comment_workload:
Mainly answer some questions (online activity), complete one lab per module, plus the final project.

The only thing you need to be wary of is time management because rushing through several modules back to back is not fun or beneficial at all(that is unless you already know everything)

reviews.author: ruhtrahu
reviews.title: PLEASE DO CONSIDER
reviews.comment_content:
(Not the exact wordings)
-Introduction to Computers
-Elementary Programming
-Objects, Classes and Basic Debugging Techniques
-Methods, Instance variables and Scope Rules
-Expressions and Branching statements
-----Midterm examination-----
-Loops
-Arrays and Nested loops
-Character, String I/O
-Eclipse console, String and File I/O
-Recursion
-----Final examination-----
reviews.comment_teaching: During secondary school, I studied Information & Communication Technology. Therefore, I understood most of the concepts, which made it hard for me to judge whether the instructor was good or not. However, I did not have a feeling that I was taking an instruction course. Therefore, if you did not have any knowledge in programming, it might be difficult to understand. The lecture had a good atmosphere though.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab: 10%
Assignment: 20%
Midterm exam: 30%
Final exam: 40%
-----------------------------------------------------
Overall mean of Lab session: 4.77/5.00
Mean of Assignment: 177.2/200.0
Mean of Midterm exam: 74.6/100.0
Mean of Final exam: 73.9/100.0
-----------------------------------------------------
My Score
Overall in Lab session: 5.00/5.00
Assignment: 200.0/200.0
Midterm exam: 85.0/100.0
Final exam: 90.5/100.0
-----------------------------------------------------
Overall, I scored 91.7/100.0
My grade in this course is B+...
It is quite discouraging.
reviews.comment_workload:
9 labs required.
1 assignment including 2 parts.
The workload is not heavy though.
-----------------------------------------------
For the lab sessions, you can just read the lab ppt provided in the course website and prepare all the codes before the lesson. The first few sessions even provided you a solution in the ppt. Despite the fact that it requires some thinking in the sessions afterward, if you do enough preparation before the session i.e. keep trying until you make it work, you can finish the lab session within minutes by simply copy and paste.
-----------------------------------------------
For the assignment, the first part is easy with the clear instructions provided. For the second part, it required more thinking but you must have adequate time to find out a way that will make it work.

reviews.author: Kevyn
reviews.title: a good course for computer beginners
reviews.comment_content: Basic concepts in java. it'll be quit easy if you've learnt java or other languages before. but it won't be hard if you don't have programming background but work hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pedro teaches so great. though teaching a little bit fast, he explains the concepts really clearly. And you can ask any questions after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
grade is quit fair.
30%mid+40%final+2 assignments+ several labs
but remember to be very very scrupulous in the exams!
Final overall score is above 95 and got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is quit light. all the works can be done without too much efforts.

reviews.author: mini
reviews.title: difficudlt to get good grade
reviews.comment_content:
contain the basic function of java ing the course
quite easy for beginner
however, if you want to get A range in this course, you need to get really high mark(>90)
the final exam paper contains topics that didnt being metioned in the notes given, thats not fair to the beginners(including me!)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Clearly discribe about the basic function of java
But the lesson is pretty boring for me, i always fall in a sleep during the lessson
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term: above 0.3sd
project: 100/100
final exam: above 0.3sd
finally got B
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly lab and a mini project, easy

reviews.author: Kelvinlh
reviews.title: Its okay
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting about basic java. It might be confusing to people that hasn't learnt about programming before. It is better to learn abit before taking this course, but dont be too afraid
reviews.comment_teaching: He speaks clearly compared to other teachers and he is passionate on teaching. HE IS FROM HARVARD HE IS GOOD!!
reviews.comment_grading: I got full score on assignment and lab, 93 out of 100 in midterm and 89 out of 100 in finals. I got A- in the end. Its not that bad, but its not good either. OH WELL
reviews.comment_workload: Not too heavy if you listen to the teacher and if you understand a bit of programming before the course. You need to finish the assignment before the lab though because everyone leaves early

reviews.author: HMMMMM
reviews.title: Grade is better than it is said this year
reviews.comment_content: The content overall is very basic, and for those with programming knowledge at whatever language, the lecture content is understandable after a few minutes of viewing the PPTs. That said, what is tested is harder than what is taught, with emphasis on some trivial differences between codes.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is good enough, but the difficulty doesn’t correspond with that of the testing.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not at all large, with only two assignments in the semester, each of which can be finished in an afternoons’ hard work.

reviews.author: khh
reviews.title: Bad choice for entering computing world
reviews.comment_content:
10 Online Lesson
10 Labs
1 Project

The content is very suitable for programming beginners, but I suggest them not to take this course as the grading and workload will be broken.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I attended online section
The speed of lesson can be controlled easily.
The concept explanation is clear and easy to follow.
There is a discussion forum for you to raise question.

Although the teaching is great but many details concept haven't taught in lesson but appears in exams question.
reviews.comment_grading:
Project 10%
Mid term 35%
Final 45%
Labs 10%

All Labs and projects got full mark
midterm 93%
final 88%
I got B+
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 10 labs and 1 project
Before midterm the workload is very small as
the labs are too short and easy to finish
After midterm the workload is slightly high for the programming beginners as debugging is time consuming.
