For the midterm and final exam,the preparation workload can be very high or low. If you aim high marks(full mark), you need to have long programming experience to answer the very tricky question.
Do not waste time on teaching material, that is useless to improve your exam performance.

reviews.author: York Yu
reviews.title: A good course for java beginners
reviews.comment_content:
*IMPORTANT NOTE FROM A YEAR 4 SENIOR*:
I heard lots of people complain about the difficulty of the course and make others flinch. What I must specify is that I also take it as my first programming course in university and I did not have any CS background in high school. And I found it acceptable. You know CS is a really competitive field and I am absolutely NOT among the top tier. So if you really want to dig into the computer science field, you should try this course first as a touchstone. It is the first step to become a genius programmer and trust me, every programmer must have gone through this step. And if you are just interested in programming but not meant to be a practitioner, you can absolutely go for the Python course.

content:
Something about the basic concept of java in computer science, not too hard overall if you truly spend time on it and make the logic clear.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred is a very good teacher. Sometimes he uses his own ppt rather than the ppt posted on the course website. If you send him an email, he will reply as soon as possible.
reviews.comment_grading: In my opinion, the grading is quite good, it's not difficult to get an A in this course but will be a little bit hard if you want to finish with A+. But it is still possible for beginners to get A+, I myself is an example. By the way, nearly everyone gets full marks in the two assignments so you have to do well in the midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework, you only need to do two assignments between midterm and final. So the workload is really not too big. We also have 3 hours to do each lab so the time is totally adequate. Just listen carefully in class and think twice in labs and that's enough.

reviews.author: kelsen
reviews.comment_content: As an introduction course of program language, I think the course is of great usage. At least it gave me the concept of what is programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, I do not think my professor taught me well. PDF just gave me some very basic concepts, which was far from the exam. So most of the time, I have to watch other teaching video to help me really understand java.
reviews.comment_grading: This year our exam was more difficult than any of the past. We can easily tell the good from the bad. Therefore, grading becomes easier than the past.
reviews.comment_workload: There was almost no workload for me. We did not have to do any homework after lecture. The assignments were also very easy to deal with. However, this could also be a disadvantage of this course. due to the hardness of the final exam, it was impossible to get good scores in the exam if you did not program after lecture.

reviews.author: YK
reviews.title: A fairly easy course for people who know some programing
reviews.comment_content:
I studied the course through HKMOOC online.
He divided the course into different moldule.
In each module it will contains videos(he explain the powerpoint),assignments(finish tasks such as complete codes),lab(to complete the program according to the instructions)
Online course is more flexible because you can use IDE to check the code before you submit
reviews.comment_teaching:
He always use some interesting example and "beautiful" drawings to illustrate some difficult concepts in programing.
This online course will give some reviewing sections before midterm and final exam. To let us go through the whole exam syllabus once.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterm mean is around 75 and the sd is around 20
Got an A for 95 overall
reviews.comment_workload: Debug will take time on doing the project and some lab

reviews.author: Richy
reviews.title: Appropriate level if you know how to code.
reviews.comment_content:
As I knew how to code already, the content was still very basic to me, but I'd understand that it would be more challenging if you've never coded before. I would consider learning the content in advance.
You can go to the course website: https://course.cse.ust.hk/comp1022p/ .
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was very adept in the subject and taught the course very well. Despite him having a slight accent, his teaching methods were above average as compared to other courses.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was fair to me, but it may not be for someone who has never coded before. You should expect that most of the other students taking the course already know how to code, and thus if you have never coded before, you will most likely fall under the mean (which was 76.8% for fall 2018).
reviews.comment_workload:
There was one lab each week, which didn't really need much work to do on, but it is advisable to complete the labs on your own before coming into your lab session.
There was also an assignment separated into two parts, and were really easy if you have successfully done all labs.

reviews.author: kamineko
reviews.comment_content: Contains some basic concepts about OOP, and basic uses of Java. Not difficult if you have some background of programming. But the MCs in the midterm and exam is tricky, if you haven't study programming before systematically like me, you probably lose some marks since you may not very familiarized with some concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is trying to teach something, but I think some of the students already know the concepts that he is teaching. Overall his teaching is fair, some important concepts will be addressed in his lessons, it is good.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think is fair, but no margin of error if you wish to get an A+.
For me,
Midterm: 91, mean ~75
Final: 94, mean ~74
Assignment and Labs: full mark
Overall near 95%, finally an A
If u want to get an A+, pay special attention to MC questions, since LQ is much easier and similar to PP
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair, the assignments are not difficult.
But you need to work very hard and be very careful to get an A+ since those people will get full marks in every assessment.

reviews.author: marpy
reviews.comment_content:
I think this course gives a basic but thorough overview of java. The instructors and TA's assume everyone to be a beginner so they start with elementary topics and work at a good pace. So, if you are a beginner in java or even programming, like me, you can learn a lot and not feel like you're being left behind. After the midterm, you are introduced to a little bit more complex topics, but I still feel like the pace of the class is quite good.

Labs were also a really good supplement to my learning. Overall, it was a very interesting class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor was very nice and kept a light-hearted atmosphere during the lecture. He always asks if students have questions and is always willing to help students if they have questions after class.

I believe he explained the concepts quite well. He also wrote programs during class to show how certain things worked instead of just reading off the presentation slides.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading in this course is probably the biggest downside. I heard many students already know java so the mean and SD of the mid term and final are quite high. If you want to get a high grade you cannot really make any careless mistakes.

With that said, even if you're a beginner, if you work hard you can do really well in this class.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low. If you want you can do labs before class and just demo it. However, the later labs can get a bit challenging. But, the TA's and student helpers are very helpful and you can always ask them questions.

The assignment isn't too difficult. You just need to be a bit careful and double check your work.

reviews.author: 16lamt1
reviews.comment_content:
Very basic programming concepts. Easy to pick up if you've done other basic languages like python.

Basic syntax
Classes and subclasses
Variables and scope
If-statements, if-else-statements, switch statements
Loops
Arrays
Recursion
reviews.comment_teaching: Pedro is a very good lecturer and speaks clearly during lectures. Takes time to clarify any questions asked and delivers content in a simple and effective manner that is easy for beginners to grasp.
reviews.comment_grading:
Really bad. Don't take this course as a free elective. Only take unless you've done programming previously or it is a compulsory course. If  the above does not apply to you but you have an interest in Java, you're better off learning it by yourself and not destroying your GPA.

Midterm - 30%
Final - 40%
Assignment - 20%
Lab - 10%
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. Just keep up with the lecture notes. All homework exercises and practices are optional. Make sure to show up to all labs as they account for 10% of total grade. Aim for 100% on the assignments. There are either 2 small assignments or one large one that is split into to parts. Not a lot of time should be taken up by this course.

reviews.author: ka@-@
reviews.title: 如果冇comp 背景 自問唔勤力就唔好take
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1: Hardware and Software, State diagrams

Week 3: Objects and Classes, Properties and Methods, Superclasses and Subclasses
Week 4: Static variables and Instance variables, Primitive types and reference types, Scope rules

Week 6: Midterm Review
Week 7: Loops
Week 8: Arrays; single and multidimensional

Week 11: Recursion

reviews.comment_teaching:
他會上堂舉很多額外examples, 講一D tricky 位
只要你自己睇曬D Lecture notes， 其實都唔洗上堂，夠做Lab
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%) 有9個lab
Programming assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (30%) (mean=76.1, sd=18.6)
Final exam (40%) (mean=76.94, sd=18.76)

冇comp 背景

reviews.comment_workload:
Lab 其實自己預早做定好d， 真係唔識可到時問隔里， 因為做完就走得， 但都去得啲都full mark，所以唔可以走太多lab
份assignment 叫寫Game mastermind 啲 method, 個course website 有足夠指引，都係用返lab用過啲改少少， assignment 2 有bonus part 前面失分可以係到攞返
交完， 再係 demo session 示範一次 加 講解俾TA
Midterm, Final 強烈建議做曬d past paper， 做唔識就問TA, 因為到時份野題型同pp 一樣

reviews.author: Timothy49X
reviews.comment_content: Basic programming in Java like branching, loops, arrays, file I/O, recursion , stack and classes. The topic of recursion and file IO can be a bit hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: He will make short pauses from time to time to see if students have anything unclear to ask. Nice
reviews.comment_grading: mean of mid-term is around 76, sd 18. for final, the statics is almost same as that of mid term. I get 70 in mid term while 81.5 in final. I get full mark in labs and assignment. My grade is B.
reviews.comment_workload: The only workload is the assignment, which is fucking annoying and troublesome. Note that the assignment is  submitted in week 10 and 12, be careful for clashes with other projects

reviews.author: Kevin KAI
reviews.title: NOT SO BAD AS YOU THOUGHT BEFORE
reviews.comment_content: This course offers some so basic concept about java. It is not so difficult for you to understand the knowledge if you can go to lecture and listen to the instructors carefully. If you cannot follow the instructor, don't worry. You can spend some spare time to see the ppt. But overall it's not difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This instructor explain the concept clearly. It's easy for me to understand.
But, it's hard for me to follow his temple because I think he gives talks in a high speed. We finished all the lectures more than one to two weeks before the exam. So sometimes I cannot write notes and understand all the thing immediately because hardly can I follow him.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is not so bad as we think before. Maybe this year Java course becomes a little bit lenient.
As I say before, the courses are not so difficult. But you should be more careful because your competitors are sooooooooo good and professional.
As for the lab and assignment. It's not difficult for you to get full mark and you MUST get full mark. Since you can prepare the lab before the lab courses and you can ask other professional students for help, you can get full mark easily.
As for the midterm and final exam, there are plenty of past papers for you to practice. You MUST do them otherwise you won't know how to handle the exam. Maybe you don't know how to solve the questions, but after doing past paper, I bet you will handle all the questions basically.
You need to be sooooooo careful!!!!!!!!!
For me, overall 92 something, I get A-, surprisingly.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not so large. Just need you to spend time to familiarize the labs and exams before the assessment. But all depends on you.
There are two assignment in the whole sem. Each may need to spend 4-5 hours to do it. But I really enjoy to do the assignment because it is about making a game.

reviews.author: LeaveSoon
reviews.title: Really not suitable for students who don’t have programming background
reviews.comment_content:
Same for all sections.
But I think the PPTs are not enough for handling projects and Part 2 labs
Part 2 may be difficult for students who don’t have any experience or knowledge in programming.

Part 1:
Course Overview
Programming Fundamentals
Object-oriented Programming
Scope Rules, Boolean Expressions and Branching Statemens
Loops, Shortcut Operators, Arrays

Part2:
Introduction to OOP, Subclass, Multidimensional Array, Simple Sorting
Character String, File I/O
Simple Event Driven PRogramming and GUI
Recursion
Abstract data type (ADT), Eclipse
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Pong listed a lot of daily examples which were useful to understand the concepts
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Acticites 10%
Lab exercises 10%
Project 10%
Midterm Exam 30%
Final Exam 40%

My score: 6X/100 and got C+, so maybe absolute grading (?)
Don’t expect much although you have tried your best because there are lots of students that master programming take this course.
Better to get full score in Online Activites, Lab exercises and Projects; and perform better in Midterm Exam to secure you grade.
It is because Midterm Exam is easier to get higher score. Whilst, Final Exam which just contributed 40% is much more difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
As I took the pure online courses, all the labs in Part 1 were available in late Augest. Whilst, labs in Part 2 were available right after the Midterm Exam.
There is one deadline for each Part. So, you can arrange your time when to do the labs.
This time, there was deadline extension of Part 2 labs and project.
I think the workload is rather heavy for students with no programming background because a lot of concepts and codes needed to be “disgested” in order to use them. Although you understand the concepts behind, there are cases that you may not know how to use them too. So, better ask TAs for help since the labs and projects are time-consuming.

reviews.author: masuki
reviews.title: Not suitable for programming beginners
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1: Hardware and Software + State diagrams
Week 2: Basic data types, variables, assignment statements, console I/O
Week 3: Objects and classes, properties and methods, superclasses and subclasses
Week 4: Static variables and instance variables, primitive types and reference types, scope rules
Week 5: Arithmetic expressions, boolean expressions, branching statements
Week 7: Loops
Week 8: Arrays; single and multidimensional
Week 9: Console I/O in Eclipse
Week 10: String manipulations, file I/O
Week 11: Recursion
Week 12: Abstract Data Types
reviews.comment_teaching: Not much can be said about Wilfred as I have only attended 1 lecture throughout the entire semester. It would be presumably hard for beginners to actually learn something about programming in lectures. If you're new to programming and you've unfortunately enrolled in this course, you should study more via YouTube videos.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Lab
20% Assignments
30% Midterm
40% Final
--
Since nearly everyone who studied this course has already acquired at least some programming knowledge, the mean and SD of the course is quite high.
Midterm mean: 74.xx SD: 18.xx
Final mean: 73.5 SD: 18.xx
--
My scores:
Midterm: 92
Final: 90.5
I have attained a full score on assignments and labs.
Final grade: A-

I have a friend from LX and LAX who got 95 in midterm and 92 in final, and received an A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite light, as it only requires you to demonstrate a small program to the TA in each lab session every week, plus a 2-part assignment.

For the assignment, Desmond had provided briefing session for it. We need to look at the pseudo code and the comment given in the skeleton. For the assignment, it may be challenging.

reviews.author: kkimah
reviews.comment_content: Pretty interesting especially if you have no programming background. it starts from the most basic

If you really have to take this course but you don't have any programming background, you basically have to work your butt off and stay in library watching youtube Java videos all day for like two weeks. not heavy.
you need to complete two assignment (part 1 and part 2) during the course, but compared to all the labs and finals and stuff, the difficulty is not that high

reviews.author: yenchung
reviews.comment_content: Includes quite a few knowledge and codes application. But the pace is so slow before the midterm that we didn't even proceed to loops.

reviews.comment_grading: Lots of experts but lots of beginners as well. While the contents aren't that complex, working hard on ppts and look for some additional videos are enough.

reviews.author: Yerke

Basic principles of coding in Java. Content is easy to understand.

I don't know a lot about that, since I didn't have final yet.

reviews.comment_content:

reviews.comment_teaching: I believe that Wilfred is a Hong Konger, because of his heavy accent. you can understand what he say but definitely not clearly. Also, he always want to make some gags in class which is not funny at all. His class, to be honest, is kinda boring. be careful.
reviews.comment_grading:
For me it is easy to get a fair high grade.

For the project, i got full mark
For the Lab, i got full mark

Finally i got B+
reviews.comment_workload: There are nearly no workload from this course. there are only a lab per week and a project , easy to manage.

reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to Computing with Java
if you are new to JAVA, do not take this course

the instructor is funny and willing to explain more to make sure most of us understand.
only the powerpoint is not detailed enough for you to understand profoundly about the usage of codes.

reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is a good lecturer. He explains everything very clearly. If he thinks something is very important or hard, he will keep repeating the content again and again XD and at the time you will know that what will be included in the exams
reviews.comment_grading:
I got B+ very easily
There are 9 labs and I got full mark
2 assignments also got around 80%
midterm above median 1 mark
final below median few marks
reviews.comment_workload:
I have to attend the lectures to get a better understanding of the topics. But I have also try to skip some lectures about some easy chapters which didn't cause any problem.
You have to do a lab per week which you can just finish it at home and submit it directly in the lab section. I usually have to spend around an hour for each lab.
For the homework part, I think its tough, it has tons of instruction in it to guide you how to do BUT THEY ARE NOT TAUGHT BEFORE. I think I've spent around 5 to 6 hours for each assignment

reviews.author: MishTake
reviews.title: Desmond is the best!
reviews.comment_content:
This course is designed to equip students with the fundamental concepts of programming elements and data abstraction using Java. Students will learn how to write procedural programs using variables, arrays, control statements, loops, recursion, data abstraction and objects using an integrated development environment.

Content included:

Intro. to Problem Solving and Comp. Prog
Basic Prog. Lang. Elements
Java Operations
Java Checking and Selection Statements
Java Looping Statements
Java Arrays
Java Classes and Objects
Inheritance
Java Static Variables and Methods
Recursion
Java Strings
Java File I/O
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is definitely the best professor i have seen in HKUST just yet. His teaching is great, in depth. You have to pay attention to the classes because some of the mid term / final questions may be asked from some questions asked by students. All in all, his lessons are interesting and won't let you fall asleep. I recommending stay after the lessons as you can ask him as many questions as you like. And he will be willing to answer all of them, both about Java and studying in HKUST.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid Term and Final above 1SD.
There are 2 assignments, both 100%.
At around top 30% of the students, getting A-.

Desmond promised he will give top 37% students A range, and another 50% B range, so you don't have to be afraid to get poor grades in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: There are only two assignments to do. In the beginning it seems that it is quite challenging as you are completely new to java. However when you are starting to understand each line of code inside the assignments, you start to know what you are doing. Desmond likes to give out image processing assignments. For this semester, the first assignment is to create a program that enhances the image's contrast. This can be done by using "for loop inside a for loop". You will learn it in the first few weeks. The second assignment is to create a GUI that supports a few image processing methods.

reviews.author: Shercc
reviews.comment_content: greenfoot, java, basic programming skills(recursion, if-then-else...), object-oriented programming concepts( class, object...) are included. Not very difficult if you have the basic programming skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: The Indian professor explains concepts with examples and stories. Funny teaching. You can ask him questions after classes.
reviews.comment_grading: get at least 93% to obtain an A range. Try to get full mark in assignments and not to make careless mistakes in exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload of this course is acceotable. One written assignment, one individual project which requires you to write a mastermind game in greenfoot (instructions and template are  well given), one midterm and one final exam.

reviews.author: Johnny Ngai
reviews.comment_content: Mainly about if statement, loop, variables.

reviews.author: Hamburger Milk
reviews.title: Perfect Teaching! Good Grade!
reviews.comment_content: Pretty good
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is the best teacher I've ever met in this university!!!
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is much more lenient than the grading in fall semester. Desmond said there will be 1/3 students can get A range. But you still need to work hard and take it seriously and follow the teaching:)
reviews.comment_workload:
Average workload.

~~Go to the lectures although there is no attendance taking
~~Go to the lab every week. It will contribute to your final grade.
~~Finish the programming assignment. There are two of them in the semester. Don't be a ddl fighter. Otherwise if you have some unknown problem, you won't have time to ask Desmond about it.
~~Midterm and Final exams. There are two grading schemes: with or without midterm grade. But I think the midterm is easier than the final. So go to the midterm.

reviews.author: Jonathan:-)
reviews.title: BEST ins ever
reviews.comment_content:
If you have the intention to further major/minor in CS or CS related major/minor, it would be better to take COMP1022P taught by Desmond. The content may be a bit challenging but is very useful for future study.

0-logistics
1-Intro to problem-solving and computer programming
2-Basic programming language elements
3-Java operations
4-Java checking and selection statements
5-Java looping statements
---------midterm coverage----------
6-Java arrays
[The level of difficulty for the content below is a bit high]
7-Java classes and objects
8-Java inheritance
9-Java static variables and methods
10-Java recursion
11-Java file I/O
12-Java Strings
---------final coverage (cumulative)----------
The content is quite good for the beginners. But the level of difficulty gets harder as it progresses. Still, Desmond tries his best to explain and one should be able to understand with some efforts.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His notes are quite clear with vivid examples.

He is able to explain clearly.

Do attend the lectures (or at least watch the lecture video once) as there will be some that are not in the notes but mentioned only in the lecture, and are tested in the exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Desmond guarantee at least 30% A range.

Lab 10%
10 labs in total. mean is around 85%

Assignments 20%
2 assignments in total.
Assignment 1: mean=79.5%.
Assignment 2: mean=72.8%.

Midterm 30% OR 0%
mean: ~70 median: 71 SD:~18

Final 40% OR 70%
mean: ~52 median: 50 SD:~20

Some data:
90%+ A+
78%+ A- or above
Slightly above mean B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate.

Usually, need to spend some time after lectures to fully understand the content.

Assignments are quite useful and practical, however, they do require quite a few time if you want to finish them perfectly. Briefing sessions will be conducted for the assignments and they are somewhat helpful.

reviews.author: Sine

reviews.comment_content: Include topics "hardware software", "elementary programming", "objects and classes", "variables scopes", "expression branching", "loops", "arrays nested loops", "string file io", "recursion". Having lab for student to write program.
reviews.comment_teaching: He could teach logic by some daily examples (usually from his experience) which help beginners to understand Java. He was a nice and humorous professor. It was a enjoyment to have a lesson by him.
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%)
Assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (30%)
Final exam (40%)
Teach was good, but the mid-term and exam grading were terrible. Those questions were set by TAs who would not let you got high mark so easy. There were a lot of "beginners" who know programming studied this course. Usually, the mean of mid-term and exam were around 75-80 over 100.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was small. You need to do a written assignment around October and a programming assignment around November. the written assignment was easy but the programming assignment would take some time to finish. But there were adequate instructions on their websites. If you followed it, you could get a full mark.

reviews.author: Amy.T
reviews.title: 挺好玩的但是有一點爛龜
reviews.comment_content: 內容講了一些很基礎的java，初學者不用擔心，看PPT差不多就弄懂了，課程相關的green foot也很簡單，但考試的時候會考的很細，而且考的內容上課不會講很多，所以如果是初學者（像我一樣的話，暴風哭泣.jpg）考試會覺得有一點壓力。
reviews.comment_teaching: 我覺得這位印度的教授講的挺不錯的，很有趣，人也很好，雖然我還是忍不住睡過去了⋯⋯但教授真的挺好的
reviews.comment_grading: 主要由：1. lab 2. 兩次Assignment 3. midterm 4. final組成，lab和Assignment都不用擔心，lab基本上就是就是提前做完就直接走，會留下來的學生很少。Assignment很簡單，今天這個學期做的是一個candy的小遊戲，大概兩三個小時就能做完，不過有可能debug有些時候可能會耗很久時間。Midterm和final不算難，但是周圍的人都考太好了（全是大佬），所以分數就很慘
reviews.comment_workload: 幾乎沒有workload，不過如果你想midterm和final拿高分的話肯跟需要花多一些時間

reviews.author: Vinchann
reviews.comment_content: The topic is very interesting for the student who have learnt programming in advance. It enhances your skills on several problem-solving questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is a very good teacher. He is very funny such that the class is not boring at all.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite lenient. Once, I got deduced from using another path in my answer sheet rather than using the same way as in the answer key; however, the TA might understand as long as you can clearly explain your answer to them.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not much. There are only 2 assignments that you need to dedicate yourself to. The assignment sometimes a little bit hard for people who just learn programming because the TAs are the one who make it. However, Desmond is very open to help you guys for your assignment.

reviews.author: 佳妡
reviews.title: hard for students have no basic computer background
reviews.comment_content:
introduction to java with expert classmates.
hardware-software
greenfoot
object-class
variable-scope
expression-branching
loops
arrays-nested-loops
eclipse
recursion
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is great but TAs.........
It seems like you have to learn lab by yourself
reviews.comment_grading:
.....all my classmate are terrible expert......
if you want 1 SD higher than average in exam, you have to get 97/100.

laboratories 10%(totally 9)
lab material would be more and more harder
assignment 20%
    one paper assignment one coding assignment (with greenfoot)
midterm exam 30% (easy)
final exam 40% (easy but harder than midterm)
reviews.comment_workload:
Have to prepare for every labs.
assignment 1 is on paper
assignment 2 is to code a game called masterpiece.
i think is difficult to me and have to spend a lot of time.

reviews.author: Man Tsung
reviews.comment_content:
The course consists of most of the DSE syllabus, it is better for students to have programming background, or otherwise be really interested in programming.

Exams are allowed to open book, you may not have to recite the whole content in lecture notes, but understanding in the subject is required.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor's lecture on Java program is understandable, it is better to attend all lectures if you have a poor programming knowledge.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab assignment (weekly)
Exams ( Mid-term / Final)
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much, but you are advised to finish labwork in the lesson, or you have to complete it at home.

reviews.author: Anonym
reviews.title: unescapable
reviews.comment_content: a good start to java and to programming in general.. has been useful in some simple projects. if you are new to programming you will have to struggle for a while to get a grasp of what is going on.
reviews.comment_teaching: fun professor.. encourages students to learn by trying the codes by themselves.. havent seen the teacher live.. canvas provides video recordings of the course
reviews.comment_grading: a lil harsh.. but A-range is reachable by understanding the concepts and learning how to put them into practice.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is above average

reviews.author: jacko
reviews.title: Bird course but you've gotta be consistent if you want a good grade
reviews.comment_content: Honestly not very good IMO. You won't learn much, regardless of your programming background (or lack thereof). More time is spent in greenfoot (which I personally was not a big fan of) than eclipse. This course only goes to show that intro courses are often not useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: Muppala's the best prof I've had so far; he's very passionate and manages to keep students engaged. I slept in every class this semester except Muppala's.
reviews.comment_grading: Grades in this course are hardly indicative of the student's skill level. If you're consistent enough and get full marks in the assignments (complete the bonuses as well just in case), labs, midterm and get a 90+ in the final then you can land an A. Personally I messed up slightly in the midterm and assignments so I only got a B.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework and only 2 assignments: one written and one greenfoot project. Hella chill tbh.

reviews.author: humanoid
reviews.comment_content: The content might look difficult to those who are doing programming for the first time. However, to be honest, if you study well, the content is still manageable. Some concept may be hard to understand at the beginning.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is okay. The professor tries his best to make the otherwise boring ppt interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: There are many student who can already program in Java. Therefore, the mean of the exam will be quite high. To get in the A range, you should not make big mistakes, which can be critical.
reviews.comment_workload: There are not many workload as all that is needed are one written assignment, which is just like a test paper, and one programming assignment. They are given enough time to be completed.

reviews.author: Ren Xuanchi
reviews.comment_content:
The content of the course can be reviewed on the website:https://course.cse.ust.hk/comp1022p/labs.html.
And the ppt of the course can be pre-reviewed. It is quit good for a beginner to learn java.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred is a kind professor. You can ask him anything that you are wondering. He likes to use cute picture to make the lecture more interesting. However, to be honest, it is ok  for you to only study the ppt. Wilfred may make some simple mistake, for he does not writing java frequently.
reviews.comment_grading: It is easy to get an A-range grading. However,if you are willing to get A+,it is very difficult,unless you get nearly full score in every assignments and exams. If you do the past paper, you will actually have a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The homework includes a writing one and a programing one. It is quite hard at the beginning,but with the number of program that you completing increasing, the assignments become easy. What is more, it is necessary to finish the past paper.

reviews.author: Ivansin
reviews.comment_content: some basic knowledge of computer programming. If you have programming foundation, the content are trivial to you.
reviews.comment_teaching: He just followed the lecture slides , not very interesting.If you have programming foundation, you can keep all the lecture. And then review yourself is ok.
reviews.comment_grading: exam and test is quite easy , I got 90 something and have A range.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is normal. You have to complete all the labs but the labs are easy and the project is easy to get full marks. In exam, you better have a clear concept rather than bring all the notes and rely on them.

reviews.author: wcwcwcwcwc
reviews.comment_content: Include basic concepts of java and give u chances to deal with programming language by your own.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professors know most of us have no experience on java and programming,which is true for most people. However, you need to ask them questions after lecture in order to get total understanding.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very bad. I got a 93+ out of 100, while still in B range; how ever, I have learned that should I got 96+/100, it would be A+.

There are lots of people with programming experience in this course. It is definitely to pass in this course but it is difficult to get an A- or above.
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty low workload. There are three homework assignments in this course in total. Labs are scheduled for 2 hours but you can finish in 12 minutes and just leave

reviews.author: Lynn Zhang
reviews.comment_content: Simple concepts with adequate explanation, though I wish there was more focus on actual application and not coding games with not much use. Like perhaps we could have been given a chance to code a screenshotting program or a task manager-like program.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very interesting classes with easy to understand powerpoints. Professor is very happy to answer questions after class, but you have to be fast as a lot of people will surround the professor with questions. TAs are quite helpful in labs as well, but sometimes they have trouble handling the amount of students so you'll be skipped or end up waiting around 30 minutes for a TA to get to you.
reviews.comment_grading: Do not take this course if you are truly a beginner in Java. The course content is easy but because there are a lot of people who have already taken Java classes in High school, the mean is extremely high and A/B range is narrow. The mean was around 85 with many people with full marks or close to full marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is alright if you listen in class and participate in all the labs. Homework can be difficult to completely code from scratch on your own, but is rather simple if you paid attention.

reviews.author: poky
reviews.comment_content: Don't choose this course if you don't know programming. It would be too difficult for those who have no experience in programming. There is no attendance.
reviews.comment_teaching: This teaching is okay. The lessons are interesting and not too bored. Anyway, You can just skip all the lessons. So don't bother.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is really bad. Even 90% only got B. DON'T choose this course if you need a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. There are just one written assignment and one programming assignment through the whole year.

reviews.author: Jubin
reviews.title: NOT an introductory course!!
reviews.comment_content: The course "introduces" you to java programming. To be honest, the content has been designed to make it introductory as much as possible. Gotta appreciate whoever made it But considering the high level that the course reaches by the end, the professors have to move kinda fast. Despite the fact that all the basic tools required to ace the examination are provided in the lecture slides and lab-work, you may not get the right idea required for a question as each concept and type of programming questions are not covered exhaustively. But with the right determination and proper coverage of the reference book, you can crack this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Muppala was pretty amazing. He did his best to present this course with a beginner's perspective. Kept making dad jokes in the class and I feel like the students never appreciated him enough for that. He would always stay back to answer doubts and would not leave until everyone was done asking questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Can be disastrous if you go below 90. The bell curve falls really fast after that.
Assignment 25% (Written assignment: 5% ,Programming assignment : 20%)
Mid term 25%
Final 40%
Labs 10%
I ended up with an A+. But I feel like I was able to get that grade only because I learnt C++ in high school. But even that turned out to be a problem, because despite their similarities, there are some fundamental differences between Java and C++ and it kept bothering me throughout the semester.
Make no mistake, you can ace this course without any programming knowledge. I have friends who did. But you have to pay attention to the lectures, go through the reference book( I cannot emphasize this enough) and try the online quizzes. Download Java Eclipse from the course website and try out new codes every time you feel confused.
reviews.comment_workload: A whole lot of students I know who had some kind of programming background told me that the workload is absolutely zero. True....if you do know some Java beforehand. Despite the fact that I did know C++ from school, I actually spent a considerable time on this course, mostly going through the reference book, which is pretty comprehensive and mentioned those exceptional cases that tend to appear in exams which most students get wrong.

reviews.author: khangsek
reviews.title: Interesting course with humorous joke from lecturer
reviews.comment_content: The content is very appropriate for a beginner in programming. Ranging from variable, object, image, if else statement, loop, nested loop and last but not least, recursion. The content is relatively easier to understand if you have a nice lecturer.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of MUPPALA,Kumaraswamy R Jogesh is really fantastic as he always adds some humorous element in his teaching to get us awaked during the class. He explained the course materials in details with slow-paced to make sure everyone can understand. You can see his passion in teaching and always willing to answer every question you have in mind during class and after class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is harsh. If you want to get good grade, please make sure that you get full marks in lab section and the assignment. This is because you will find out that people in this course may already had learned the basic programming in their high schools or self-learning. But for this semester, the grading doesn't seem that bad compared to the previous semesters.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light as you only have to attend lab section and do the assignment given. There will be written assignment and programming assignment. The programming assignment is separated into two parts. Do look for friends to help you out if you meet any difficulty.

reviews.author: Umakant
reviews.comment_content:
Content is pretty easy. We start off by studying basic concepts from Greenfoot. Later after going through the basics thoroughly, we do actual simple programming.
Students will learn how to write procedural programs using variables, arrays, control statements, loops, recursion, data abstraction and objects using an integrated development environment.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Wilfred is a pretty good teacher.
The courses are taught using ppt but some students use books to study the course.
I personally only used ppt and I think it's enough for the course.
If you don't understand what he says in the class please don't hesitate to ask him after the class is over. (Although I never asked😂)
reviews.comment_grading:
The course was not that hard if you can grasp the concept. But since most of the students are already familiar with computer or have studied computer before, it is hard to get a decent grade for a beginner.
General assessment (100%):
Laboratories (10%)
Written assignments (5%)
Programming assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (25%)
Final exam (40%)
Fortunately, I was able to get A+ although I didn't study much😂😂
Btw I was a complete beginner in computer science in the beginning of the course.
reviews.comment_workload:
One of the most chill course ever. I only studied a night before the exams and got A+. So compared to other courses I think its good.
The only workload is the assignment which you will have plenty of time to complete.

reviews.author: matthew_lau1024
reviews.comment_content:
－非常基本嘅java知識，容易上手，例如class and objects, data types最難都係去到recursion，多啲做練習就可以。
－基本上教學內容唔會太大變動，上堂對於programming幫助唔大，靠powerpoint自修就可以滿足個要求
reviews.comment_teaching:
－Wilfred嘅教學係有趣，用咗好多比喻手法去解釋每一個概念，即使識啲內容都可以去上堂感受下佢講嘢
－通常揀得compp都係本身識java，大部分都扮新手咁入嚟刷grade，所以唔好希望上堂氣氛係愉快，即時係Wilfred教
reviews.comment_grading:
爛
88%-->B-
93%-->B
自己諗啦
reviews.comment_workload:
每個禮拜有一個lab,基本上上lab前用10－30分鐘寫完啲code，去到即刻舉手交就得，難度黎講真係唔深，全部都係powerpoint啲嘢，有部份lab更加比埋d code你照抄。

差唔多去到sem 尾要用greenfoot去寫mastermind隻game,無限制用咩技巧去寫，淨係考慮output可唔可以meet到requirement。有bonus part做，如果100分compulsory因為大意而失咗分，可以用bonus 補救

reviews.author: Andyks
reviews.title: Self-learning is a must
reviews.comment_content:
The content is just some basic stuff regarding java such as looping, if-then-else, variables, arrays, data structure, recursion etc.
Not difficult at all so there are many people getting extremely high marks in assignments and exams.
Not suggested taking as a common core.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He tried to explain everything well but it is difficult and abstract to understand for those who have not learnt to programme before.

The lecture slides are useful for you in the exam sometimes.

The lecture may help you understand Java programming but self-learning is more efficient and effective in order to have a clearer understanding of Java and a good grade in exams.

Conclusion, make use of online resources.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab : full mark
Mid term : ~98
Final : 94
assignment : ~97
overall : 97.75
just got an A. Not a good grade course for sure
reviews.comment_workload: Just 1 lab per week and some written and online assignments. No big deal at all.

reviews.author: 阿楠
reviews.title: Good teaching
reviews.comment_content: This course is designed to equip students with the fundamental concepts of programming elements and data abstraction using Java. Students will learn how to write procedural programs using variables, arrays, control statements, loops, recursion, data abstraction and objects using an integrated development environment.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond Tsoi is a very passionate instructor aiming at making his student love programming. He explained the concepts clearly with his own funny examples. He spent time in explaining common mistakes each lesson after the lab. You can understand the lesson very quickly with his explanation. He also asked for opinion for the difficulty of exams. Key points were highlighted and were often asked in the exams. The only bad things of Desmond is that sometimes he repeat somethings so often and his jokes may not be funny.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exams are in open-note form as Desmond wants students to understand the concept instead of just memorizing the codes only. The difficulty of the exam is reasonable. The programming questions can be hard, but he gave marks so far as your answer is logical. He emphasized that there is no standard answers for programming.

I got my first A grade in University in this course. I have learned basic pascal before and I think this may be one reason. Programming background is surely an advantage. Yet, I think it is still a good course for programming beginners as my programming background is not that really good in fact. Of course, such a good grade may be due a good instructor like Desmond Tsoi.
reviews.comment_workload:
You need to attend the lab bi-weekly. 1 mark for attendance of the lab and 1 mark for the complete of task. You just need to follow the steps and it is easy to complete the task.

There is no assignment. Just mid-term and final.

reviews.author: uraniumgun1127
reviews.title: GOOD CONTENT // BAD GRADE
reviews.comment_content: This course provided me with the better understanding of the programming using JAVA. The reason is the PPT note is simple and well organized. Also, the concepts they teach were all essential information on handling JAVA. However, this course is not recommended for the students who start programming since JAVA is the quiet hard programming language. If you are a beginner, start with Python.
reviews.comment_teaching: the instructor NG, Wilfred Siu Hung 's teaching was bad. He knew well about the content but, his English speaking was terrible so, it made me hard to understand the several syntaxes of JAVA and the meaning. the instructor MUPPALA, Kumaraswamy R Jogesh's teaching was very satisfied. He had no difficulty in explaining the note and he often recommended the better way of study JAVA with fashion. Choose the good instructor if you want to take this course
reviews.comment_grading: Overall, the students get good marks. But, getting A grade will be super challenging. the mean grade of the mid/final exam was about 80%~83% and I got 96% in the midterm exam and 91% in the final exam.I almost got the full mark on the assignment and the lab but, my grade is still B+. The reason is too many students who know JAVA very well enter this course and the only very small percentage of students got A. Since my grade was not bad, I will give B on grading section.
reviews.comment_workload:
QUIET HEAVY.
the students who start the programming will suffer a lot from the very hard written assignment and the programming assignment. Generally, the written assignment takes 4hours, the first programming assignment takes 12hours, the second programming assignment takes 24hours to finish to the average students.
You must attend the lab course once a week to get the lab grade.
Each lab course takes 2hours to finish. Hopefully, the grade of the workload is usually high. The first written assignment will the most challenging task for the beginners haha.

reviews.author: Mchen
reviews.title: Good course but not for grade
reviews.comment_content: This course teach student basic programming knowledge by using Java. Although Java is a good OOP language but I think it is not very freshman-friendly. If COMP1021 have quota, please do not hesitate to take that!!
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring. Actually i seldom go to this section after several lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: Not good, because too many students already have enough program skills and got full marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Depends on your program skills. If you have already learnt some other program languages like C++ or Free Pascal, then the workload is almost 0. If you are a newbee for program, then good luck.

reviews.author: kartik04
reviews.comment_content: They try to touch alot of concepts, indeed what should be the basic idea behind a introductory course for a discipline. They can improve on selection of material and the depth they go into.
reviews.comment_teaching: Didn't really attend much lectures, but from the ones I did I found prof MUPPALA K R Jogesh better than Prof Wilfred S Hung. Though the pace and the amount of content of this course doesn't let any thought provoking teaching take place.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is tough, mainly because of high means and high SDs. I got 99 in midterm 81 in final (both the time above mean, infact more than 1 SD above mean in midterm) , full in assignments , missed a couple of labs and ended with a B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Managable. 1 lab session every week + 2 lectures 50 min each.
2  assignments.

reviews.author: MIYANO
reviews.title: A Competitive Course
reviews.comment_content:
Self-study is really important!!
What is tested in the exams and assignments is quite different from that taught in class!!
However, I really learnt a lot through this course, and beginners can also take this course(I didn't use computer at all before taking this course, and I even can't type well),as long as you spend enough time after course.
I get interested in COMP after taking this course, so it's a good course...
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is good, though he may make some mistakes in lectures
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%)
Written assignments (5%)
Programming assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (25%)
Final exam (40%)
I got full marks in labs and all the assignments, and about 2 points lower than (mean+sd) in both midterm exam and final, I thought I could get A, however I just got A-, too many experts from India and mainland(I'm from mainland) and you can't get good grade if you make some stupid mistakes in exams.......
reviews.comment_workload:
quite large?
I spent a lot of time on this course, for both finishing the assignments and self-learning.

reviews.author: kms
reviews.title: Review
reviews.comment_content: Content was not over-bearing but it can be quite difficult to comprehend from time to time. Having no prior programming experience, it was difficult to digest certain concepts but in overall it is still manageable.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer tries to cover all the content within the given time and the entire course was not rushed. However, when questions were asked, the answers were not satisfying and sometimes not comprehensive. It is recommended to approach the lecturer after lecture or approach the TAs with the question during Lab sessions
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is drawback of this course which could possibly turn away a lot of students from enrolling. With strong understanding of the contents and spending some time in practicing, getting above 80% should not be difficult in the examinations. However, the bell-curve of grading system is discouraging.

Final grade: 97%, A
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is manageable. For weekly lab sessions, you can read up on the instructions in advance and if you are able to do them, you can prepare prior to lab session and show it to TA when your session starts.

For programming assignments, while it might take some time to finalize and check for mistakes, in overall it is still manageable.

reviews.author: dontregchem1030
reviews.comment_content: The content is suitable for beginners as it only includes very basic concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is nice and has a sense of humor that keeps me awake during lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: Just be careful and you can get a good grade. It is easy to get 100% in the programming assignment and the written assignments. Just aim for 100% in every part if you want to get an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little workload. The midterm and final are open book so the course requires very little study as long as you understand the concepts.

reviews.author: sunnychan1
reviews.comment_content: Really basic concepts of coding, matches its title of "introduction".
reviews.comment_teaching: This Instructor is very humorous, he made jokes on the lesson to familiar us the coding concepts. His English accent is also very understandable.
reviews.comment_grading: All graded contents are quite simple, the grading depends on your carefulness rather than your understanding. The exams are also open-booked so it is not necessary to recite the syntax and methods. Only the lab session counts attendance.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite fair, one written assignment and one programming assignment, which are quite useful for you to understand the concepts. However, the programming assignment is quite time consuming and confusing as some details are not written well.

reviews.author: I.048S96
reviews.title: Without prior experience in Java, you won't get a good score.
reviews.comment_content: The content is not very hard. As the course name suggests, it just touches upon the most introductory details of Java programming.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is okay. Professor Muppala makes these terrible jokes (some are quite good but... yeah)

I didn't really listen to the lectures so I don't recall how good it was. Sometimes I fell asleep and spent time doing my lab... maybe you should refer to someone else's review.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is very objective. You could get 100s in every single assignment, even both the midterm and final exams.

Project: 100 (Part 1: 35%, Part 2: 65% + Bonus: 30%)
--> Bonus is more than enough to get you a 100% for the project assignment.
Labs: 100
Midterm: 100
Final: 95 (I didn't have time to study for finals so...)
Final Grade: 98.88 (Letter Grade... I don't know)
I am quite certain there is a final grade of 100.00. Could have been me if I spent more time on studying for the finals...

Even though my final grade is 98.88, I am not confident I will get an A+... Other students are very good as well. The mean is not very high for exams but the SD is extremely high 17 ~ 22. There are always 100s in midterms and finals. It's not difficult for those who have experience but it's a very competitive course.
reviews.comment_workload:
There's not much to do for this course.
1) Just go to lab sessions every week. It takes around an hour. And don't forget the demo session for the project. I am aware some students screwed up on that one...

2) Complete the Project (takes around 10 hours in total I think) Those who are better and more focused might finish it in even 5 I think.

3) No Attendance. Regardless I go to every class...

reviews.author: Colleen
reviews.title: Not that difficult as everyone said
reviews.comment_content:
Basic stuff for programming
Actually not that difficult but the way they organize the lesson make it confusing for beginners to understand
I have no idea about what they are teaching before midterm exam. Luckily the TAs are very nice and I understand much better after asking them. Self learning would help too. Free apps are recommend . Also , find someone who know programming and want to major in cs to carry you. That will help a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is very nice  and willing to answer your questions. He always asked if everyone don't understand what he is talking about and would stop and answer your questions.
He is funny too. Always try to make his lessons interesting and easy to understand by telling jokes , stories and examples. The TAs are nice too.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not that good because many people get very high mark and the questions are tricky. It is not about whether you understand the contents or not , it is more about being careful.
96.6%>>A
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok. But the labs get difficult in the last. Once I stayed for two lab sessions because I could not figure out how to finish it.

reviews.author: adwonghk
reviews.title: 有人carry會好讀好多
reviews.comment_content: 作為Engine year 1學生必須要讀既Comp科其中一科(Comp1021, Comp1022q, Comp1022p)，呢一科聽聞係比起其他兩科難，但其實都係教返基本Programming既內容，包括if else,switch,for,do while loop，當中最難應該係recursion。
reviews.comment_teaching: 教既時候都只係照讀返Powerpoint既野，上左兩堂冇再上過。
reviews.comment_grading:
The general assessment (100%)
-Laboratories (10%)
-Written assignments (5%)
-Programming assignments (20%)
-Midterm examination (25%)
-Final exam (40%)

Lab同Written Assignments大把人好高分或接近滿分，所以想要好grade就一定要交齊做好佢地。Midterm同Final唔太難，但正因為唔太難所以佢d問題問得好tricky，自己之前有學過Java都比d題目trick到，所以真係要睇清楚條題目(特別係MC)問緊咩、有咩前設等等。

Midterm太輕敵，做左半個鐘就走左，結果89分；Final都係早走左得83分。Lab同Written Assignments全部滿分，最後得A。兩次都剩係睇一次powerpoints同做一份pastpaper就算。

Miterm Mean 81.80 Max 100 Min 22 SD 16.11
Final Mean 77.79 Max 100 Min 22.5 SD 17.47
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab每個禮拜一次，可以提前一日係屋企做定先，去到再比Ta比分(計埋Attendance)。
Programming assignments得一份，分Part 1同Part 2，好似比左兩三個禮拜做。

學過寫Program既會覺得好輕鬆；新手既話後面既lab會有少少難度，而Programming assignments對新手而言我相信都幾難，但係可以問返Ta同Prof.而且Powerpoint都會有唔少提示。

reviews.author: VincentChao
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content: The instructor is great because of his good powerpoint help us construct a clear concept.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, I'm willing to take all of his courses owing to his patience and professional teaching skill.It is quite easy to understand the concept of coding .
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%)
    Written assignments (5%)
    Programming assignments (20%)
    Midterm examination (25%)
    Final exam (40%)
Because lots of people learned coding before, it is not easy to get good grade.
Make sure that you got enough grade in midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload:
LAB is required
Writing assignment is not hard but take time
Programming assignment either
Only three homework is needed

reviews.author: Hugo Chin
reviews.comment_content:
For those like me who didn't learn any computer programming before, I will not suggest you to take this course. Because this course is full of students who have learnt programming before and they know everything about java. Even you tried very hard to get up with the course, you will still get f--k by those who have learnt before.

Get into Comp1022Q or study it in the next semester. Otherwise your grade will be f--k up by those A-range or B-range students.

Laboratory is compulsory and if you finish the content in that lab, you can leave early.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good.
reviews.comment_grading: I don't know the grading of A-range or B-range as I just got a C even I tried very hard to study the lectures. And my total scores are close to mean -1 sd.
reviews.comment_workload:
For those who didn't learn java before,I believe the workload is very high. They have a lab every week. And they have 1 written assignment and 1 programming homework which includes designing a game. In this semester we have to use Greenfoot to write a Mastermind game.
For those who have learnt before I am sure that the homework can be finished within 1-2 hours. But for people like me, I need to use much more time to finish the

reviews.author: MarcK
reviews.title: Need to pay extra efforts into this course
reviews.comment_content: This course teaches you how to use greenfoot and parts of eclipse. For those who haven't learnt programming before, the contents would a bit difficult to understand and hard to catch-up.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is funny. He always tells us jokes during classes and the whole atmosphere is quite good. Moreover he uses extra examples to let students understand concepts better.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it is alright although I didn't get good grades. More than half of the class have learnt programming before university therefore the mean of mid-terms and finals are quite high and also the standard deviation is quite large.
reviews.comment_workload: The workloads are fine in terms of assignments. There is 1 written assignment and 1 programming assignment. But I think the lab tasks are quite difficult to catch-up.

reviews.author: Hopper
reviews.title: 冇底5好入！！！！
reviews.comment_content:
教嘅都系基本JAVA野；  不過D人真系全部都識； －3 － 好無奈好冇 靜靜看著全部人都根本就識嘅之後其實我覺得Ta都好無癮；
冇乜程式底就5好去讀。揾自己 D GPA黎搞。
reviews.comment_teaching: 我今個SEM最中意呢個professor 佢講書幾好，少少照PPT讀但系overall我覺得系教緊書。幾開心嘅。
reviews.comment_grading:
分真系一般般 上年聽講93%A range； 今年要95%先A range
98.9% A+  份卷滿分嘅人數！！ 震憾簡直。。。 所以真心講系個個都滿分祝你好運。。。
reviews.comment_workload: workload冇 ； 得lab要上，計分，最後有個programming assignment 同埋written assignment 做完就有分輕鬆過。

reviews.author: davidsun1972
reviews.comment_content: Great content, teaches a lot about the basics of java programming. classes are easy to understand, but a bit boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Muppala is a great teacher, his teaching might be a bit slow if you are very into computers.
reviews.comment_grading: Mean is very very high, with a high sd also, so it will be very hard to get A or A+. You need to score really high (95+) on the midterm and final to get A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
The lab is a bit confusing at the end (eclipse)
one programming assignment using greenfoot that requires some time. Don't copy or you'll get bad marks

reviews.author: Maggie2000
reviews.comment_content:
(pros)
Introduction to JAVA for dummies. Help students get a better understanding to programming. I'd like to say I can teach myself other programming languages by reading blogs and tutorials after taking the course.
(cons)
The course is relatively shallow. Also limited scope. Stops at recursion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
MUPPALA is a lovely professor who is willing to answer all kinds of questions after class. But I always want to sleep during the class... Maybe it is my fault.
But I truly don't think I can learn a lot in the 50-min lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: Fine. If you really understand the course content, you can handle the exams without much trouble. Owing to the shallow syllabus, both the final and midterm aren't hard. But you have to pay more attention to the details.
reviews.comment_workload: Adequate. Just attend the lectures, read the notes, finish the labs and assignments. It's a fun course. I usually launch eclipse whenever I'm tired of other courses. Programming is fun.

reviews.author: liwingyankobe
reviews.title: 運game
reviews.comment_content: 好基本嘅programming concept，有學過program嘅會極輕鬆。一開頭會用一個叫greenfoot嘅垃圾軟件，之後轉eclipse會好啲
reviews.comment_teaching: Instructor上堂幾有趣嘅，解釋都算係易明。Lab嘅TA就唔清楚，每次都係自己做完
reviews.comment_grading: 因為啲野好淺，會有一大堆人9字頭甚至滿分。去到考試唔小心錯咗題已經跌grade，無論本身幾勁都無用。Cutoff又係高到喊，就算9字頭仍然會有機率B range
reviews.comment_workload: Ok輕鬆嘅。有lab但每次都好快做完可以早走。得一份手寫同一分打code功課，基本上好快搞掂，但因為大部份都滿分，要花心機check清楚

reviews.author: Super Toxic Man
reviews.title: good grade course
reviews.comment_content: This course is designed to equip students with the fundamental concepts of programming elements and data abstraction using Java. Students will learn how to write procedural programs using variables, arrays, control statements, loops, recursion, data abstraction and objects using an integrated development environment
reviews.comment_teaching: good teacher and clear understanding and good presentation
reviews.comment_grading: i get a grade easily and it make me learn a lot about java
reviews.comment_workload: low workload  because there are few labs and assignment. it make me learn a lot but also no more workload. it is a good study balance.

reviews.author: adrianos
reviews.comment_content: It is not an introductory course for programming and the content is too hard for students with no programming background. Chosen topics are appropriate though.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good, with class exercise as well as good teaching materials.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not that good, as most of the students are already proficient in programming before taking the course.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not that high, just attend regular lab and complete lab assignments. Midterms and final exam is quite demanding for an introductory course, you have to be prepared to write a program out of nothing.

reviews.author: iamsamlau
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting with different programming code. Need to revision before writing a program.
If you are interested in programming, you will find that it is so easy to learn and understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Self-learning is important and be careful about the bug which is made when the (; () {} /) is typing wrongly.
reviews.comment_grading: Not hard to get a higher grade which includes C vs C++, C++ vs Java, Basics, Operators, Arrays and Strings, References and Pointers and Functions
reviews.comment_workload: It is difficult to pick up the stuff if you don't understand the meaning of different C++ or Java Language.

reviews.author: aditya lamba
reviews.comment_content: Basic Java with introduction to greenfoot. Very simple class. Easy for anyone with no background in computer science.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not that great professor. But is really nice person if you go and ask any question. Prompt reply to e-mails by prof.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading if you get everything above mean. Easy midterm and finals. Labs are easy to do as well. Similar to past papers, lectures and class examples.
reviews.comment_workload: Bare minimum. Labs are weekly but you can get it down beforehand and just show it in the lab timings and leave. No attendance

reviews.author: T. S.
reviews.title: DON'T CHOOSE THIS COURSE IF YOU HAVE NO PROGRAMMING BACKGROUND
reviews.comment_content:
Eclipse and Greenfoot are being used this semester.

1. Basic data types, variables, assignment statements, console I/O
2. Arithmetic expressions, Boolean expressions
3. Branching and looping statements
4. Arrays
5. Classes and objects, properties and methods
6. Inheritance
7. Static variables and methods
8. Primitive types and reference types
9. Scope rules
10. String manipulations
11. File I/O Recursion
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is a very passionate tutor as he often raises his tone to attract students. He explains every concepts in details and he provides us with multiple codes that correspond with his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
- Coursework (30%)
         -Lab Exercises (10%)
         -Programming Assignments (20%)

- Individual Examinations (70%)
         -Mid-term Exam (30%)
         -Final Exam (40%)

Grades are very lenient this semester as the majority of students got A and B range.
reviews.comment_workload:
The course consists of, per week
-2 hours of lectures
-2 hours of lab exercises (You can leave early if you completed the tasks)

You have to attend the labs held on every weeks and complete simple tasks.

Two complicated assignments (1. Photo Editor, 2.  A* algorithm ) are given to students this semester. TAs eventually give us a lot of tips to equip us with extra knowledge to finish the tasks.

reviews.author: Doctor
reviews.title: This will be a must take course
reviews.comment_content: The content is basically about java programming language. we use 2 IDE for java programming the first half of semester, we mainly use eclipse. this part will teach you how to use eclipse and the setup. this will also teach you the syntax for java programming such as public static void main (string[] args), if then else, variables, looping. the second half of semester we were using greenfoot as IDE, feature teaching at object oriented programming
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching excellent, the ppt is having lots of funny pictures, with clear outline and also having lots of example for each concept.

for the speech of teacher, he usually raises lots of questions to arouse students' interest and he is willing to answer all questions from students.
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A+ in this semester, and most of my friend got an A- or above. basically, the professor will consider giving half of the class an A range if the majority of students score well(the instructor said on the first day of lecture)
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload can consider as high especially for those who did not have programming base. there are labs for each week and each lab is having only the questions and some related materials and does not contain any skeleton code, students have to think how to write a programme to satisfy the lab requirement.

Moreover, there are 2 assignments for the semester, each assignment is a great challenge.

The first assignment was to create a mini photoshop. students are required to create the effects for pictures with provided skeleton code.

the second assignment was to use greenfoot to implements A* pathfinding algorithm. the algorithm itself is hard to understand and is not covered during the lecture. you have to watch external documents and example from the external source to accomplish it. but it will be fine for the coming semester as the instructor said is only the TA having too high expectation on us, and this assignment will not be that difficult for the coming year.

for the mid term and final. basically is the matter of careless. if you are careful enough, you can get >90%. never forget to mention, the exam paper of this instructor is exclusively tricky and difficult.

reviews.author: matt147
reviews.title: Suggest to take this course if Desmond is the only instructor
reviews.comment_content: The content flow of the course was total different from the previous semesters because only Desmond Tsoi was in charge for this course in Spring 2017. He tried to make revolutionary differences regarding the course content, exam questions, difficulties, assignments and the grading system. Therefore, you may wonder why the reviews for the course in Spring 2017 are much better than others. The changes made COMP 1022P a much better course for students who want to study advanced Computer Science courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is a good guy and his teaching is vivid. Attend the lessons allow you to have a thorough understanding although the lecture notes are very clear about everything. If you have questions, he is always available to help you. You can easily master all the concepts if you attend the lessons and ask him in person.
reviews.comment_grading: I have to emphasise the grading for the course is good only when it is taught by Desmond as the only instructor. He promised to give 30% of A-range. I got 0.6 sd above mean for mid term and 1 sd above mean for final and nearly full marks in assignments and it turned out to be A-range. The exams were designed to be more difficult so the mean was not very high.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was relatively heavy comparing to the previous semesters. The assignments were more difficult and time-consuming especially for the second one. The second assignment was suggested by the TAs as the most difficult assignment ever in the course history as the A* algorithm was not even covered in the 2000-level courses. This assignment was designed by a foreign TA and Desmond was quite regretful for giving us this assignment so he provided tips to lower the difficulties before the deadline. Yet, you can learn many things in the assignments.

reviews.author: KelvinC
reviews.comment_content:
A simple intro to java programming.
Quite interesting and not that difficult for beginners.
It is good for beginners who are gonna dig deeper in programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Wilfred is good. All stuff clearly explained, but a bit slow and boring. What he is gonna talk about is mostly in the ppt.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab & Assignment : full mark
MT : 88/100
Final : 97/100
Grade : A

P.S.: I'm a beginner.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just 1 easy lab per week with helpful TAs.

1 assignment for this entire course which is separated into 2 parts. But no help will be given to this.

Quite easy to get full marks.

reviews.author: johnson
reviews.title: OK course
reviews.comment_content: ok for newcomer cause I learned Java first from this lesson
reviews.comment_teaching: the tone of English is not good to understand
reviews.comment_grading: if you spend enough time on it you will have good grade. I think it is a good grade course.
reviews.comment_workload: Just the same as the last one. Not a very heavy workload as long as you spend enough time on it. There will be no test in the class but you have to attend the class in order to get all the contents that you need to know. What's more there will be one a midterm exam and a final exam. Repeat my word again. As long as you put enough time to understand the contents you will get good grade.

reviews.author: Travis_L
reviews.title: 初次寫Program的人比較難
reviews.comment_content: 內容圍繞基本的JAVA coding, 但對於初次寫Program的人比較難。加上用到新的software, 對於沒有任何基礎或興趣的人, 不太建議。但對於之後COMP course, 讀COMP1022P會比較有用。
reviews.comment_teaching: 好比心機教, 基本上都知大家冇咩Programming經驗。
reviews.comment_grading: 如果冇底既要努力D, 因為有其他識Program既人會讀,所以唔建議作為COMMON CORE。
reviews.comment_workload: 有midterm, final(open book), project(3 parts), lab(every week)。雖然多野做, 但唔算太難, Workload 一般。

reviews.author: LEE JUWON
reviews.title: Reasonable but super Effort
reviews.comment_content: Interesting Course for all the beginners. it becomes a real fun when you start understanding the syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: I liked the professor but it was too difficult to understand what he was saying as I was very new to the computer world.
reviews.comment_grading: I would say that this course is definitely unfair for the beginners as many so-called EXPERTS take this course for their computer science or engineering majors. However, I wouldn't say that obtaining a good grade is impossible.
reviews.comment_workload:
Damn lot for beginners. Tiny for so-called Experts. To be honest, I did not understand any the lecture materials. I needed lots of help from the TAs to improve and of course, self-study. I spent a majority of my time trying to pass this course and this resulted in me getting a lower mark in other subjects...........

P.S Take this course If you dare.

reviews.author: app_Sci
reviews.comment_content:
Covers about 3-4 month's material in 4 weeks.
Covering
The learning is mostly based on online components at first, then it is face-to-face components.
Below are the main contents:
Computer hardware, software, data types, variables, object-oriented programming, branching statements, loops, arrays, file Input/Output, event driven programming, GUI, Character strings, recursion, Abstract Data Types,...
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is good, and he may ask us about the opinion of the course after the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
fair grading. According to the teacher, the mean is about 75/100 for midterm exam.
Grading components:
Online activities (For assessing what you learnt before the face to face components) (10%)
In-class activities (Actually really just for attendance) (10%)
Labs (10%)
Project (10%)
Midterm Exam (15%)
Final Exam (45 %)
I got 74.33% and got a C+.
PS: You cannot see the mean of the class in CANVAS.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very Heavy.
From Dec 20 to Jan 18, we have to learn about 3-4 month's content.
Also, we have to complete lots of online modules, quizzes, and online labs.
After the midterm, they only have one week for you to learn, then it is final exam already.
If you are not ready to work under heavy pressure and intense deadline, then do not take this course!!!!

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Newbies do have a chance to do well!
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to Java Programming - the course contents are actually understandable for beginners like me. They include basic syntax of Java and concepts of programming like objects and classes, loops, arrays, recursion, etc. Content after the mid-term can be quite difficult.

♦ Introduction to Computers - Hardware and Software
♦ Elementary Programming
♦ Objects and Classes
♦ Variables and Scope rules (extensively tested in the mid-term)
♦ Expressions and Branching Statements
♠ Loops
♠ Arrays and Nested Loop
♠ Console I/O
♠ String manipulation and File I/O using Eclipse
♠ Recursion
♠ Putting Programming Concepts Together

♦ Pre-midterm topics
♠ Post-midterm topics
reviews.comment_teaching:
A good professor. He always creates a relaxing atmosphere in the lectures. He's also very friendly towards computer noobs like me. He uses various examples on powerpoints to illustrate different concepts, and I think his explanation is clear enough.

The lab sessions, however, are quite annoying at times as the lab helper is absent for no reason at times. There was once I had to wait for more than 1 hour to wait for my demonstration of the lab work, as the TA was busy checking the others.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab (10%)
Nearly everyone got full mark. It's basically attendance marks. Many people just finished the lab work beforehand and showed it to the TA immediately when the lab session started.

Assignment (20%)
Nearly everyone got full mark.

Mid-term (30%) - Mean 66.08 / SD 20.39
It was quite hard and tricky. Pay special attention to the details.

Final Exam (40%) - Mean 78.51 / SD 17.79
It was much easier than the mid-term.

The cut-off marks were insane. Lots of people got 91% and ended up with only B range. I was pretty lucky, as I got more than 98% which translated to an A+. (But probably if I got one or two more MCs wrong in the mid-term I would lose that A+) Just have to be very careful when doing the exams and during the revision, pay extra attention to the details because there are many questions focusing on the details the professor would not elaborate on. The past papers can help a lot in preparing for exams.

As a word of encouragement, getting a good grade isn't impossible, even if you're new to programming.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only assignment was the Mastermind game using Greenfoot. The assignment wasn't a heavy workload as the website already contained very detailed instruction on the implementation of methods. All I needed was to follow the instruction. It was just 1 to 2 hours for each of the 2 parts, so the workload wasn't really heavy at all.

Exams are open-notes, and thus they don't need a lot of memorization. This significantly reduces the workload during the revision for the exams. But remember to do past paper!!!

reviews.author: K. H.
reviews.title: Not a course for people without programming background
reviews.comment_content:
Basically uses Java Language to teach some of the basics of programming and the concept of object and class, topics included:
1. Hardware and Software
2. Elementary Programming (Language Basics)
3. Object and Class
4. Scope of Variable
5. Branching Expression
6. Loop
7. Arrays
8. String
9. File I/O
10. Recursion
11. Abstract Data Type (in this semester, this topic is included in the form of supplementary notes and not included in the exams)

Although the content is quite adequate for an introductory course of Java, the topics included may be too difficult for programming beginners and for some people with little knowledge of object-oriented language. I would recommend those people to take COMP 1021 or COMP 1022Q instead.
