reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor MUPPALA's English is quite understandable. In addition, he has a relatively slow pace of talking and teaching. This makes people very easy to follow his idea.

He also put emphasis on some key ideas and try to make some jokes in class (although sometimes his jokes are not understandable), this makes his teaching clearer and more interesting.

He is also very willing to answer student's questions in class and after class, this help students to learn more.

The only downside of his teaching is that sometimes he put too much time on some topics and actually delayed the original schedule of teaching.

The teaching assistants are all friendly and approachable. They are very willing to answer your questions through e-mail or directly in office.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading scheme is as the following:
Laboratory work: 10%
Assignment: 20%
Mid-term exam: 30%
Final exam: 40%

I got full marks in both lab work and assignment, 87/100 in mid-term exam (Mean: 65.95, SD: 20.39) and 98/100 in final exam. (Mean: 78.51, SD: 17.79) The overall percentage is 95.3% and I got an A.

The grading is quite harsh because many people with strong programming background would get really high marks in the exams. So be careful in the exams, otherwise you will lose a lot of marks and get a lower grade.

Also, the time given for assignment and lab work is quite sufficient (in case you cannot finish your lab work in the lab session, you can still submit it within a few days), so please finish all work to ensure you won't lose marks which others don't.

(Fyr, the grading rubrics is attached)
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload for this course is relatively high.

For the lab works, the first few allows you to simply follow the instructions in the lab notes and finish the tasks. However for the later ones, you need to actually solve the tasks by yourself. The lab notes only serves as very general guidelines (although sometimes the TA will provide some hint)

For the assignment, in this semester we are required to reproduce the game "Mastermind" by using "GreenFoot" (a programming platform using Java with GUI). The assignment takes really much time so I recommend spending a few weeks on it. In addition, self-study of the lecture notes is prefered (all lecture notes are provided on the course website) to finish the assignment asap.

attachments.name: Grading Rubrics for COMP1022P Introduction to Computing with Java

reviews.author: dell_monitors
reviews.title: OK la
reviews.comment_content: Data types, File I/O, ADT, Arrays, Recursion and all kinds of programming fundamentals. The content is suitable for beginners but the teaching is very fast paced.
reviews.comment_teaching: It's not bad, he tries to make the lectures interesting. Labs usually do not take too much time to complete at first but later on it actually gets a bit challenging.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you're a complete beginner, good luck. Means are very high.
Midterm mean/ sd: 66/20.39
Final : 78/ 17.79
reviews.comment_workload: If you've done programming before, there's almost no workload apart from the assignment, but again good luck for the beginners.

reviews.author: Robin
reviews.comment_content:
Java basics. Covered contents: object and class, elementary programming skills, scope, loops, array, recursion, talks a little bit about ADT.
The IDE used are greenfoot and Eclipse.
The class and object concepts are REALLY CONFUSING for a beginner, I regard it can be better understood after learning COMP 2011.
and if you want to take further comp courses, taking 1022p is suggested!
reviews.comment_teaching:
the professor is okay. passionate and easy to approach.
Teaching assistant Wallace is great. Responsible and easy-going. And I think the student helper for my lab session is also great (sometimes help me more than the TA).
reviews.comment_grading:
Spring semester is easier to get good grade compared with fall sem. I heard that it needed more than 97%+ to get A+ in 2015/16 fall. I got 95% something and also A+ in spring sem.
Open book. The difficulty level of exams are adequate. But getting a descent grade is relatively harder...
reviews.comment_workload:
open book, weekly lab sessions, no need to finish ahead. 2 assignments, takes about 4-10 hours to finish. easy to get full marks.
reviews are essential to get good grades in midterm and finals. programming practice is suggested.

reviews.author: ettk
reviews.title: COMP1022P
reviews.comment_content: Covering basic programming techniques like looping, branching, recursion, data types..., with special emphasis on object and class in object-oriented programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tried to make lessons fun by making jokes, but somehow messing up the content. But in general, he can explain concepts quite clearly.
reviews.comment_grading: Mean and sd are relatively high due to easy exams. Try not to make any careless mistake to secure a satisfactory grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy at all. Basically just one lab per week, an assignment that asked us to write some codes according to the framework (instructions of how should you write is given so no worry), and 2 exams.

reviews.author: Lizoy
reviews.title: Excellent Professor and Good Course
reviews.comment_content: Basic java language introduction starting from simple Greenfoot to Eclipse. It generally covers variable, concepts of classes and object, arithmetic and boolean expressions and branching statements in the context before midterm. After that, upon finishing loops, it suddenly swifts from Greenfoot to Eclipse talking about string and console input and output. It ends with recursion. The overall content is just basic concepts and not much sophisticated. If you want to learn more, you can always refer to Greenfoot API or some other online documentations.
reviews.comment_teaching: At first I am worried about the Professor's accent but it turns out that not only can he makes him clear but also leverages his sense of humour and tells lots of jokes in class to entertain. He is always open to questions. Personally I strongly recommend this professor.
reviews.comment_grading: If you has some basic programming knowledge in whatever language, just follow the professor in lectures and do some pastpaper, it is easy to get 90+ in midterm and get full marks in the assignment (the assignment is a little game which you are guided to finish by leveraging your programming knowledge and your own logic) .
reviews.comment_workload: The course website offers 3-5 not grade-related questions to check your understanding. Just follow the professor carefully in lectures you can easily nail most of them. Some of them is confusing and it is better to ask to professors he will cross check and give feedback. It is not time-consuming but it can help you with your understanding. If you don't want to write your own games, then finishing the assigned project just takes about 3-5 nights in total. I think it has the lightest workload in my first semester except math1013.

reviews.author: Ziuwin
reviews.comment_content: It's a really basic java course. Being an introductory course, this course has mostly everything to get you started with no background at all.
reviews.comment_teaching: The way the lecturer taught was really good. He used examples everyone could relate to and made sure we were all following his teachings.
reviews.comment_grading: The exams were pretty hard, but with enough self-practice it is pretty manageable. Midterms was hard, so was the finals. :(
reviews.comment_workload:
Most people recommend to try doing the tutorial questions before actually going to the tutorial. The TAs are very helpful, explaining why this doesn't work and blablabla, but because it is a big class, they may not be able to cover all students.
There is also a small project where you create a mini game, and with adequate attendance and listening, you would be able to complete the project with minimal help.

reviews.author: Michael28
reviews.comment_content:
Very simple introduction to java.
You can learn how to write some basic programs in Eclipse and it is quite interesting .
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred is a good professor. He explains the concept clearly but a bit boring as he just read the PPTs in the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm 86/100
final 93/100
lab full marks

Grade: B+
(quite hard to get A range)
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab are easy. The TAs are helpful.

There are only one assignment.
Not difficult even you don't have source.
But TAs will not answer any question about the assignment. You have to do it by youself.

reviews.author: Chelsea
reviews.title: Not as terrific as heard
reviews.comment_content: Very simple introduction to java language. Most syntax.Suitable for beginners of programming. For me,who hadn't touch programming before,I fell I really learned something from this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pedro is very patient and helpful. Even on his trip he replied to your email instantly.
reviews.comment_grading: I got quite a good grade. Not as terrible as I heard before. If you listen carefully in class and read notes thoroughly it's not hard to get a a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Not very heavy. Just ccc's normal. There are 2 assignments. But both are quite simple.

reviews.author: STL
reviews.title: COMP1022P
reviews.comment_content: Basic and useful knowledge. Program your own game based on your own understanding. 主要讲解关于Java语音的基本内容，简单的编程逻辑，有助于养成对计算机语言的初步概念。
reviews.comment_teaching: Instructor 人很nice and patience，善于活跃气氛，讲解based on 课件，同时也有很多补充的内容. TA和Instructor 本人都非常乐于在课上和课后提供帮助
reviews.comment_grading: 大家得分都比较高，想拿好龟的话需要非常细心，在考试中不可犯太多错误。Project 尽量要拿到满分。
reviews.comment_workload: workload比较适中，没有平时作业，有两次大考试和一个project. Project 时间充裕，允许与同学交流，压力不算太大。

reviews.author: PawelP
reviews.comment_content: Basic Java stuff. I would say it is extremely interesting for someone that didn't take Java before (like me). At the end you can write some basic programs in Eclipse.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond is an awesome professor. Really lively, funny and likable.
The tutorial guys are way more boring, but the stuff there is quite easy.

You can access all lectures online (videos), but you have to attend the tutorials.

I don't like the use of Greenfoot at the beginning. The transition to eclipse is quite rough. I would much rather prefer to start in the Eclipse.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exams are HARD, especially that many students know Java before.
There is one midterm and one final. The mean is around 75%.
Labs are super easy, but you have to do the tasks - it is more like a attendance grade.
The assignment is not easy, but you have lots of time to do it. You are allowed to consult with professors and friends, so in reality everyone gets 100%.
reviews.comment_workload:
If you have never done Java, it is lots of work.
If you have done Java - no work at all.

reviews.author: WYKEI
reviews.comment_content: Learn about object oriented programming language, some basic concepts of writing program such as class,keywords, loop,array. It focus on how you understand the knowledge of Java.
reviews.comment_teaching: As a student who knows nothing about computer and programing, it was very difficult to catch up, especially after the mid term, I understood nothing after taking the course.
reviews.comment_grading: Actually, the grading was very good,  although I really do not understand the concepts and I was always below the mean [ more than 1 sd ] , I still got C+ in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was really heavy even though you work hard. You have to make a chess game and it has to follow the rules. If you do not understand the concepts, you are not able to finish the assignment. However, you can bring notes to take the exam, you can use less time to make revision.

reviews.author: Gman
reviews.comment_content: The content is pretty easy. Its basic Java. Those with even the slightest knowledge about programming will find the course quite simple. As for those are new to programming, you'll have to put some effort to understand the concept if you want to keep up
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor definitely knows the concepts inside and out and is able to explain them in quite a lot of detail with plenty of examples during the lectures.

Side note: He enjoys cracking jokes every now and then.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is separated into lab attendance, final project, mid-term exam and final exam.

Since the content is pretty basic, you can expect the mean for the mid-term and finals to be somewhere around 80-90.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload for this course is not exactly light but it is still pretty manageable. There are around 11 lab sessions, a final project and of course the two exams to work on.

For the lab sessions, you can do it before hand on your personal laptop and show it to the lab instructor during the lab session if you wish to leave early.

reviews.author: SL
reviews.title: Better for those who have basic programming concept
reviews.comment_content:
The course is mostly based on a simple java programing sofeware Greenfoot and some on Eclipse.
The topics includes introduction of object-orietated programming, loops, if-else statement.....etc.
However, it is better for those who have some basic programming concepts before studying this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wilfred's is ok. He will answer students' questions. However, his explantion is not quite clear sometimes.
Some of the TAs are willing to help you if you do not know about the assignments and labs.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. However, many people get high marks in midterm and final. Therefore, the mean mark is at around 70-80 out of 100. The Mean of this course is about B-. If you have basic programing concepts before studying the course, It is not quite tough to get the mean score.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 8-9 labs in total. You must attend the labs as attendence are recorded. However, you finish the lab task before the session as you can obtain the tasks online and bring your own computers to show your programs to TAs.
There is an 鬥獸棋 assignment. It is quite complicated especially for those who have not learnt programming before; as you have consider the rules and develop a program by yourself carefully.

reviews.author: Balileua
reviews.comment_content:
Basic syntax about Java, won't be difficult as long as you have attended all lessons(or at least watch the lecture videos if you insisted to skip the lessons) and done some extra research on it.
Topics:
1)Introduction to computers: Hardware and Software
2)Elementary Programming(variables, console output, comments..etc)
3)Objects and Classes
4)Variables and scope rules
5)expressions and branching statements(switch, if-else statement, boolean operator, comparison operator, arithmetic operator)
6)loops(while loop, do-while loop and for loop)
7)string manipulation and File I/O
8)Arrays and nested loop
9)console I/O
10)recursion
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is a great teacher. A very nice guy and is very professional in teaching xd The lessons are interesting and   he had explained the concepts clearly. It will be nice if you could find him personally after lessons and ask more questions before you leave. Personally, I had learned a lot (though many of them are supplementary, but it will be useful if you were very interested in CS or want to get a better grade ) during the talks with Desmond.
reviews.comment_grading:
8 Labs :10%
Assignments ( Part 1 + 2 ) : 20%
Midterm: 30%
Final: 40%

We are doing a new project this year (Mastermind), it is easy and you could always find your lecturer or TA for help if you really need. There will be no difficulties for you to get a full mark for labs and assignments.

Midterm is easy, just remember to bring your notes will be fine. Revision on past papers is already enough. However, the final this year is much difficult than the previous years (mean 65.8) and seems like the CSE department are trying to make the finals more and more difficult. So do be well-prepared, don't be scared when you see difficult problems, they are a bit tricky but you will be able to solve it if you calmed down. ~92.x% is an A for the course this semester. AVOID silly mistakes, they will be the greatest killer to your grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
relatively light workload. You could finished the lab before the lab session if you want to leave earlier.
Labs are relatively easy, assignments will also be tested during the lab sessions.
No homework.

reviews.author: Vaishu
reviews.comment_content: The content is also pretty easy. Its basic Java. Anybody with even slight knowledge about programming will find the course extremely simple. Those who have no programming knowledge, may be required to put a little effort.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is amazing at teaching. He knows all the concepts really well and is very helpful. His teaching style is very energetic.
reviews.comment_grading: Since the course content is very simple, the mean tends to be very very high. Usually the mean is 90. The s.d is 5-6. Thus getting a good grade may not be very easy.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not very light, but manageable. There are 10 or more labs, 1 project assignment and two exams. The assignment is usually difficult.

reviews.author: YSA
reviews.comment_content:
Suitable content for an intro course to computing. Starts off with the very basics like hardware and software, input/output devices, etc. Various basic coding aspects are covered including objects and classes, variables, expressions, branching, loops, arrays, strings, file IO, recursion.

Content is taught using Java with the Greenfoot software for most of the course. The software is very simple for beginners as it has an easy graphical user interface. Later Eclipse is introduced, which is more advanced but the course does not go too much into details.

Overall the content is manageable for a student with no previous background in any kind of computing or coding, and will be very easy if you have learnt any kind of programming before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wilfred is a good professor, explains the concepts well and clearly. Always open to questions and any kind of problems with the course content, assignments or project.

The lectures can be a bit boring as he just reads off the PPTs. Not necessary to attend the lectures if you prefer reading the PPTs on your own.
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%)
Programming assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (30%)
Final exam (40%)

Grading can be a little harsh because the laboratories and programming assignments are so easy that many people get full 30% there. In the exams a lot of people get very high marks (90-95%+) because they have some kind of programming experience before, which makes these exams extremely easy.

I got 30/30 in laboratories and assignments, slightly below mean in Midterm, ~1 SD above mean in Final: overall B+ grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is quite manageable. Weekly laboratory assignments are quite easy and most students complete them before and just bring them to the lab sessions to show it to the TAs.
The main workload is the programming assignment which is creating a simple board game using Greenfoot. It is split into 2 parts and there is enough time provided, but make sure to start early and not at the last day. Although it takes some time to complete, it is very easy to get full marks.
The exams are not too difficult and a quick read of the lecture notes before the exams is enough even without attending lectures (also you can carry lecture notes to the exams). The past papers provided on the course website are very useful for practice.

reviews.author: rsm
reviews.title: Good course overall.
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers basic java syntax and fundamental programming concepts which include variables, classes, if statements , loops, recursion and file IO.

These concepts are taught using greenfoot to help visualize classes and objects. The latter part of the course is taught with eclipse.

This course is intended for beginners so students with solid programming knowledge should find it easy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Muppala explains the materials clearly and often gives real life examples to illustrate abstract programming concepts. He is willing to answer questions during the lecture. Occasionally, he tells jokes to brighten the classroom mood but his jokes get repetitive and overused.

Labs are useful, let you practice concepts that were just taught in the lecture. TAs will give tasks which you have to finish during the lab session in order to get lab grades. They are willing to help out if you get stuck.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading consists of:

-> 10% Labs
-> 20% Assignment
-> 30% Mid-Term
-> 40% Final Exam

The exams are fair as no materials out of scope were asked. You may bring lecture notes. These are useful for referring to specific syntax and conventions.

The mean will be high as this is an introductory course yet many  students have programming background. Be very careful when answering questions in the exams and try to get full points in the labs and assignment. Expect a lot of students getting 90+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload consists of an assignment and labs.

No extra workload for labs as these can be done during the lab sessions. Lab tasks are posted on the course website so these can be done in advance, allowing you to come to the lab sessions only to show your work and leave immediately.

The assignment consists of making a jungle chess game in greenfoot. The details of the assignment are posted on the course website 1 month before the deadline.

reviews.author: lisean789
reviews.comment_content: Basic java syntax: variables, methods, scoops, array, conditional loops, and so on. Nothing difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred's teaching is quite good.He gives out presents for students who ans his question. But I still skipped most of the lessons. It's rather easy to learn everything from notes.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grade. mean is high, 7X to 8X. Midterm and final must get 9X to get a A range. Mean is about B-. But once again, it is not difficult to get 8X to 9X if you go through the pastpapers.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. 1 assignment, 2 parts. If you have source, no problem. Have counted attendance labs every week.

reviews.author: AlvinChan
reviews.comment_content: Content covers all the basics of Computer Science. this i the hardest language to start Computer Science in at HKUST however.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor did not know what he was doing sometimes. His examples don't help explain the contents of Computer Science and the lecture notes are only so-so. The TAs really know what they are doing though and will help look through your code for labs. I especially had difficulty with File I/O.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean will be inflated by people who have already taken computer science courses. The midterm is rather difficult but the final is rather easy given lecture notes. I finished this class with a B-. Lab sections grade on attendance though you can start+finish the lab assignment before and submit it then.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not super high. What work there is will be hard if you do not understand the concepts that the lab/projects cover.

reviews.author: Christopher PK
reviews.comment_content: Basic java programming, perfect for beginners. Recommend for those with no programming experience, and those who would like to play with some real programming. Unlike other languages like Python, which is simply a script.
reviews.comment_teaching: poor powerpoint and teaching. Wrong info shown on slides, wrong programming concept. Please do not take Wilfred's class.
reviews.comment_grading: good grade course. Getting an A should be easy, if and only if you scored full marks in the major project. Attendance only for the labs.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. One major java project, which won't take longer than two weeks to complete.

reviews.author: Rubbish
reviews.title: 簡單course
reviews.comment_content:
內容講下loop,recursion,基本java既語言
主要用greenfoot去教書
內容就唔難 都係教最基本既野 會用下D example黎教
reviews.comment_teaching:
英文唔清楚，仲有上堂講野成日1999
解釋一D概念個陣佢自己都好似唔係好識解甘樣 每堂都係照讀PPT 有時會比D
reviews.comment_grading:
考試有open note
grade一般  
因為容易份卷好易 所以midterm 同 final 個mean都好高 兩個都差唔多90分 因為連final都幾多人90幾分
錯少少可能就會跌左個SUB grade
reviews.comment_workload:
每星期有個LAB 好簡單 唔識做問人拎個CODE都得
有個assignment係整鬥獸棋 唔識問人教你都得 內容唔難 跟足做都會有100分

reviews.author: Zach Chan
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content: This course focuses on basic Java programming language. Greenfoot and Eclipse the softwares are required. All labs were all provided in the course website at the beginning of the course, so if you are familar with Java already, i suggest you finish them first and show them to TAs in the corresponding lab sessions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Ng showed lots of examples in the PowerPoint slides to illustrate the Java concepts. Lectures attendance is not counted and all course materials will be uploaded via course website and emails.
reviews.comment_grading:
My grade: 94% A-
Very good grade overall
Exams are not difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
Total 8-9 labs
Lab attendance and completion are recorded.
You can bring your own notebooks to show your programs to TAs.
An assignment titled 鬥獸棋 is needed to handed in sep. by 2 parts. It is quite complex and TAs are willing to help you if you do not know how to complete the assignments and labs.

reviews.author: Jackie
reviews.title: A bit difficult for beginners
reviews.comment_content: Overall, the course mainly focused on using Java language in Greenfoot, and move to eclipse, which is more difficult than the former. It taught about basic programming techniques in Java at first and more advanced applications mostly after mid-term. The course is not very difficult to handle but as a beginner in programming I found it quite hard to understand the logic. To be able to understand everything I needed to read the textbook and the powerpoint slides thoroughly and try the codes by myself using my own computer using my spare time. Maybe because I am not very interested in programming, I did find the course a bit dull and demanding. My advice is to take this course only if you are very fond of the subject.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Muppala is a very dedicated teacher as he was always trying to grasp students' attention and engage in the lesson very well. he also tried to use many interesting real-life examples in illustrated abstract concepts which made the lectures not boring.
The TAs are very helpful and they were willing to provide any information about the course to you. Like when you dunno how to fulfill lab tasks they will be eager to assist you and give you some hints.
reviews.comment_grading: I guess many people got very good grades in the midterm and final exams, like 90 or more. Also many students found the homework (the chess game) not difficult as they mostly did the bonus points. Personally I got more than 85 in both midterm and final exams but I didn't do well in my project. At last I got 65-70 as my total score and I got a B-.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload is quite high, especially the homework. It requires you to make a Chess game by using Greenfoot according to the rules they give you. Many students were able to figure out how to do it but maybe because I dun like programming very much and I'm a beginner, I gave up some part of it. However apart from that I needed almost 5 days to finish it.
Labs are quite difficult as well so I mostly asked the TAs for help.

reviews.author: harusan
reviews.title: Quite useful and basic COMP course
reviews.comment_content:
The course teaches basic programming concepts in java language.

The basic concepts were taught with Greenfoot, a graphical intro to java. The topics includes introduction of object-orietated programming, loops, if-else statement.....etc. After midterm, the course is taught with eclipse.

Most of the topics are easy at the begining of the course, and give you a general idea of what programming is.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor explains the concepts clearly. He uses pens and paper to explain each steps of the code, and answers the question of students patiently.
reviews.comment_grading:
According to the professor, the ability of students in this year is high comparing with previous years.  Hence, the mean of this semester is quite high as many ppl get above 90. To get an A range in this semester, you need to get above 92%, and 96% for A+approximately in your final score.

Therefore, one little mistakes in th exam can lower your grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very little workload. You can finish the lab task in your home, and show it to the TAs in the lab session.

For the assignment, we have to use greenfoot to write a Jungle Board game, which is quite easy. Most of the ppl get full marks in their assignments. You can finish the bonus tasks(which are not too difficult) to prevent yourself from losing any marks.

Just make sure you understand all the concepts for the exams, then everything will be fine.

reviews.author: Andrew
reviews.title: Introduction to Computing with Java
reviews.comment_content: 普遍講Greenfoot 同埋 Eclipse。好straight forward 但要完全明白好難。
reviews.comment_teaching: 其實所有concepts都解釋得頗清楚，但因為Programming本身比較難明白既關係，要自己做吓test同埋打吓Programme先會明。
reviews.comment_grading: 呢個course就出名好grade㗎啦~ 我大約88%攞B+，好唔好grade你自己話啦~
reviews.comment_workload: Workload最重係個assignment要寫鬥獸棋，我整咗10hrs~ 其他都係做lab（其實可以Lab session 先做，但做定先可以早走...）

reviews.author: LauY
reviews.comment_content:
The course is divided into two parts. The basics are taught with Greenfoot, a graphical intro to java. It might be confusing for those who have some sort of programming background, but generally it is a good starter programming tool. The second part is taught with Eclipse.

The topics includes if, while, do..while loops, arrays, basic console and file i/o, etc. All of those are fairly easy. Except for recursion, which I have heard that many struggled with.

Labs are very easy, the TAs didn't mind you bringing your already finished lab works to their sessions, so you have plenty of time to prepare well at home if you find any of the works hard.

The assignment is about some Chinese chess game. If you don't already know how to play the game, it might be a little hard to get the rules.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is very clear. The ppt slides are easy to read and understand. The professor speaks well and would not mind clearing some concepts up or answering questions in class. Most of the classes are 9am ones, so the professor tried really hard to lift up the spirits.
reviews.comment_grading:
1 midterm, 1 final, 1 assignment (with 2 parts), and multiple labs.

Grading for assignment is very lose, for a 100 full mark assignment, you have 50 marks bonuses. So if you really can't finish one of the requirements, you can still get full marks by doing some bonus tasks.

The exams are not hard but that results in a very high mean and s.d. Mean is ~80% while sd is ~18% for both the exams. So you can't really have careless mistakes or it will cost you a subgrade.
reviews.comment_workload:
both exams are open-book exams, so you only need to fully understand the concepts to take them
labs are easy, the TAs are helpful

overall light workload comparing to other UST courses

reviews.author: Eric Chan
reviews.comment_content: The first half of the course uses greenfoot and the second half uses eclipse. The teaches programming from the start so it is not difficult even you haven't learn programming before. In fact, if you know programming already you can skip most of the lectures and just go to the lab section each week.
reviews.comment_teaching: Although I already learn programming before, I think professor Muppala teaches the concept clearly. He will use pen and paper to write out each step to illustrate how the program works. He is also willing to answer your question in class. TA in the lab also seems quite helpful and also willing to answer you question.
reviews.comment_grading: The whole course is not really that difficult especially if you have learn programming before. Therefore the mean always lies at 75-85% so it is not easy to get a good letter grade.
reviews.comment_workload: There are labs every week but you can do it before hand and leave immediately after showing the TA your work. You are required to make an animal chess using greenfoot. It is not really difficult since the instruction on the notes are quite clear.

reviews.author: vincentytw
reviews.comment_content: Starting from Greenfoot to Eclipse,the course started from some basic concept in java so it is not difficult  for beginners.However, after mid term the concepts would become difficult , so don't miss the lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching: The power point slides are easy to follow even if you are self study and the professor taught quite well
reviews.comment_grading: Th mean is high around  80 and SD is 15~18 , some careless mistake would lead to bad grade,so mean is b -in this semester since too much people getting 90above
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. There are two assignments and 10 labs to do.The assignment is鬥獸棋 ,some instructions are given in part 1 so this assignment is not difficult provided that you know the concepts.

reviews.author: HKG_SIGMA
reviews.title: Interesting introductory course of Java
reviews.comment_content: An introductory course with a main focus on Java programming. At the beginning a graphic-based software, Greenfoot, is used to introduce Java in a rather relaxing way, since it is less tedious than traditional Java programming software. It provides a decent platform for programming newbies to try out. After Midterm the focus is shifted to Eclipse, a more professional Java software. The course generally covers most of fundamental elements in Java language, like language grammar, Class, Variable, Method, Looping, If-statement, File I/O, Recursion, etc. You definitely don't need to be afraid of taking this seemingly tough course, since all these stuff are easy to get familiar with.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good professor who has a strong passion in teaching programming. Sometimes he makes jokes in lesson. Occasional in-class mini projects are to be expected (e.g. Make a piano in Greenfoot). If you sit at the front of the lecture theatre he may invite you to answer his questions. A friendly atmosphere throughout the lessons. Lab sessions are also compulsory which in fact help you understand concepts introduced in the lectures. Each lab consists of several tasks and TAs will check your work and grade it (actually if you can finish those tasks then full grades will be given right away. They rarely ask you questions).
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade as usual. Since most students haven't studied ICT or computer-related subjects in secondary school, it is never a hard job to get a good grade if you are hard-working enough. For those who have studied ICT (no matter which elective, Database for myself), you will find it very easy to overwhelm others. In my opinion, ICT is much harder and broader than COMP1022P.
reviews.comment_workload: One Midterm and one Final. Very light workload. A lab task for every week. You may want to finish it before the lab session. Only one assignment (it is more like a mini project) is required to finish throughout the semester, which is a Board Game "Jungle" (鬥獸棋) and you need to use Greenfoot to write the game. Skeleton is given so no pressure on finishing the project. Even you are unable to finish some of the required features, you can always complete bonus tasks to get full mark.

reviews.author: whatwhat
reviews.title: For people wishing to get basic programming
reviews.comment_content: Will start with greenfoot and then later move on to eclipse. Pseudo code will be used in the beginning and will move into "real" programming  which is still very basic
reviews.comment_teaching: understandable but could be better and more immersive
reviews.comment_grading:
mean will be high..make no mistakes.
It's easy to make careless mistakes and since it's an easy course everyone will do good so avoid mistakes at all cost
reviews.comment_workload: if you do the labs before going to the labs you'll not only get to leave early but will have a good head start.

reviews.author: SVM
reviews.title: Good Course
reviews.comment_content: When we were taught this course, it was done using a software named Greenfoot. That software was a bitch, because rather than helping a beginner learn, it tended to confuse the user more. In fact, I had already studied java to an extent beforehand, still I often struggled with Greenfoot. Thankfully, Greenfoot was not included in the midterm or final. In fact, I've heard that Greenfoot has been completely removed from the course. If so, that is a good thing and ought to make the course content really good.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof KIM was damn good. He tried to keep the course as interesting as possible, and he was always there for doubts and queries. I attended one lecture by Prof. Wilfred, and I have to say that I think Prof KIM was way better than him.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is neither good, nor bad. That's about it.
reviews.comment_workload: Assignments are the only workload, and they are given well in advance, so light workload.

reviews.author: SC
reviews.title: Easy for Good Maths/Logic Background
reviews.comment_content:
Designed quite well to teach the fundamental programming concepts, including variables, logical operation, simple loops.

It also has a project to make 鬥獸棋, which was quite fun. (if you know how to do it) The project is also designed to let students to revise the concepts taught.
reviews.comment_teaching: While the professor taught quite well, it is better if you could self-study even after the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: As normally many people have ICT/programming background would also study this subject, the grading might be bad if you could not handle the concepts well.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite easy for students with ICT background. But if your understanding of the concepts are not good, the assignment/project would be quite tough.

reviews.author: Ryan Lin
reviews.title: COMP1022P
reviews.comment_content: Basic java knowledge. Not very helpful for business students. Though i think the course is interesting and you can write codes and produce some games by yourself
reviews.comment_teaching: You have to get used to his Korean accent and his hand-writing. But overall his teaching is good.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good and it's relatively easy to get A range. If you work hard enough it won't be a problem.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. You just have to attend the labs and there will be two homework for you to complete, but it's not very difficult.

reviews.author: CC
reviews.title: Learning programming in a fun way
reviews.comment_content:
Covers basic concepts of Java programming. The topics are taught and explained explicitly; the course is suitable for beginners. Type of variables, class, method, array, recursion etc. are included in the content. The difficulty escalates after the mid-term exam so be prepare to spend a bit more time on the second half of the course.
Most of the course uses Greenfoot to help you learn how to do coding. The later part uses Eclipse, which is slightly more complicated.
reviews.comment_teaching:
For some reasons I have attended some lectures from each of the three instructors. I shall do a brief summary of their teaching style.
Prof. NG: He uses ppt that combines his own input and the original slides. He explains things clearly and patiently. He has a sense of humor and is always well-prepared for lectures.
Prof. KIM: He includes quite a lot of extra things in his lecture (e.g. Hashmap) which are not required for exams. Even students with programming experience can learn something new. His lectures usually move at a fast pace. He is also witty and seems to enjoy interacting with students.
Prof: MUPPALA: He uses the original ppt slides and goes through them quite slowly, which is very ideal for any beginner. I observe that students tend to ask questions more eagerly in his lectures because he is very patient.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab sessions
There are tasks in each lab session: attending the lab is one of them. Labs before midterm are easy. They get harder after midterm, especially when Eclipse is used. I personally would do pre-lab on my own before the lab sessions. The TAs would help you if you can't complete the tasks but sometimes they can't help all the students given the time limit so you best be prepared.

Midterm
It was quite easy. Many students got over 90%. The format was a few multiple choice questions followed by coding.

Final exam
Open-notes. The first part was multiple choice and the second part was coding. The key to get a high score is always a clear concept. Again, many students got over 90%.

Overall, the course gives good grades! And it is enjoyable as well!
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment
My assignment was to make the Jungle board game 鬥獸棋 on Greenfoot. It was divided into two parts, which had different deadlines.
I found the "save" function (I/O) the hardest. There were bonus points for you to gain by setting extra functions, such as sound effect. Even if you fail to program some of the basic requirements, you can still get full mark with the bonus points. The TAs would be quite busy towards the end of the semester so doing the assignment and ask for help earlier might be a good idea.

reviews.author: sweet_cookie
reviews.title: Simple Programming for Learners
reviews.comment_content: The course consist basic knowledge on programming and is suitable for learners to get to know more on programming. Yet, it is too simple for experienced students.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Kim has a good sense of humor and can make the class pay more attention. He used simple examples to help students to understand the topics.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is adequate. It is not too easy to get grade A, but it is easy for students to pass and get a grade B simply because its content is too easy.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is extremely light. The course only required you to finish simple programs during labs and a game program as assignment, making use with all the knowledge that is learned from the labs.

reviews.author: Fishball
reviews.title: 無返咁上下底都係讀1022Q好D
reviews.comment_content:
其實教既野幾得意,
用一個入門軟件去教JAVA,
一開始一定係照打Code,
但係到自己諗到Run到果陣都有有返咁上下成功感
reviews.comment_teaching:
無底無玩開掂過既人一定要上,
佢講解起碼都會解釋到你好多問題,
但係如果要明哂就一定要自己試同埋自己走去問佢,
當然你有FD問就最好啦.
reviews.comment_grading:
其實呢科grade唔差,
Mean左右就B range,
但係因為大部份人都係有返咁上下既,
本身唔識既人想有Mean就要努力小小啦,
不過都唔會太難,
明白Lab做咩都OK嫁啦.
reviews.comment_workload:
正常一個Course既workload咁,
有Lab,有一個Project仔,
不過因為個Project其實幾好玩,
所以都無所謂啦

reviews.author: Codemetry
reviews.title: An on9 course for Java experts to get good grades but the content and exams are so poorly delivered
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus (Easy:🔷, hard:🔶)

🔷 Part 1:
🔷 Module 01: Course Overview
🔷 Module 02: Programming Fundamentals
🔷 Module 03: Object-oriented Programming
🔷 Module 04: Scope Rules, Boolean Expressions, and Branching Statements
🔷 Module 05: Loops, Shortcut Operators, Arrays

🟥 Midterm exam 🟥

🔷 Part 2:
🔷 Module 06: Introduction to OOP, Subclass, Multidimensional Array, Simple Sorting
🔷 Module 07: Character String, File I/O
🔷 Module 08: Simple Event-Driven Programming and GUI
🔶 Module 09: Recursion
🔷 Module 10: Abstract data type (ADT), Eclipse

🟥 Final exam 🟥

This is a typical list of topics for introduction to programming and is similar in most other programming languages. The syntax of Java tends to be strict (at least stricter than Python), but with endurance, you can get used to it soon.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching is terrible. This is an online course, and videos are delivered instead of lectures. But the man speaking is some ex-professor (not David Rossiter), with a heavy Cantonese tone of English. Plus, he seems to be just reading aloud a script, very boring.

I learned Java 6 years ago so I didn't watch most of the videos. I watched tutorials from https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFE2CE09D83EE3E28 and I recommend this playlist a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is similar to COMP 1022P courses by other instructors in the past. Around 95% total mark can get you an A, so it's quite bad but should be fine for people who learned programming prior.

However, the mid-term exam and final exam are poorly designed.

Here is a summary of the exams' style. They are delivered online as Canvas quizzes. PDF notes, Google Calculator, BlueJ, and the course website (HKMOOC) are allowed references.

There are 10 questions in the mid-term exam and 18 questions in the final exam. Some are MCs, some require you to process the code manually and determine the output, and others require you to fill in the blanks to complete a program. Codes that aren't intended to be copied into BlueJ will be displayed as an image.

The instructor (or TA) really wants to utilize Canvas' auto-grading system, so he adds a lot of warnings asking us not to add ";", full-stops ".", unnecessary spaces " ", etc. in bold, italics, and with capitalized words. The utterly long warnings take up to half part of a question.

There is 1 error in the mid-term exam and 2 errors in the final exam, causing us to waste all our time on those questions. Combined with the warnings distracting us from reading the core part of the question, all of us become careless in at least one question. Therefore, the maximum in the final exam is 96/100, as opposed to 100/100 in mid-term exam (and 103/100 in MATH 1023 mid-term exam).

Moreover, quite a few questions don't really test our programming abilities with Java. One asks us to process a code but everything is compressed (like two methods in one line, brackets, if statements, for loops, return statements, all put in a single line, which is allowed in Java but not in Python). Honestly, it only acts as an eye test but nothing else.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite light. The deadline for everything in part 1 is before the mid-term exam and in part 2 is before the final exam. It took me 4 days in total to finish all the assignments.

1. MCs: You get around 3-5 MCs per module to test your understanding of the topic.

2. Labs: You have a lab per module, and inside a lab, you have 3-4 related tasks constituting the entire program of the lab. Each task, you write around 10-20 lines of code for each task, but the task is very easy to understand and the code logic is very simple.

3. Discussions: You need to figure out the answer to the given question and post the answer in the discussion forum. There are only a few discussion tasks, and honestly, you can just copy the answer from the forum.

4. Project: It is just a longer lab with around 5 tasks, plus some code can be copied from previous labs.

reviews.author: AProBro
reviews.title: Pretty Decent
reviews.comment_content:
just basic computer science knowledge, in java programming language. teaching objects, classes, variables, scopes, loops, arrays, nested loops, string, recursion.

Used eclipse IDE and greenfoot.
reviews.comment_teaching:
bit slow but not hard.
One lecture slide a week + tutorial. tutorial can finish all in the class. TA is helpful and tutorial is quick fun honestly.
reviews.comment_grading: i got a, everything above mean, but i took java class before.
reviews.comment_workload: Just one tutorial per week not too hard, most Project can finish within a week, lecture slide maybe review for tests/exams its not bad

reviews.author: a1668k
reviews.title: Not recommend to people without programming knowledge to have this class
reviews.comment_content:
Just some basics of programming with Java. The things you will learn in this course are nearly the same as HKDSE ICT Elective D and even less than that, so if you have learned ICT before, the content in the course may be familiar to you. For nearly 2/3 of the course, you will learn Java basic with Greenfoot, and change to use Eclipse in around the last few topics. Recursion will be the hardest thing in this course but is still ok if you have had the lesson.

Topic 1 - Introduction to Computer: Hardware and Software
Topic 2 - Elementary Programming
Topic 3 - Object and classes
Topic 4 - Variables and Scope rules
Topic 5 - Expressions and branching statements
*Mid-term Review*
Topic 6 - Loops
Topic 7 - Arrays and Nested Loops
Topic 8 - Console I/O
Topic 9 - String manipulation and File I/O
Topic 10 - Recursion
*Final Review*
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred is good really good teacher. He was willing to answer most of the question you ask for it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%) (with 9 lab in total for 20-21 fall, 1/week)
Written assignments (5%)
Programming assignments (20%) (write a Mastermind game)
Midterm examination (25%) ~ With Mean of 63.6
Final exam (40%)

Those Labs can be easily getting full marks if you have put some time to finish those coding before you the lesson. With the Mid-term and Final exam, since we have online mode this year, those exams will be divided into two parts, MC and Long Question. You can finish the exam within the time limit if you have a really good programming foundation and study those past papers before you have the exam.

Since this course is harder than COMP1021, most of the people with good programming knowledge will choose this course but not the 1021. Therefore, you will see lots of programming experts in this course. If you do not have confidence in programming or you are bad at using the computer, I will not recommend you to take this course. Just take COMP1021 instead of this course.
reviews.comment_workload: If you have some basic programming knowledge before you take this course, those labs and assignments may not be too hard for you to finish. But if you haven't learned programming before, those labs and assignments may be a little bit hard for you to do. With 9 labs (1 lab pre week), 1 written assignment, and 1 programming assignment, the workload is quite light comparing to other courses (like LANG1002).

reviews.author: hoifanrd
reviews.comment_content:
A basic introduction to Java, with the most complex content covered being recursion. Overall, not very complex if you have prior programming knowledge but is still accessible if you do not. Just need to make sure to review classes and lecture notes before exams.

1~Introduction to Computers: Hardware and Software
2~Elementary programming
3~Objects and classes
4~Variables and Scope rules
5~Expressions and branching statements
6~Loops
7~Arrays and Nested Loops
8~Console I/O
9~String manipulation and File I/O
10~Recursion
reviews.comment_teaching: Muppala is a good teacher. He is a very humorous teacher and willing to chat with us freely. When we have questions about programming, he will demonstrate the result by the compiler immediately and solves our questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratories (10%)
Written assignments (5%)
Programming assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (25%)
Final exam (40%)
reviews.comment_workload: No heavy if you have prior programming experiences.

reviews.author: ZOU, Huaiyang
reviews.comment_content:
Just the basic knowledge of programming(variables, data type, arrays, branches, loops,recursion and so on).

It is taught in Java, but it actually doesn't matter that what language is used.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is moderate. The professor is trying to make a good atmosphere.
reviews.comment_grading: Majority student can get a very high grade. So it is not a course that needs you to understand the material, it is a course that requires you to do the perfect. I also don't think it is a good idea to take this course's grade to as the pre-condition for 2012H.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is moderate for real beginners.
Tasks are basic application of the basic content. If you know how to solve common programming problems on the internet(which I think is necessary for programming learners), this course will not be hard and will not spend you too much time

reviews.author: Thomas Kang
reviews.title: Every knows about Java except you
reviews.comment_content: I forgot but some of them are quite easy even you are a beginner of programming. But when it comes to the second part of the course, you need to pay more time into it to catch up the course
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually quite comprehensive and the instructor can let you understand all the things. (if you really pay attention in class)
reviews.comment_grading:
Like what i have said, you need to pay much time  when the content getting harder and more complex. If you don't, the final will definitely kill you.

But hw and lab and midterm can save your life.

Above mean slightly i remembered and get b+.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too high i think? (in my opinion, project and online discussion = high workload.)

reviews.author: lyzzzz
reviews.title: A middle course
reviews.comment_content:
#1 hardware - software
#2 elementary programming
#3 objects and class
#4 variables scopes
#5 expression branching
#6 loops
#7 array, nested loops
#8 eclipse
#9 eclipse string file IO
#10 recursion
#11 altogether
Supplementary— ADT

First we use Greenfoot — the kid’s software to implement Java
Then use eclipse
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mediocre. Prof is nice and willing to answer your question but it is hard to understand his accent (for me).

PPT is well organized.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since a large amount of students’ grade is close, the grading is very cruel. A and A- may only have a difference of 0.5 points.

At last get 97.05/100 and get an A. I heard that 96 is A-. So cruel.

Please be CAUTIOUS if you want to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload since the content is relatively easy. Though there are 3 assignments, it is easy to finish and get full mark.

1 written assignment and 2 programming assignments.

reviews.author: twlw
reviews.comment_content: This course is the first computer course you can have in HKUST. It will teach you basic java. No prior experience in programming is needed.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor read ppt, you do the lab and homework.
BTW, if you have programming experience, I suggest you don't go to lecture because it is boring.
reviews.comment_grading: Many people take this course as it is a requirement. Some of them are novice, but many of them are not. Average score of this course is very high, so you must not lost any point on lab and assignment, otherwise you will not get an A
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light. You just need to read ppt, take the lab every week and do little bit homework.

reviews.author: rind
reviews.title: Do not take this course
reviews.comment_content:
Starting in the first week, the content will be covering some basic programming knowledge such as variable, data types.
I think one of the problem of this course is that it uses Greenfoot to teach which is quite weird since it is not a common IDE used for JAVA and more importantly, those you learn from Greenfoot are actually not much related to the Eclipse software you will use later.
The concepts are quite easy if you have any programming background. I have studied ICT and I think it is quite easy to handle all concepts. I think recursion will be the most difficult part of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wilfred is quite funny and kind in class but I think he teaches too fast and not explaining every concept clearly. I can catch up all the things since I have programming background. It is extremely hard for someone who does not have any background to learn during lectures. You have to learn more after the class. Something very interesting is that he revealed the final exam questions accidentally. I give him a C.
My TA Wallace is extremely helpful. He explains everything clearly in lab sessions and his English is so good! He will answer your email very quickly if you have any question. I give him an A.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very poor grading.
I accidentally select COMP1022P and I couldn't swap it with COMP1021.
If you read through the reviews in past years, the curve is extremely high.
As always, the mean of both midterm and exam is very high. Due to the social issue, it changes to online exam and in other words: an open-book exam. The mean is higher than the exams in past year thus affect the cut-off which means a slight change will make your grade different
The question ask in the exam is quite funny because no one will write a programme like that. It checks your concepts. If you are a CARELESS person, drop this course.
Sometimes the exam ask something never taught in lectures. Remember to study past papers.
I get 96.85 overall and get an A-. Quite frustrated.
reviews.comment_workload:
It depends on your background.
If you have no programming background: please drop this course. It is hard to learn from lectures and you need a lot of practice.
If you have programming background, maybe javascript or python: I personally learn this two language before which is not a Object-oriented program (maybe it is but I haven't learn that deep), some thing new like Classes and Constructors, Objects are actually quite confusing at first. You have to spend some time learning it. Therefore I never miss the lectures though rarely do I learn something from it. Things start getting easy once you make these concepts clear.
If you learn C++, Java before: Congratulations, don't go to lectures.

1 written assignment
2 programming assignment
1 midterm
1 final
light, assignments can be finished in 2 hours.

reviews.author: Wang Yuxi
reviews.title: COMP1022P
reviews.comment_content: While you need to review the lesson after class and do some exercise to familiarize with those concepts. Java is a little bit difficult for students without previous computing knowledge since some of the logic is difficult to understand initially. While you may find it easier after you grasp the basic ones.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches really well since he uses simple terms to introduce the complicated concepts. While he may needs to teach more related exercise or how to implement those concepts.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is satisfactory for me. I think if you want to get a good grade, you really need to master related concepts pretty well and do some past papers before the exam. Also the two assignments needs to get full mark since students in this class are all very excellent.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. The assignments are easy and doesn't take much time to complete.

reviews.author: overloadtension
reviews.title: Be careful. If you are only interested in Java but not the grade, self-learning would be a much better option
reviews.comment_content:
Maybe difficult for beginners but easy if you have studied ICT
Just basic knowledge and algorithms, like data types and variables, objects and classes, string manipulation, loops and recursion
I guess you would learn almost nothing if you learned Java in ICT.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good. Clear explains every idea(even it is basic) with demonstration by simple programs. You can ask questions freely if you want. My TA in labs is also caring. However, he does not allow you to demonstrate your program(then leave the lab)  before he finishes teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading scheme:
written assignment: 5%
programming assignment: 20%
lab sessions: 10%
midterm: 25%
final: 40%

The mean of this term is very high due to the stupid nature of the final exam, it is an online quiz, most questions are like
Question: What is the output of the following code?
**code**
Everybody would copy it to an online compiler right?

I forgot to submit some homework so my grade drops from A+(estimation by my friends' results) to B+

So be careful in homework and exams if you aim for a safe A for this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light.
The written assignment is one-off, and the programming assignment has only 2 parts. Even if you are a deadline fighter like me, you only need to work hard 3 times.
Some people may recommend preparing for labs(?), but it is not that necessary.
For both labs and programming assignment, you can just simply follow the instructions and then get full score...

reviews.author: kiritoislegit01
reviews.title: Boring if already know programming
reviews.comment_content: More theories than actual coding, so far we learnt how our programs are stored, sizes of different data types and how programs perform our code.
reviews.comment_teaching: Only went for first lecture, it was alright. He explains the slides clearly.
reviews.comment_grading: Still taking so im not sure, its probably quite hard to get high grade as there are alot of experts in the course.
reviews.comment_workload: Basicaly no workload since i already learnt most of the concepts already. The labs can be done within a few mins as long as you understand the contents on the notes.

reviews.author: TerryWu
reviews.title: Best instructor and grading scheme!
reviews.comment_content:
The content guides you from the origin of Java to some advanced syntax and the essence of Java (which is in fact OOP).

Desmond always says that after taking COMP1022P, you can catch up with the upcoming COMP2011 so well since Java and c++ are similar. So for those science and engineering students, this is definitely the best COMP course for you to take at your first year.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond is a good guy!

He uses Cantonese, Mandarin and English to clarify the concepts which he thinks to be easily confused.
He also uses good analogy to describe some concepts (ex. big box for class, small box for variables) so that it will not be too difficult to understand those ideas.

Though there might be some additional courses, but Desmond managed the pace and progress of the course well so there is no worry about too much stuff to learn for only a week.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% for coursework:
    10% for lab (total 10 labs)
    20% for two coding assignments

70% for examination:
There are two grading scheme which the system will automatically choose the better one.
    1. 30% midterm + 40% final
    2. 70 % final (for those who got bad grade for midterm)

It is so good that there is still one more chance for those who did bad at midterm to achieve good grade.

My midterm is slightly above mean but my final is +1SD, and finally I got A- for this course.
You will not lose hope even if you did bad at final.
reviews.comment_workload:
For programming assignment, it is a bit difficult for a newcomer of Java to tackle them. It is better to find a friend who is more familiar with Java to help you with the assignment so as to finish them earlier.

For MT and final, the questions have almost nothing to do with the lecture note (the examinations are both open-note). Only few questions are about some memorizing knowledge that you can find on your lecture note and others are all tricky questions. Usually those tricky stuff came from the questions asked by students after class, and those students are usually more advanced with respect to learning programming language.

Conclusion: Try to listen to and understand the questions students asked during class or after class + Find a good Java partner to tackle the assignments = For a Java newcomer to get good grades :)

reviews.author: Kyoko
reviews.title: 兴趣是最好的老师
reviews.comment_content: 教的都是java的基础，从计算机语言介绍开始，认真学的话，到最后能学到很多东西
reviews.comment_teaching: 教的很详细，老师很和善，会耐心回答我们的问题。lab提前准备好的话会很容易做好的。有兴趣的话可以自己平时找点自学资料或者视频学习。
reviews.comment_grading: 如果你付出了，grade应该是很理想的。虽然我最后只有B+😂 我是0基础小白，我也承认我没有认真学习😂 考试的题目都不是很难，认真学的话就能考过。很多人认真学了拿了A甚至A+，龟还是很好的
reviews.comment_workload: 有两个assignment，虽然工作量有点大，但是做起来很有意思，也很有用。做完了也不会觉得累，反而会有满足的感觉😂 平时的workload还是比较好的。

reviews.author: wenziqi
reviews.comment_content: java入门，很简单和接地气，从greenfoot引到正式变成
reviews.comment_teaching: wilfred喜欢在ppt里插入各种猫的图片以便大家云吸猫，讲课水平还好吧，不好也不差
reviews.comment_grading: 很简单就是比细心，分数差一点很能grade就不同了，细心就好
reviews.comment_workload: 除了有个project没啥其他的事情要做了

reviews.author: Danielllc
reviews.comment_content: The course is well-organised, from basic hardware to abstract data type, the knowledge taught is very useful and enjoyable.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pedro 's teaching is very well, and he is very patient. It will be easy to understand the important concepts if you attend his course.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is much better than before, it seems COMP1022P is trying to change its notorious grading.
The course before the exam will be used to review, past papers will also be given online.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light, there are many tips for the project, so it's easy to finish it.

reviews.author: ParcoChan
reviews.title: Useful course but NOT an easy course
reviews.comment_content:
In a nutshell, very useful course but NOT an easy course for programming beginners.
U will learn all necessary concepts in programming. Skills learnt in Java is useful in another language, say C++. I enrolled to COMP2011 in year 2 and i found the skills from java is helpful.
Not necessary to choose this course if u r not that kinda like learning programming.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond Tsoi's teaching is overwhelming. I sit his class. He is funny. He always gives a great illustration for explaining concepts.
I have talked to Desmond after the semester issues. He is really nice to students.
I enrolled into Wilfred class originally. Boring explanation on the statements on examples. No concepts. But he is a good guy. He gives me marks for expired assignment even I cannot give my doctor certificate.
Lab TAs will be helpful if u cannot get the ideas.
reviews.comment_grading:
My grade:
100% lab 95.5% assignment
92% mid-term 88.5% final
all above mean
93.6% in total and only B+ (??)

Additional information, always enrol in spring semester and try to attend Desmond's class. Better grading than fall.
reviews.comment_workload:
Lectures, not necessary, you can always find all information u need on google, but i recommend u to show up on class.
Weekly labs, it's time-consuming if u cannot get the ideas on class
Written assignment x1, easy if u know what is now teaching.
Programming assignment x2, same, very time-consuming if u cannot get the ideas
Mid-term and final, not much to revise if u really understand the concepts.
So, it is not a big deal if u do not skip class.
I skipped a lot before mid-term and it almost, almost crashes me!!
But if u do revise the materials on the class, not copying from the source to finish the lab on every week. It halves the workload.

reviews.author: dani23
reviews.title: Great Course for SBM Students [Easy Grade]
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite simple and fit for a beginner. I am a first year SBM student with no prior knowledge of programming. I thought it was going to be a tough course because I read the comment on UST Space. The content was just basic programming like the syntax and basic addition, subtraction, etc.

For the final exam, I only read the powerpoint for a while and just went to take the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite good. I understand what he said in class because he has good English skills. I think he got his phd from UCL.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair, considering how good everyone is. I got a 95.7% overall score in the course and got an A-.

The mean is fair, with the mid-term being 80/100 and the final being around 70/100. The SD for this course is about 20 points.

Also, for the final exam, at first I got 89 out of 100, so I went to check my answers with the TA. One answer on the test was not the same with the correct answer, but it was correct. I explained to the TA, and he corrected it to a 94/100.

[Both exams are open-note!]
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite low, there is only 2 big assignment, which was quite easy to do. THere is also few labs, which you can all finish in like 20 minutes.

reviews.author: NGTing
reviews.title: COMP1022P
reviews.comment_content:
If you are a computer science student, this is a easy course for you.
If you are a engineering student, this course maybe a bit challenging to you.
If you are a business student, decide to choose another course before add-drop period.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lab tutor did not give us full answer despite lab session is over. Then he will give you a 0 mark for the lab.
You may try this course if you are an EXPERT.
reviews.comment_grading:
mid-term mean around 85/100
written assignment mean around 94/100
Final mean around 70/100
You can take this course if you like programming.
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely workload when compared to COMP1022Q
Written Assignment x 1
Programming Assignment x 2
Lab x 8
Mid-term exam
Final

reviews.author: lscheung
reviews.comment_content:
1. 都是很入門的java知識，對於新手而言還算是友好？
2. 考試主要考細節，粗心就完了，因為一題一個grad，無論midterm還是final
3. 考試的東西其實ppt裡都有，但是，全都是出現的很簡單的例子，而且不會特別仔細講，如果不自己去找資料的基本上就完了
4. 考前會發過往試卷，很有用
reviews.comment_teaching:
1. 老師已經很努力地把課堂變的有趣點，我之前毫無任何電腦課的經驗，但上這節課至少不會很悶
2. 但是這節課並不能只依賴上課，只依賴上課到了第一次assignment和midterm，就會感受到來自老師的深深的惡意
3. 上lab，ta和helper都會教你，所以不會可以問
4. 可以在特定的時間問ta
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Grading對於像我這樣的此前沒接觸過電腦課或者相關資料的人來說只能用淒慘形容，十分慘烈
2. 課程的評分包括1次midterm，1份寫的作業，1份設計一個mastermind遊戲的作業，9次lab（分數佔比很小），1個final
3. 大部分人作業和lab都是滿分，跟我一樣不是就很慘
reviews.comment_workload:
1. 負擔主要來自於需要自學，但主要靠google其實就能解答很多問題了，基本上平時只要不懂會查，考試突擊可以保住B範圍
2. 可能兩份作業會比較花時間，第二份作業大概零零碎碎寫了5，6天，但是其實作業內容和考試緊貼，所以寫作業算是很好的複習

reviews.author: Anisha
reviews.comment_content: Personally, I had no problems understanding the concepts of java and writing simple programs in class. However, I felt that the lecture content was highly deceiving when I sat for the exams. The TAs make very tricky question papers which are extremely difficult if you do not have previous java experience. Whatever taught in class is completely useless and honestly, you can sit in your own dorm room and teach yourself. Even then, you will probably end up with a C or below if you are not an experienced programmer.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is not very good in the sense that the professor teaches nothing that is relevant to doing well in the exams. He will explain concepts to you well but the real essence of programming lies in practice and actually writing programs which is not done in class at all. I found the TAs to be extremely unhelpful especially an Indian one who I believe relishes in seeing students miserable with their assignments and labs. So if he is the one grading them for you, I wish you good luck :)
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair because the experienced programmers will score extremely high marks and the inexperienced ones will score extremely low. There is no way it can go otherwise
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is low all throughout the semester except for exam time and during assignments.

reviews.author: eaglechan
reviews.title: java course
reviews.comment_content:
java using greenfoot
easy stuffs regarding content
very hard midterm and final
reviews.comment_teaching:
indian professor is funny
u can just seat playing hearthstone
or listen to him
reviews.comment_grading:
damn hard
i got 71 in midterm
that mean is 80somethings and sd is 15
i revised all pastpaper but still do not know how to write programme
what the hell is going on with this course
reviews.comment_workload:
easy assingment
you can just copy assingment from past paper,
they are some how similar

lab is ok
i have never prepare it but sometimes still can leave early

reviews.author: qwertyyuiop
reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM MUPPALA !
reviews.comment_content: The teaching content is just adequate but not much enough. Compared to another class, MUPPALA didn't give detailed explanation or demonstration of complicated knowledge. Overall the lecture notes have the basic programming definations, but if you want to get a good understanding of Java and get good grades, it is strongly recommanded to learn more from textbook, google or other MOOC courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor comes from India and has a Indian accent. It will be a little problem listening to his teaching, but overall it is acceptable. It was easy to be abcent-minded because the teaching lacks passion and the jokes told in class is indian-style and not easy to get the laughing point.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was very terrifying. Overall 92 will only result in a B+ grade and 95 will only get a A-. So if you are not hardworking enough, your grade will kill you. Actually, if you work quite hard, you may also get a terrible grade. If you worry about that, drop it and take COMP1021 instead.
reviews.comment_workload: The overall workload is just adequate but it needs more off-class studying. It's not difficult to finish labs and assignments but it's not enough for exams.

reviews.author: lawhosing
reviews.comment_content: so difficult. Many contents, and all are relevant to each other, if you loss one, it means you loss all of them.
reviews.comment_teaching: so boring and expect everyone have CS background, not too bad, but obviously not good.
reviews.comment_grading: BAD for non-cs major/ no any CS background (Programming)
reviews.comment_workload: Big workload as you have to continuously non stop studying and asking and typing code, understand the language, if you are a good language learner, that might be fine for you. But I think for no CS background, please don't try it.

reviews.author: klkl
reviews.title: GOOD INSTRUCTOR !!!
reviews.comment_content:
Just basic programming fundamentals

Java :
Operations
Checking & Selection
Looping
Arrays
Classes & Objects
Inheritance
Static / Variables / Methods
Recursion
Strings
File I/O

The content is quite simple and interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is the nicest instructor I have ever seen in ust. He is fun and often tell some jokes in class. And he explains every details clearly and also with three languages ( English, Cantonese and Mandarin). He will make sure all students understand contents well and able to finish the assignment.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab Exercise (10%)
Assignment (20%)
Midterm (30%)
Final (40%)

Good grade indeed( for this instructor). Desmond gave 30% A range. Work a little bit harder to understand the content and
do some programming practices. Then that's not really hard to get a good score. It's just an introductory course!  But also because of the easy contents, the mean is usually quite high.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 hours Lecture and 2 hours Lab every week

There are some lab exercises every week.To save your time, you can do the exercise before and let the TA check directly. Or you can do it on the lab and ask the TA for help if you simply don't know how to do.

--------------------------------------------

2 Assignments

Image processing application

Just follow the instruction and fill code in the blank. Not very hard but need some time to think.

A*Path finding algorithm

It's really a nightmare ! It require you to write a path finding code on greenfoot. But some data structure like queue or list is uncovered. You have to read the api on the internet and use them. Also, the algorithm is quite complicated and you have to pay a lot of hard work on it. Thankfully, Desmond recognized the problem and gave us many tips and extended the deadline. We are supposed able to do it finally. But I don't think this assignment will not be assigned again in the future (at least not in this introductory course).

reviews.author: jwy
reviews.title: COMP1022P Introduction to Computing with Java
reviews.comment_content: Not recommended for those who didn't learn Java before. Quite tough for beginners.
reviews.comment_teaching: Funny, passionate, great professor. Always prepared and is enthusiastic about helping students. If you can do all the lab works on your own, you can do well on exams as well.
reviews.comment_grading: If you work hard, you'll get the grades that you want.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload really depends on your level of programming ability. If it's the first time learning Java or any sort of programming lanaguage, the same assignment/lab might take you some time but if you have some programming background, it doesn't take so much time.

reviews.author: Senpai
reviews.title: do not take this course if you have no programming background
reviews.comment_content:
use Greenfoot to learn java,beginner will find it difficult to catch up the content. however, it would be easy if you have learn programming before. contents become much more difficult after the midterm.
friendly reminder: most of the student taking this course are actually programming expert.
reviews.comment_teaching: actually the professor teach it quite well and always answer student's question very soon. beginner students may find the lecture quite fast and can not completely understand the concept before getting into new concept.
reviews.comment_grading:
the mean is very high in midterm and final exam as most of the students expert in java programming.
getting c or above need a very high overall course mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is quite large as you need to understand all of the concept before doing the lab and assignment and exams.
2 assignments and various labs.
1 midterm and final exam

reviews.author: 陳文揚
reviews.title: Okay course, BRILLIANT INSTRUCTOR
reviews.comment_content: The content is similar to previous years, but for this term Desmond decided to teach condition statements, looping statements, arrays, etc before going into classes and objects and so on, and also used Eclipse first before introducing Greenfoot. For me (someone with no programming background), I think this arrangement is fine since Desmond teaches really well, and Greenfoot is an absolute rubbish software.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond deserves more than an A for teaching, he is simply the best instructor you can meet (at least in your first year). His passion and teaching style will make the most disinterested student like his class instantly. His lecture notes are complete and sufficient for revision, although it is still highly recommended to go to lectures. Besides that, there are also lecture videos and extra teaching materials posted online which allows students to catch up and revise before the exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% lab, 20% assignments, 30% midterm, 40% final
The exams are not too hard as they cover most of the course materials, but to be safe it is encouraged to bring your lecture notes into the exams.
Compared to the other terms, the grading given by Desmond is really good. He gave around 30% A range.
reviews.comment_workload: No regular homework, but there are lab sessions (10 of them in total, which are very easy and straightforward too), and two programming assignments which isn't too heavy but requires a lot of patience and research to complete. The first one was about image processing and wasn't too difficult to do since the pseudocode provides sufficient hints to solve the assignment. The second one is an absolute killer (about a computer algorithm called A* algorithm, don't think many people managed to solve it) which you will need lots of help from the TAs and the internet.

reviews.author: Denise Tse
reviews.title: Better take it with friends
