reviews.comment_content: Contents are basic elements of java programming. Quantity is suitable. Not too much even for students without programming background.
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond's teaching style is lively and easy to understand. But teaching speed is a little bit slow, so there may be extra lectures. Lecture videos are provided for every lecture, including extra lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grading. Not difficult to get a range even if you do not have programming background. If you got full mark in assignments and labs, even if you are below mean in midterm and final exam, you can still got a B!!!
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments and 1 lab every week. Workload is quite heavy but not difficult. Enough instructions for assignments and labs. Attendance for every lab counts 1 mark.

reviews.author: ShoW
reviews.title: DESMOND ♡
reviews.comment_content:
1 Problem Solving & Introduction to Computer Programming
2 Program Comments, Primitive Types, Variables and Literals,
Console I/O
3 Arithmetic, Assignment, Relational & Logical Operations.
Manual Type Casting
4 Branching Statements
5 Looping / Iterative Statements
6 Java Methods, Parameter Passing Mechanism,
Scope & Duration of Variables Method Overloading
7 Classes and Objects, Properties & Methods, Constructors
8 Fundamentals of Inheritance
9 Java Arrays
10 Recursions
11 Strings
12 Abstract Data Types
reviews.comment_teaching: Desmond is super nice, and he is a really passionate teacher. However, not many people answer the questions he ask in class, so I always tried to answer.
reviews.comment_grading:
Coursework (30%)
- Lab Exercises (10%)
- Programming Assignments (20%)

Examinations (70%)
- Mid-term Exam (30%)
- Final Exam (40%)

I felt obliged to write this because people always say COMP1022P is a lan grade course. I think it is actually quite good. I got only a few points deducted from PA2, and for Midterm and Final around 0.5SD above and 1SD above for each. The exam is open notes, and I regret I didn't print the notes for the Final Exam. Still got A.
reviews.comment_workload:
To be honest, the course material is pretty easy to follow if you pay attention in class, but the 2 assignments might require a lot of thinking time. I recommend you try not to get too much help from others for the two assignments as it is a good learning experience. In this year, they gave us a Greenfoot task that was hard for people, and they had to add extra code to the skeleton code to make it easier. I personally think Desmond should have held the advising session for the second assignment as he did with the first assignment (The TA in charge of explaining was not so good).

For the lab sessions (about 10 sessions) they are easy and just do the tasks before you go to the lab and you are good.

reviews.author: abcab_123
reviews.comment_content:
1. Basic data types, variables, assignment statements, console I/O
2. Arithmetic expressions, Boolean expressions
3. Branching and looping statements
4. Arrays
5. Classes and objects, properties and methods
6. Inheritance
7. Static variables and methods
8. Primitive types and reference types
9. Scope rules
10. String manipulations
11. File I/O Recursion
reviews.comment_teaching:
佢會特登講慢D make sure全部聽得明
基本上有上lecture唔會唔識
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Lab Exercises
20% Programming Assignments
30% Mid-term Exam
40% Final Exam

lab滿分 2份assignment 100/100 80/100
midterm 68.5/100 median 74
final 64.5/100 median 64.25
最後B+
reviews.comment_workload:
lab同assignment 1好快就做得完
assignment 2用greenfoot寫A* algorithm 要自己睇java library
如果最後冇updated skeleton code應該deadline前都交唔到

reviews.author: nightmare
reviews.comment_content:
Basic data types, variables, assignment statements, console I/O
Arithmetic expressions, Boolean expressions
Branching and looping statements
Arrays
Classes and objects, properties and methods
Inheritance

reviews.comment_teaching:
Fair
If you ask him questions, he would be pleased to answer you.
reviews.comment_grading:
Laboratory exercises 10%
Programming assignments 20%
Midterm examination 30%
Final examination 40%
Full mark in both lab and assignment
Below 1 sd in mt
Mean in final
Get a C
reviews.comment_workload:
Heavy if you never study java before
Fair for  a lab every week and 2 assignments

reviews.author: cheungkinyi00
reviews.comment_content:
comp2011 前必讀 1021 1022q 好多野無cover

Key Concepts Covered

Basic data types, variables, assignment statements, console I/O
Arithmetic expressions, Boolean expressions
Branching and looping statements
Arrays
Classes and objects, properties and methods
Inheritance
Static variables and methods
Primitive types and reference types
Scope rules
String manipulations
File I/O
Recursion
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond 名不虛傳係個完美主義者，真係會當你係初學者甘去教，完全唔覺得chur。而且份人好Nice， 同學生好多互動，上堂會講D 笑話黎調整個mood.

佢自己整 notes，好過cse department戈份好多, 好多program 例題，會寫晒所有步驟同思考方法。

Desmond 仲改左成個course ge 流程，個人認爲比以前容易。而且完全唔洗用個垃圾greenfoot， 改用目前比較流行 ge eclipse.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme

Item Percentage
Laboratory exercises 10%
Programming assignments 20%
Midterm examination 30%
Final examination 40%

2017 spring 好似有 30% a range.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 份assignment workload 比較大， 大概需要 1 個禮拜先做得完，而且無source。不過個assignment 1比較有意義， 係關於image processing application, 類似整幾個 instagram ge 濾鏡；

10 個 lab 比較輕鬆， 基本上送分， 1 分attendance 1分 demonstration，但每個禮拜 2 粒鐘lab有D多。

reviews.author: Mok Ka Sin
reviews.title: This course is really hard
reviews.comment_content:
You may feel very difficult if you haven't learnt java.
The assignments are very hard.
Many of the students who took this course are very familiar with java or program, and they were working very hard with this course, they always ask questions during the lessons and after school.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is really nice. If you ask him questions, he would be likely to ask you.
But some of the TAs are not really nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean is very high.

Final:
Average: 78.51
Standard Deviation: 17.79

I haven't handed in assignments, midterm below 0.7SD, final below 2.3SD and finally got a D.
reviews.comment_workload: Apportiate, there is a lab every week, and 2 assignments.

reviews.author: Victoria
reviews.title: DESMOND IS THE BEST
reviews.comment_content:
Basic programming logics with Java
Interesting if you want to learn programming
As someone without a programming background, I didn't have too much difficulty as the lectures are quite clear
But the best thing about this course is
DESMOND
reviews.comment_teaching:
Desmond is probably (one of) the best teacher out here. His teaching is slower than most lecturers so he usually gives extra lectures on a weekend but honestly you probably couldn't get a better teacher
ALL HAIL DESMOND
reviews.comment_grading:
OK, not so bad but not that great either.
Mean for midterm was really high (86% or sth)
Final exam was more difficult
And pretty much everyone got almost 100% in the labs/assignment
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is fine. There is one programming assignment divided into two parts, and a lab (with attendance) every week designed to teach you how to use Greenfoot to do the assignment.
Go to the labs or ask DESMOND if you do have any difficulty. He's more than willing to help.

reviews.author: Jet
reviews.title: Challenging course for beginners
reviews.comment_content: Content seems not so hard to understand, but better revise them for the lab classes and tests.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not boring, but not enough contents are taught to do the assignment and lab work.
reviews.comment_grading: Getting full marks in assignment is easy. The mean for both the tests are relatively low and SD is very high which means there are many students who are good at coding as well as beginners.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much work to do, but some lab work is difficult for beginners in coding. There is only one assignment to be completed. Enough time is given to complete the assignment. However, it is hard for beginners finish it by themselves. Need help from someone who knows well about coding.

reviews.author: Oswald
reviews.title: Fairly straightforward course
reviews.comment_content: Content is a little difficult to grasp so needs a bit of revising for exams. However, once doing a few practice problems it becomes a lot easier. Just do practice problems, I don't really understand how to do Java, just know how to answer the questions on exams.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor tries to make interesting but is actually quite boring. Skipped many of the classes.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is satisfactory, as long as you fairly understand content exam is not too hard.
reviews.comment_workload: Not that much workload, just make sure to know someone that knows java so you can copy his assignment.

reviews.author: Mkwing
reviews.title: don't take this if you have never learnt programming
reviews.comment_content:
- Teaching Java programming using Greenfoot (stupid software).
- Very basic knowledge of  programming. Easy if you have learnt programming before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very basic programming skills, you can learn them online at any time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Most of the students taking this course have learnt programming before (maybe because they think java is more useful than python and vba, but i think python is a very good programming language for beginner. it is actually a useful and powerful language as well), so, a lot of students got very high score, which means the score of A range is so high, probably that's why people said the grade of this course is so poor.
i got A with overall ~95.x%.
reviews.comment_workload: Basically the main workload are the labs and two assignments (separated from one program, so you can treat them as one assignment).

reviews.author: theappleme
reviews.comment_content:
Object Oriented Programming, Scope Rules, Boolean Expressions, Branching Statements, Loops, Array, File I/O, Recursion, Abstract Data Type, etc

You learn all this online by watching videos and doing exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching:
You're expected to go through the online videos and exercises before the week-long face-to-face meeting. During face-to-face meetings, the prof will review some of the online content then you'll do some in-class activities

the prof and TAs are helpful and patient. If you're stuck/have no idea what to do, then just ask and they'll give you hints and guide you
reviews.comment_grading:
It's ok, pretty fair

(I guess it was like absolute grading?)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok if you can manage your time well (aka spend most of your time on this course if you wanna do good) It's quite intensive since it's crammed to ~2 weeks, which means mid-term on the 1st week, then finals on the 2nd week, then you're "done" (after finishing your project) You have to go through the online materials to not get confused/lost during face-to-face meetings and especially in labs.

reviews.author: Kevin Pratama
reviews.comment_content:
The content covers basic, introductory Java programming language. If you're from CS background, you may find transitioning in this course not really hard.

The content itself isn't too demanding. But if you're a starter, it will take some time learning Greenfoot and Eclipse interface and setup.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good and friendly professor. Often crack some jokes during classes and always use examples with thorough explanation to teach concepts. Also willing to help students with their questions after classes
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is pretty fair. Got A-band grade. I didn't take any paper-check, so probably with paper-check, the instructors can give a higher grade. But the grading itself is very friendly.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not very much if you have a CS background. Introduction to Greenfoot, Eclipse and assignments can be rough for starters.
The assignment itself provides a skeleton code so you only need to input code inside the functions.

reviews.author: yyeugene
reviews.title: Not a good course for beginners
reviews.comment_content:
cover basic java concepts, including looping, arrays, greenfoot, a little bit about eclipse, data types

without programming background, it will be pretty hard. People in this class are doing well in programming
reviews.comment_teaching:
Poor teaching, lecture slides are bad
you dont really understand what the lectures slides are about unless you jot notes during lecture, thus skipping lectures are not recommended
sometimes out syl stuffs are included, but it helps u to understand the concepts better
reviews.comment_grading:
competitive, esp with engine students, mean is around 60-70 something
mid term is hard
final is a bit easier
reviews.comment_workload:
not much workload
labs are compulsory, or else you lose marks.
there is an assignment though, you submit the assignment before final, sufficient time to finish the assignment as long as you are actually doing it. takes around 6 hours to finish, of course it also depends whether you are good at programming. Do not copy the codes from your classmates as they said they have some machine to check your code

reviews.author: Lindadong
reviews.comment_content:
对于初学者还是挺不错的，讲的很详细ppt的内容也很多，很方便复习。
据说1022会简单一些不过不是很清楚。
reviews.comment_teaching: 教授人超级好，上lecture风趣幽默也乐于回答问题：）
reviews.comment_grading:
个人认为不是很好拿A+......
A range不清楚但是教授表示一般前50有A range......（301人的quota这样orz）
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload挺轻松的吧，不过也有可能是我选了两门Workload D 的课对比起来很轻松...
有openbook的midterm 和 final，每周的lab一定要去，有事情去不了可以提前跟TA说明。除此之外还有一个分成两个部分的Assessment，是做一个叫做mastermind的无聊小游戏，自己检查两边一般不会出什么问题。

reviews.author: Rise and shine
reviews.title: Very intensive, Not very hard, acceptable for beginners
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Java introduction:
Object orientated programming
Basic structure of object orientated programming
If else
Loops(for, do, while)
Arrays
2d array
Recurrsion
File I/O
Scanner class
Stack (abstract data type)

You should learn in the online system and go through all 10 modules before face to face meeting in just one week. The week of lectures and labs are very intensive and just a brief review. Therefore, if you do not work hard before hand, you would get stuck in labs and cannot finish in time.

I do not have programming background. However, only a logical mind as used in other areas like maths and science would be enough to solve the problems. It need a bit time to familiarize with the computer language though.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof's English is fair. Local Hong Kong accent. Prof and TA are very helpful. Just ask if you get stuck.
reviews.comment_grading:
It was said that A = 90%, B = 80%, C = 70%
10% online
10% project
15% midterm
45% final
10% in class activities
10% lab
reviews.comment_workload: Fair workload.

reviews.author: Tree0821
reviews.comment_content: Introduction course, when you get used to it , it will be very easy. There're so many students who are already good at writing code and usually get very high marks in exam. You can reach A range Inly when you perform excellently in your exam if the final exam is as easy as this time
reviews.comment_grading: There're so many students who are already good at writing code and usually get very high marks in exam. You can reach A range Inly when you perform excellently in your exam if the final exam is as easy as this time

reviews.author: TheOnlyRealMAX
reviews.title: 雖然幫不了你GPA太多，但還是要的
reviews.comment_content:
其實內容很窄。
其實學完了你也不敢跟別人說你會coding。
其實我現在也不能從零開始。
其實我現在還不是太能搞清楚個frame。

其實就是每次教幾個類似的command，讓你在task裡面運用一下。對初學者而言上手還是容易的。
可是如果是對coding有興趣的同學……這幾個command學了，也不過是零零散散的一些零件，組成不了一個大的對coding的理解。
我們不能期望學完了就能夠對coding有什麼深刻的體會，這個course真的不過是給了一個機會你去淺嘗輒止。但對於沒有任何背景的同學而言，還是要的。
噢，對了，考試考的很多都沒有怎麼重點教。
reviews.comment_teaching:
不太系統，蠻亂。

我在midterm之前都還完全不知道整個greenfoot的frame究竟是怎樣的。教了method之後竟然回頭來教基本的variables……跟string相關的在method之後才提及，還根本只說了個大概。

好吧，應該是我沒聽課。

不過我要說，wilfred這個人還是活潑的。說話稍微有抑揚頓挫，PPT有emoji和無意義的輔助圖片，用pad講課還是蠻先進的感覺。呃……這段是褒義的。
reviews.comment_grading:
84分 = B-
grade的組成不再贅述。
if（易讀！= 好grade）{
另外選一些好grade的course安撫你受傷的心吧；
}
reviews.comment_workload:
如果明白了，其實不難。
可是不開竅就……
就要大量時間舉手等tutor問問題，就要大量人情卡數R source和solution，就要大量時間在lab和assignment鉆牛角尖……

reviews.author: Ka Long Or
reviews.comment_content:
Indtroduce the basic knowledge of java..
If you are not going to take CS as major , don't take this course as it is time-consuming to learn java without the basic knowledge of coding.There are a lot of students taking this course with fundamental of even advanced knowledge of programming.The mean of this course is really high.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good.The instructor is enthusiastic for teaching.Always interact with students. The TAs are helpful and quickly respond to students 'question upload in canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Hard to get a good grade.
if you get higher than approximate 90% of total score ,you can get A range

reviews.author: lazerbeam
reviews.title: Easy if you have programming background
reviews.comment_content:
Basic programming concepts:
e.g. objects and classes, variables and scopes, branching, loops, recursion (only simple ones)

If you have programming backgrounds, you don't even need to learn them, just revise before the exams, and the exams are open note.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches quite well (although i only attended a few lectures), the slides used are also clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mean is high since the midterm and final are not difficult
Mt mean : 66, final mean: 78
I got 97/100 in midterm and full mark in final
Finally an A+.
Almost everyone gets full mark in assignment and lab class.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost no workload, only a programming assignment (2 parts), and for each part you have about one month to complete it.

Lab class every week, but simple content, and you can do it before the lab class, so you can leave in 15 minutes.

I only spent about 3-5 hours for each part. So the workload is extremely small for a 3-credit course.

reviews.author: Tim Poon
reviews.comment_content:
個course由Lab+lecture組成,lab主要係幫你實踐lecture教的concept,TA基本上會一步步教你做,所以基本上係你出現lab就滿分,全部lab都係做完就走得,通常都有得早走,甚麼你一早去course web page跟指引做好,上lab直接交,可以立刻閃人
midterm+final個人覺得較淺,基本鬥小心
reviews.comment_teaching: 我上Lecture基本無認真聽過,所以唔知好唔好,Midterm後無上lecture,note其實都好清晰,自修無咩難度
reviews.comment_grading:
據說是三個comp新手course最爛grade的,不過我讀了覺得還好,中學完全未學過ICT之類的
走左兩個lab,ass滿分,midterm高0.58SD, final高0.98SD
B+
reviews.comment_workload: 唔算大,一份ass做小游戲+midterm+final

reviews.author: TonyB
reviews.title: An interesting course to take
reviews.comment_content: The content is very interesting and gives a good overview of the java language, but the first weeks might be quite difficult to follow if you are entirely new to programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is well organised, but it is sometimes a little bit boring. The majority of the material is in the slides.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is curved, and the mean is usually pretty high. The difficulty of the exams may vary, the midterm was a bit difficult, but the final was very easy.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty light if you understand all the content. There is a coding assignment, but they give you 2 months to complete it.

reviews.author: bissjs
reviews.comment_content:
Basic contents about java programming including basic grammar of java language, branching statement, arrays and file I/O.
The level of content is adequate for introduction course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture is helpful, but I think studying presentation file is enough.
Lab session is worth taking.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendence of lab 10%
Assignment 20%
Midterm 30%
Final 40%
Too many people got a high score so should get almost full mark to get A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload.
Assignment is writing a code of board game which is based on greenfoot.
There were two parts of assignment which is easy if you follow the lab and understand the contents.

reviews.author: Steve(Min Kyu)
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Java stuff.

Starts off easy but gets harder as you go on.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very easy to understand and clear to follow.

The lab TA's are a lot more boring but most of the lab contents should be easy to follow if you read the lab instructions.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got a 90 Final, 100 assignment 0.5sd above mean Midterm and ended up with a B+.

A lot of java experts take this class and gets a 100 in everything so it is very hard to get an A range in this class.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 lab almost every week.

The labs in the beginning is a joke and only takes about 5 to 10 minutes.

However, it does get harder later on but still manageable.

reviews.author: dmkl
reviews.comment_content: the content is enough, before the midterm, all knowledge is easy to understand and basic, after the midterm, some topic is difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching skill, and gives many extra ppt.
reviews.comment_grading: Not good grade, even I have previous knowledge of JAVA, I still get a C+, since many people get 90%+ of their score. In this course, the logic is much much important than the programming skill, especially the nest for loop.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is at the right level, only do lab exercise, some lab is difficult but some lab is very easy.
1 personal assignment, not take too much time.
1 Exam mostly get 80%.

reviews.author: Hafi
reviews.comment_content: If you have a little bit experience in programming, this course will not be too difficult for you. Both the mid-term and final exam is 'open notes', so nothing is needed to remember except bring your notes to attend the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good professor. The lesson always full of joy and the pace is acceptable. Lecture video is provided so it is easy to catch up even missed some classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of this course is totally a sh_t. Don't expect you can get a very good grade if you are not an expert in programming.
The general assessment (100%):
-Laboratories (10%)
-Programming assignments (20%)
-Midterm examination (30%)
-Final exam (40%)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is light. Just two assignment (a single programme divided into two parts) involving the codes taught in the lecture and the lab. However, most of the time you need to search the syntax online.

reviews.author: tanay
reviews.comment_content: It covers basics of java using Greenfoot, which is a very basic and graphic platform. It starts off with introduction to the platform which make take a little time to understand. Then they focus on introducing the language and how it works. The content covered according to me isn't hard at all if you know it or have done any programming language in your life. But if you're a newbie, better take a rain check or do an online course beforehand, because it becomes too much work load. To be honest, if you want a major in CS in the future, this course is the tip of the ice-berg so you should be fine with the content or else its going to be a major problem in the future courses
reviews.comment_teaching: I didn't attend many lectures as I had already covered most of what was being taught but whenever I went to class, I was never bored because Prof Wilfred uses good examples and supplementary slides. He also does those Harvard's CS50 style small giveaways in the beginning so its fun if you keep your eyes open.
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A+, but it is very difficult as I had few of my friends missing out majorly on the A range due to small errors that they did in the exams. Also, the exams are very tricky and you need to have preparations and know your concepts beforehand. Also, I the margin of error is pretty small and the grading the way it should be for a course this big and with so many people.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload according to me was okay, mostly because the labs were easy for me and also the project. AGAIN, if you're a newbie, its going to be major issue so keep that in mind and take out time in the beginning to get the work. Always prepare for the labs and finish them before the actual labs.

reviews.author: huxing
reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment_content: Basic programming concepts. Extremely interesting for people with no knowledge in programming before, but it would be boring for more experienced learners. I would say it's a great introductory course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wilfred's teaching is thorough, but I find it a little too slow. Working through the slide off class by yourself instead of taking lectures would be more a more efficient use of time.

TAs are very helpful, kudos to them.
reviews.comment_grading: You need to get almost full marks to get A+, since the exams are quite easy, and many students are familiar with this stuff even before taking the course.
reviews.comment_workload: Next to null. Assignment would take ~ a week, but other than that, it's only understanding the concepts that you have to work through.

reviews.author: MEMENTO
reviews.comment_content: The content is about basic java concepts. It covers learning about basic data types such as int, boolean, String, etc. Simple if-else statements, recursion, while/for loops, and basic concepts about OOP such as inheritance, instance variable, static variable is included as well. If you previously learned OOP before, this course will be easy. If not, I recommend you to stay focused during the lecture and spend some time self-studying.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Muppala's lecturing pace was appropriate to me. He uses humor while he is lecturing, and I enjoyed his lecture. All of his lecture is based on his PPT, so it is better to review PPT after the lecture to have better understanding of the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is rather generous on scale of 100, because you can easily get full points from the assignments and lab, which count 30% of the total grade together. However, since this is graded with relative evaluation, I recommend you to spend some time studying even though you get good grades based on the lab/assignment.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not heavy at all, because most students finish lab during the lab section, and more than a month is given to you to complete the assignments.

reviews.author: danny boy
reviews.title: May the luck be with you
reviews.comment_content: Intro to Java, mainly through Greenfoot and Eclipse in the latter part. As a programming idiot I can still feel it is really just an intro course (even I still find it really hard). Learning the basic syntax in lectures, take them into use in labs and assignments, and good luck in exams. Things learn in the notes are just basic knowledge and the course is requires more in understanding and logical thinking to be demonstrated through tasks and exams. As an idiot I found a lot of new things to be learnt in the course (but broken grade); or you are a genius who is not going to learn anything from it (they are those who should take this course for the grades ;( )
reviews.comment_teaching:
The prof is pretty funny, you are not going to fall asleep in the class if you don't find it difficult to understand his accent. He and the TAs are always willing and able to answer your questions after class, in lab and on canvas, and of great effectiveness. But again, some have fairly heavy accent, both in Cantonese and English (No prob if you are good in Indian or Mandarin), which is the only problem i can think of.
(Even though I absolutely gave up the course in around Nov and did not attend a single lecture or watch them back)
reviews.comment_grading:
10% lab attendance (everyone should get it)
20% assignments (should get most if not all if you try just a little bit of bonus as buffer)
30% midterm
40% final

As mentioned in the other previous reviews here, above 1 sd is B range, and 1.1 about A. And as previous years, mean is somewhere high in the 70s; +1 sd is high 80s ~  mid 90s, and you know the rest.
So if you know nothing about Java, and can't get full marks due to carelessness, choose another course and don't be like me. One TA was absolute sympathetic and surprised at me that I picked this course when I have no idea about Java (He said I'm so 'chur' but I'm just an idiot who has no idea what (s)he is doing)
Luckily it seems the final paper will be set according to the midterm result (which is absolute horrendous and is like 10 marks lower than previous years), the final was much easier than the previous years and the mean is like 10 marks higher (which is not a good thing as +1 sd is like mid 90s, and +1.1 is [no one cares/gets] )
reviews.comment_workload:
lab: 1 session per week with all lab tasks already on the web. There are always people who done it before the lab and go away before you can see the desktop on Win 10.
assignment: 2 parts due in early and late Nov, live demo required; bonus part as a buffer in case you lose some marks in the main parts

You can pretty much generate (copy) everything from the lecture notes for your lab tasks and assignments, and even exams as they are open notes. (If you understand the syntax well. And yes, from a programming idiot prospective)
You can do your lab tasks before hand and show them to the TA if you do not waste your time. Or if you are an idiot like me, you can get the answer and attendance after sitting through a whole 2 hrs in the lab.
Assignment is to make a mastermind (with a twist, ask the TA you are curious if you are not a cat). It is separate into 2 parts just to relieve your workload. First part is fairly straight forward (copy from notes cough cough) while the second part requires more logical thinking and understanding on syntax. It can be fairly time consuming if you get stuck, and the TA will NOT offer any help out of fairness. I do it on my laptop on my long journey to/from the serene UST such that I didn't find it really costing me much time. It will not be that time consuming if you do the task over a long period of time. Don't do it in the last minute or you could be thinking of mushroom when you are stuck.

reviews.author: Sakamoto
reviews.title: So many experts! So you gotta work hard to achieve nothing!
reviews.comment_content: Though there are some inappropriate arrangement in the order of slides, the content are all quite useful actually. And the attached slides give you better understanding of the lectures, which is also suitable for "experts".
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred is such a enthusiastic teacher that he always try to warm up the class. Therefore we got a lot of fun during the class(even at that time I'm always starving). And the TAs are the most efficient ones I've ever met. Thanks!
reviews.comment_grading:
Well...here's the bad words!
I understand there are experts.
But there are experts every year!
I got 93.7% overall(the rule: 30%midterm, 40%final, 20%assignment, 10% lab)
And I got an A-!
WTF????
Since there are so many experts.
Why the final exam is so easy that everyone seems to score the same?
reviews.comment_workload:
I have to say it's not easy...The lectures take some time to digest. And the assignment is challenging and time-consuming.
So good luck.

reviews.author: Sunny0516
reviews.title: I suggest taking COMP1021 instead.
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to Java Programming.

The course covered some syntax for Java, and basic concepts for programming such as variables, looping, branching, array.

The content is nowhere near to be simple for beginners. If you don't have programming background, i suggest you should take COMP1021 instead. Or else you will regret about it.



這科是教Java Programming的基礎知識。
他們教了我們Java的語法，以及一些編程的基本概念(例如 variable, looping, branching, array)。
實際上這科並不適合沒有編程背景的人修讀。如果你沒有編程背景，強烈建議你去讀COMP1021，否則你會後悔！
reviews.comment_teaching:
The tutor is great.

He occasionally makes some jokes during lessons, and can explain all the concepts clearly. He will also discuss some examples with us to help us to understand all important concepts.

We have sufficient time to finish the entire syllabus before final exams. Some lessons were even reserved for midterm / final review.



這個老師教得很好。
上課間中會說笑話來讓我們有興趣繼續上堂，而他也能清晰地講解全部概念，上課時也會跟我們討論一些題目來讓我們鞏固知識。
我們在final前有足夠時間完成全部課題，還有時間與我們在課上溫習。
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab (10%) - Nearly everyone got full mark / 接近每人也滿分
Assignment (20%) - Nearly everyone got full mark / 接近每人也滿分
Midterm (30%) - Mean 66.08 / SD 20.39
Final Exam (40%) - Mean 78.51 / SD 17.79

The final grade will not look great. I got 95.5% (midterm and final both above 1 SD) and only have A. I also heard 91% don't even have A-.

最後的grade不會很好。我最後95.5%(midterm與final都高1 SD)但只有A。我也聽說91%亦沒有A-。
reviews.comment_workload:
Only a lab once a week (they will teach you if you don't know how to finish it) and an assignment (2 parts + 1 optional bonus part)



每星期有一個lab (你不慬的話他們會教你做) 以及一份功課。

reviews.author: Jacky159159
reviews.title: 最垃圾COMP1字頭
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting, for a computer idiot, it is a really fun course. You can learn java lang from 0 to you can write some simple code for specific purpose. Maze, chest game, master mind etc, if you are eroll for interest, it's a nice course for you, on the other hand, if you for a good grade, please click to the homepage.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ng is a nice teacher, he is very heart to teach, but not for exam. He will use many extra examples to tell you what is it doing and the reason behind. Unfortunately, he always talk a lot of "Out Syllbus". it's easily to mess up.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is the shitty one.
most of the people compare with comp q, 1021 and comp p. i can tell you comp p has a worst grading system.
10% LAB
20% ASM
30% MT
40%FINAL

For COM Q and 1021, they have MAX(mt+final, all in final)
For COM P, you can only eat shit

FOR COM Q mean is around B-
FOR COM P mean is around the lowest C+

in my semester,
MT mean 65 SD 20
FINAL mean 77 SD17
usually the MT and FINAL mean should be 80%, this year, they make ot harder and mean had a little bit lower.
Overall mean ~ 78% SD ~14

simple math mean+1SD=92%
mean+0.5SD=85%

in here, i got B with 88%<-wtf +0.5sd B
my FDs got
B+ in 91%, <- wtf +0.9sd B+
C- in 71%
C in 76% <-wtf mean-2 =C
A in 95% &96%
none of us get A+


this course is fun, however, the grade make this course become a shit.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is fair fair, one lab per week, you can finish it easily. if you understand the lecture. ASM sperate 2 part and each part have 1 month for doing. so it's not a big deal for most of the people

reviews.author: Ares
reviews.comment_content:
屌
唔撚好提
reviews.comment_teaching: Professors and TAs were quite nice and responsive. Though, their accent are quite strong, which international students might have problem focusing during the lectures at the beginning.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
10% Laboratories
20% Programming Assignment
30% Midterm examination
40% Final Exam

It was really hard to reach A range. Don't take this course unless you have a computing background and/or confident in your programming skill. Having said that, if you have strong interest in computing and willing to spend a significant amount of time into this course...




SORRY, YOU WILL STILL FAIL. GGWP
reviews.comment_workload: Easy 10% for labs. Same for the assignment. Yet, students were expected to spend a day or two in order to finish the whole assignment. You could get bonus marks from the assignment, so even if students lost some marks somewhere, it was easy to get the marks back. There is not any project or quiz other than labs and the assignments. Therefore, students have to be self-motivated in order to learn.

reviews.author: cl000
reviews.comment_content:
it's hard AF! basically it started off real easy with very simple coding then it hits you right before mid term with all these difficult java shenanigans.. i have to say this is more than a intro course. if someone took this course and totally understand everything, you can trust him with his java proficiency.
i would say... the content is very abundant, if you have a passion for java then this course is for you
reviews.comment_teaching: he's a very friendly and nice professor. always tries to make jokes here and there which i appreciate. but i can probably understand the material better if he explains a bit more clearer
reviews.comment_grading: not too shabby! if you go to all the labs and study for the exams, there is a high chance you will pass. however, despite it being a intro course, most students in this class are already very proficient in programming before the first day, so the curve is not very fair for us, who are truly intro students.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is relatively high: weekly labs, midterm, finals and a very difficult piece of assignment to be handed in at the end of the semester.

reviews.author: cheese
reviews.title: Everyone is an expert. They are joining this course to kill your grade. 所有人都係專家，佢地係黎屈你機
reviews.comment_content:
At first you may naively think that this is an introductory course, so everyone without programming knowledge will handle it easily. But you are wrong, totally WRONG. Yup, the content before midterm may be able to handle but it turns out to be difficult to understand when the topic like String console or recursion are taught. You can see there may be someone commenting that this course is easy. TRUST me, they have learned it before. It is totally unfair to put those experts learning together with programming newbies.
For those who don't have background knowledge, our only function is to help the experts to get a high grade.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wilfred is a good teacher and he taught everything in an interesting way.
But, I got my brain tons of questions and even headache and eventually I confirmed that I learned nothing. Asking for clarification has no use because it turns out that you will get a headache again when you face a new situation.

Those experts always love to challenge the teachers and show off. And I even don't know what they are trying to argue.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is expected to be unfair if you have not learned Java before.
Seriously, those experts getting more than 80% still get a B range.
And I was below mean ...in mid term.

UNFAIR GRADING.

If this is a course like PHYS1111/1112 or MATH1012/1013 that divide different background of students. The grading will be fairer.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only one assignment.
To create a mastermind game.
Believe me, this won't be easy as sometimes you need to think of different situations and write corresponding code to fulfill the instruction.
The teacher has never taught us or mentioned about the assignment.
Still, those experts got full marks,easily and finished it in one night.

reviews.author: Sillynoob
reviews.title: Not recommended for students without ICT background in DSE
reviews.comment_content:
The content is not really suitable for students without programming knowledge
The powerpoint does not provide enough explanation on the codes
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very humorous, if you arrive early he'll show funny videos on youtube
He can use different daily life example to illustrate programming concept such as variables and array.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is not as good as COMP1021 and COMP1022Q
Most students in this course are aiming for CS major and have some programming knowledge.
If you just want to fulfil SENG or common core requirement, I won't recommend this course
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is moderate
The lab assignment can be done prior the lab section
The lab work is not easy as it does not give any hint unlike other COMP 1000-level courses
The assignment is Chinese Jungle Chess, which requires all the concepts learnt before. Some tasks are not easy.
Exam is easy as it is open notes exam. No need to study

reviews.comment_content: Relatively Easy I'd say. Those things you can learn by yourself.

reviews.author: 別問我是誰
reviews.comment_content:
入門級 COMP course (102X 系列其中較少人鍾意讀既 course, 多數人讀 1022Q Excel&VBA)，亦係 engine/science school requirement 之一。

內容關於 variables, arrays, conditions, loops, recursion (後期重點)，完全無提及較複雜既 OO。MT Final 有足夠長時間比無programming底既人思考同作答。
reviews.comment_grading:
COMP 102X 系列既3個courses 都好好 grade, 一般黎講 above mean 少少就 B range, 9字頭都肯定 A/A+ 硬。

另外有個project, 個 grading scheme 預留左好多分做 bonus，即使某d required function 寫衰左都可以用 bonus 去搭救上番滿分。
reviews.comment_workload: 呢個 course 既 lab 要上足, 每次lab都要demo一次比helper睇去take attendance (計分)，無得事前／事後網上交。

reviews.author: Justin12345
reviews.comment_content:
Covers basic Java programming.
Include topics such as
1.Data types
2.Variables
3.Classes and Objects
4.Conditional statements and Loops
5.Arrays
6.Recursion
There is one written assignment and two programming assignments throughout the semester. And also a mandatory lab session every week.
There are two lectures every week which attendance will not be taken.

In the first few weeks, Greenfoot is used to introduce basic programming concepts, and will be switched to Eclipse later on.

The assignments and tasks should be easy to you if you have some knowledge about programming.
However, at least half of the class are experts in programming, which may make the grading of the course quite competitive. I recommend you to self-study Java before taking this course if you have absolutely no knowledge about programming.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The pace of teaching in lectures are a bit too slow, which may make the lectures to be boring.
The use of Greenfoot may seem very childish and I don't think it can facilitate your learning.
The lab TAs are very kind to answer your questions and helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
Laboratories (10%)
Written assignments (5%)
Programming assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (25%)
Final exam (40%)

My score:
Laboratories: Full mark in all labs
Written assignments: 46/50
Programming assignments: 100/100 (Part 1) + 100/100 (Part 2)
Midterm: 93/100
Final: 98/100
Total: 97.05/100
Got an A at last.

Most of the people probably can get full marks in the lab sessions as the TAs will provide help.
The grading is quite insane in my opinion. The mean in final is 88.0 and the SD is 13.8. You basically need to be perfect and cannot get anything wrong in order to get an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
The lab session every week is quite easy, it won't take too long to complete the tasks (5-30 mins).

The written task is also easy (typical programming problems) which wont't take too much time as well.

There are lots of tasks in the programming assignment and it may take sometime to complete both parts(~1hr). However, you are given a month to complete it so it shouldn't be a problem.

reviews.author: kcliu
reviews.comment_content: Some very basic programming concept and Java language syntax. Not very difficult but a little bit boring. This course uses Greenfoot as an introduction to programming.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Most of the content in the lecture is the same as PPT.
You would still understand even if you missed some of the lectures.
There was one lab a week. You can leave earlier if you finished all the lab assignment.
reviews.comment_grading:
Many people are really good at programming and very careful so many of them have received full mark in all assignment, test and exam. Be careful!
There are some weird questions like i = i++, from the past exam papers. Spend some time on them.

Lab (10%)
Written assignments (5%)
Programming assignments (20%)
Midterm examination (25%)
Final exam (40%)

I got 97 out of 100 at the end but still get an A only. Not a good grade class.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only need to spend some time on written assignment and programming assignment. TA will give help if you stuck with the tasks in labs.
Mid term and exam are easy to pass but difficult to get high mark. Just spend some time on the past papers.

reviews.author: TiffanyRJQ
reviews.comment_content: An introductory level programming courses about java. I do not have any programming backgrounds and I think I made a wise decision by taking the course in the spring semester. It is less competitive and the instructor is so nice.
reviews.comment_teaching: I truly recommend the instructor. Desmond is one of the few teachers in university who devotes a lot into teaching. He is helpful and often gives relevant advice on learning.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is so great. Desmond is a good guy!
The majority are A and B ranges.
I got 93.97% in total and got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok. There were two programming assignments. Both info sessions were offered and as long as you have grasped the basic concepts in the lectures, it wont be a problem.

reviews.author: whs
reviews.title: Boring course but LEGENDARY PROFESSOR
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Java syntax and Object-oriented thinking.
1. Basic data types, variables, assignment statements, console I/O 2. Arithmetic expressions, Boolean expressions
3. Checking & selection statements, looping statements
4. Arrays
5. Classes and objects, properties and methods 6. Inheritance
7. Static variables and methods
8. Primitive types and reference types
9. Scope rules
10. Recursion
11. File I/O
12. String manipulations
13. Abstract data types (stack and queue)
reviews.comment_teaching: LEGEND. He teaches very well and explains stuff extensively with an interesting approach. If you send email and asks him stuff, he will reply in under an hour or so. Provides past paper and extra practices. Honestly BEST PROFESSOR IN UST
reviews.comment_grading:
28% A range

10% Lab
20% Assignment (two in total)
30% Midterm
40% Final

Exams are very very difficult so be prepared. Go through past papers Desmond provides because some questions are similar.

Lab: 100/100
Assignment 100/100
Midterm: 90/100 (Mean & Median: 62.25; Standard deviation: 17.26)
Final: 79/100 (Mean: 52.37; Median: 55.63; Standard deviation: 19.50)
Grade: A+
(i personally never learnt any programming at all)
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab is relatively easy, you can do everything beforehand. Most tasks are relatively short.

Assignments are much harder so you may need to discuss with some course-mates and help each other. Most take a lot of time to think through and finish so word of advice is start right after the assignment is released and not a few days before deadline. Desmond is very helpful and if u send him an email he will try his best to help you with the assignment.

reviews.comment_content:

reviews.comment_teaching: 教学是良好的。教授正在努力营造良好的气氛。
reviews.comment_grading: 大多数学生可以得到一个非常高的分数。所以这门课并不需要你去理解材料，而是需要你做到完美。我也不认为以这门课的成绩作为2012H的前提条件是一个好主意。
reviews.comment_workload:
对于真正的初学者来说，工作量适中。
任务是对基本内容的基本应用。如果你知道如何在网上解决常见的编程问题，我认为这对编程学习者来说是必要的。
这门课程将不会很难，也不会花费你太多的时间。
